loans.name: Magdalena Rocio

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena Rocio tiene la edad de 49 años, estudio solo la secundaria, es vuida y tuvo dos hijos una mujer y un hombre los cuales ya estan casados y actualmente vive solita.
Doña Magdalena nos platica que ella siempre ha trabajado ya que le gusta ser una mujer muy activa y desde que vivia su esposo hace aproximadamente 8 años. Ella por las tardes vende chicharrones y rebanadas de sandia para ganar un poco de dinero extra con el tiempo inicio a vender un poco de abarrotes en el corredor de su casa y poco a poco como tuvo buena venta construyo un pequeño local en el frente de su casa en el cual continuo con su venta de abarrotes y llamo a su negocio "abarrotes Britani" y al fallecer su esposo no se quedo desprotegida ya que tenia un negocio con el cual salir adelante y a continuando trabajando en el.
Ella necesita este credito para invertir en la compra de leche, arroz, frijol, azucar, refresco, sal, galletas, dulces, cafe, queso, crema, jabon, cloro, detergente, papel de baño, producto enlatados, tomates, chiles y cebollas para resurtir su negocio. Ella nos dice que si negocio continua creciendo casa dia mas y que siempre le gusta tener el negocio muy surtido para brindar un servicio a sus clientes.

Ella se encuentra muy agradecida por la confianza que le da la Fundacion.
texts.en:
Magdalena Rocio is 49 years old.  In school, she only went as far as junior high.  She is a widow and has two children, a boy and a girl; both already married. Currently she lives alone.  

Magdalena tells us that she has always worked, since she likes to keep busy, especially since her husband died around 8 years ago.  In the afternoons she sold chicharrones (pork rinds) and slices of watermelon to earn a bit of extra money. Eventually, she began to sell a few groceries in the hallway of her home. Gradually, as sales were good, she built a small store in front of her house, where she continued selling groceries. She called her business "Abarrotes Britani" (Britani Groceries), and when her husband died, she wasn't left unprotected since she had a business to work in, that could enable her to get ahead in life.  

She needs this loan to buy milk, rice, beans, sugar, soft drinks, salt, cookies, candy, coffee, cheese, cream, soap, bleach, toilet paper, canned goods, tomatoes, chiles, and onions in order to re-stock her business.  She says that her business keeps growing every day and that she likes to keep it well-stocked in order to serve her customers.  She is very thankful for the confidence Fundación gives her.

loans.use: To sell groceries

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Bienestar y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos de 20, 19, 18 y 13 años de edad, todos viven en su casa la menor de ellos  estudian en colegio. Su marido es chofer profesional.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse algo propio y con esto ir mejorando su casa, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, dos días por semana recorre por toda la ciudad realizando sus ventas y cobros ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil y Huaquillas cada vez que necesite. Tiene seis años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal 6 años  y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. 

Sus sueños es tener su casa con todas las comodidades.
texts.en:
The Bienestar y Progreso Comunal Bank meets every fifteen days in Colorado in Montecristi canton, which is well known nationally and international for its rich pre-colonial culture and handicrafts. It is the place of famous straw hats.

Here we meet Sra. María, who is 39, married and has 4 children, 20, 19, 18 and 13 years of age. All live at home and the youngest attends school. Her husband is a professional chauffeur 

In order to earn something of her own and continue improving her house, our friend sells clothing of all kinds. She sells door to door two days a week, covering the entire town making sales and collecting payments since she provides credit and collects every fifteen days. She also sells from her house, where customers she knows well come. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil and in Huaquillas whenever she needs to. She has been running this business for six years and it has gone well.

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, T-shirts and children’s clothes. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for 6 years and she likes it very much since her first loan enabled her to start her business.

Her dream is to provide her house with all the amenities.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza, 43, is a married woman with four children, of whom three are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Analiza has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Analiza requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Analiza has been in this business for five years. In the future, Analiza would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Jhenny

texts.es: Jhenny, de 22 años es una mujer trabajadora. Ella está casa desde hace 2 años, producto de su amor nació su hijo Kelvin al que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cayan. La lucha por su familia es su principal virtud. Desde que se casó comenzó a producir sus terrenos de cultivo, en los cuales esparce las semillas de papa de toda variedad y calidad. Pues según cuenta, todas las mañanas sale a cuidar y limpiar sus sembríos, los que cosecha después de muchos meses de trabajo. Ya tiene 3 años de experiencia en el rubro y lo que más le gusta es poder ver como crecen los alimentos poco a poco. Más le disgusta tener que abaratar el precio de venta de sus cosechas en el mercado. Pero como ella es una mujer inteligente, genera otros ingresos económicos, como el cuidado de los toros y vacas que posee. Según cuenta ahora una de sus vacas está preñada por lo que muy pronto tendrá leche suficiente para realizar lo ricos quesos, que solo ella sabe preparar. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Progreso Cayan” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Jhenny, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para mejorar sus plantaciones de papa de la variedad “yungay”.
texts.en: Jhenny, 22, is a hardworking woman.  She has been married for 2 years, and from this marriage has a son, Kelvin, who she cares for in her own home in the rural Cayan settlement.  The struggle to provide for her family is her main virtue.  From the time she was married, she began to cultivate her lands, scattering potato seeds of every variety and quality.  According to her, every morning she goes out to care for and clear her croplands; she harvests her crops after many months of work.  She now has 3 years of experience in farming, and what she likes the most is to be able to see her crops grow little by little.  What she dislikes is when she has to cut the price of her products in the market.  But, as she is an intelligent woman, she finds other ways to generate income, such as caring for the bulls and cows that she has.  According to her, now one of her cows is pregnant, so very soon she will have enough milk to make the rich cheeses that only she knows how to prepare.  She belongs to the communal bank "Progreso Cayan" and this is her first loan with MFP, where she awaits the support of all of you so that she can continue to realize her goals.  In addition, she promises to be on time with her payments.  Jhenny, once she receives this support, will invest the money in the purchase of organic fertilizers to improve her cultivations of "Yungay" variety potatoes.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Maytham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and five children.

Maytham has been the owner of a food market since 2009.  He sells soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products.  He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs.  His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by his shop. 

He is requesting a $2400 loan to renovate his market and to add more foodstuffs.  He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his market and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Yaritza Yurie

texts.es:
Doña Yaritza, sigue creciendo en inventario, en su negocio como pulperia, ahora ah aumentado la venta de frutas y verduras, pues lleva varios años apoyando a su esposo en los gastos basicos del hogar, al obtener mejores ganancias, ya que el, no tiene un trabajo fijo, solo trabaja por contrato, sus dos pequeños siguen cursando el año escolar, el  menor ha estado un poco mal de salud, lo que ha tenido mas gastos al comprar medicina.
Atraves de estos financiamientos, ha logrado, la construcion de su porche, construccion de baños higienicos, y aumento de mercaderia para su pulperia. Con este nuevo prestamos sera para invertir en granos basicos como: arroz, frijoles, azucar, caja de jabon de lavar, bidon de aceite, productos de uso personal, productos lacteos, carne, pollo, gaseosa, siendo estos los mas demandado por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yaritza continues adding inventory to her grocery store. Now she is expanding the fruit and vegetable section. It has taken some years to increase earnings with her husband helping in the basic household expenses. He does not have a steady job since he is a contract worker. Her two young children continue their course of studies with the youngest having been in bad health, which has meant more expenses in order to buy medicine.

Through the loans they have received they have built a porch and a sanitary bathroom, and they have added merchandise to their store. With this new loan she will buy basic grains such as rice, beans, sugar, boxes of soap, a large container of oil, personal care products, dairy products, meat, chicken, and soda as these are the items that are most requested by their customers.

loans.use: to buy various products for her business which are requested by her clients which will help her maintain good sales performance

loans.name: Reme Group

texts.fr:
Marie Rose est une commerçante âgée de 43ans qui habite  la localité de Gitongo de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle fait le commerce de manioc sec depuis 25 ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 5e année primaire. Elle est mariée  a Michel qui est lui aussi vendeur de bananes et ont ensemble 8  enfants qui étudient.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 160,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de manioc sec à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« REME»
texts.en:
Marie Rose is a 43-year old trader who lives in the town of Gitongo in the Gitega province, which lies in the centre of the country. She has been trading in dry cassava for the past 25 years and is also a farmer. She went to school up until the 5th grade of primary school. She is married to Michel, who sells bananas, and they have eight children who are all studying.

The Kiva loan of 160,000 burundi francs which she will be granted will allow her to increase her capital so that she can buy large quantities of dry cassava and resell it at a large profit.

Marie Rose is a member of the Reme community group.

loans.use: to increase her capital in order to buy large quantities of dry cassava for resale and to make significant profits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase kerosene, gasoline, mobile phone recharges, soap, cooking oil, flour, sugar, brooms, and medicine

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 36-year-old businessman. He is married to Jane, who is a business lady. They are blessed with two children, aged 9 and 7 years respectively. He has been running a hardware shop for the past 10 years with the monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Stephen will use the loan to buy vehicle spare parts to add to his stock. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy vehicle spare parts to add to his stock.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is planting rice crops on her one-hectare rice field. She is 56 years of age and married with six children. Margarita is a hardworking and responsible woman. She and her husband devote their time to performing some farming activities to minimize their expenses in hiring laborers. 

Margarita said that having a large number of family members means they need greater profits to sustain all their needs. In this regard, she would like to increase her rice production so that she could earn a bigger income. Margarita is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to be used in buying certified seeds, insecticides, herbicides and other farm supplies needed in the plant care of her crops. She believes that this loan will help her in satisfying the needs of her family and improving their lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds, insecticides, herbicides and other farm supplies needed in the plant care of her crop

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
As the picture shows, 32-year-old Godwin makes ends meet from brick-laying and sales. Godwin, who is happily married with 3 children, had 3 years of experience in this field.

Across the country, there has been a construction boom and businesses like Godwin's have benefited.

Godwin's business interests are not limited to brick laying and sales; he also ekes out auxiliary income from agriculture. His weekly gross sales total up to UGX 40,000. Despite this paltry amount, he remains upbeat about his future prospects. 

Godwin lays great store on family-related responsibilities.  Despite his minimal income, he has strained every nerve to ensure that he gives his children an education and significantly improves his family's welfare.

Casting his mind to the future, Godwin says he owes it to himself to elevate the standards of living of his family.  He hopes to build a house for the family.  He says this will all come to pass once his business makes the inroads that he expects as a result of this loan. He plans to use his Kiva loan to purchase more land where he can carry out his business. He says with more land, he will be able to make more bricks.

loans.use: to purchase more land where he can make more bricks.

loans.name: Nurys

texts.es: En la época mas linda para las familias colombianas, como la  navidad y el año nuevo, Nurys  siempre ha vendido a sus clientes accesorios domésticos navideños,  detalles para el hogar y fantasía femenina;  desde hace 15 años cuando inició su miscelánea, ella  adorna sus instalaciones, con la mercancía de cada época para llamar la atención de sus clientes,  que la conocen y con quienes sostiene una relación comercial, porque les vende a crédito y de contado diariamente.  Al iniciar su negocio lo hizo vendiendo artículos de modistería,  como hilos, botones correderas etc., cuando este fue creciendo,  agregó muchas otras mercancías,  que hoy aun vente, y con las que ha logrado estabilizar sus ventas hasta convertirla en una unidad productiva  con un gran potencial de crecimiento. Su espíritu emprendedor la ha guiado siempre, pues  logró  acceder a códigos de empresas,  a quienes les vende sus productos, mediante guía  especializada o catálogo y usualmente compra las mercancías que la revista trae en descuento,  para que sus clientes sientan las bondades de su oferta. Con su negocio ha logrado el bienestar de su hogar y ahorrar en su fondo de pensiones,  el que muy pronto la acreditara  como una jubilada más,  y pagaran su salario . Su sueño de crecimiento es imparable y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará mercancías variadas,  como ropa, artículos de aseo y  accesorios navideños. Con ello planea incrementar sus ventas y generar un poco mas de utilidades, pues aplicara su credikiva como un capital adicional que la llevará a esta meta.
texts.en:
Nurys has traditionally sold Christmas home accessories and miscellany during the Christmas and New Year holiday season so loved by Colombian families.  For fifteen years, she has decorated and created displays in the style of every era to attract her clients' attention.  Her customers know Nurys personally, and they are able to buy merchandise on credit or using cash.

She began by selling dressmaking supplies such as threads, buttons, etc.  As business grew, she added many other goods, which she still sells today, and through which she has managed to establish a profitable business with large growth potential.  Her entrepreneurial spirit has always guided her and afforded her access to businesses, to whom she sells her products through a specialized guide or catalog. She usually buys goods at a discount, passing on the benefit to her clients.


Through her business, she has achieved stability and wellbeing in her home.  She has managed to save toward her pension, which she will soon need as a new retiree.  Her dream is unlimited growth.  She comes to Kiva partner The Mario Santo Domingo Foundation for financing in order to purchase various goods such as clothing, toiletries and Christmas accessories.  She plans to increase her sales and generate more income, applying loan funding as additional capital to reach her goal.

loans.use: buy various goods such as clothing, toiletries and Christmas accessories.

loans.name: Adama S

texts.en:
This is 32 year old Adama S. She is married to a carpenter, his monthly income is Le1,000,000, and they have four children aged 17, 13, 11 and 6 years who are all school-going children. 

In 2007, Adama established her utensil and household items business. She began her business because her parents did not allow her to go to school. Instead, she was given out for marriage at an early age. Her husband trained her in the business, since she did not learn any trade from her parents.

Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 1,912,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Adama has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy pans, hot pots, drinking buckets, and dishes. The balance of the loan is for transportation costs.

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 478,000. In the future, Adama plans to build a larger outlet to display her goods; she is excited about the future as she wants her children to have a good education and a good standard of living. 

Rainy season is a major problem and also changes in foreign exchange rate are a problem. Competition is low as she is the only one dealing in that product. Adama serves people around the city and neighboring villages. She has good quality goods at an affordable price. Her suppliers are located in Conakry and in Freetown, where she usually goes two times per month by vehicle. She is hard working and honest. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy pans, dishes, and buckets

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy products for her store.

loans.name: Dalberto Bayron

texts.es:
Dalberto Bayron tiene 22 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la mamá y hermano en el cantón ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Dalberto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, urea, abonos, líquidos, Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los abonos agrícolas.

El sueño es comprarse una casa. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota en el barrio. Los desafíos que se le han presentado son la falta de agua a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Dalberto Bayron is 22 years old, single and has no children. He lives with his mom and brother in the Ventanas Cnton of the Los Ríos province. He is a member of the La Unión [Union] communal bank, located in the Aguas Frías region belonging to the Ventanas canton. This bank is dedicated to short cycle agricultural labors, planting corn, rice and beans. 

Dalberto is dedicated to farming corn and rice. He makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas. He is seeking the loan in order to purchase chemical and natural fertilizers, urea and liquids. With the loan's help he will be able to purchase fertilizers for farming. 

His dream is to purchase a house. In his free time he likes to play ball in the neighborhood. The challenges he has faced include the lack of water for the crops.

loans.use: to purchase chemical and natural fertilizers, urea and liquids.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 43 años, vive en la cálida ciudad de Pucallpa, la cual se caracteriza por tener paisajes hermosos y sobre todo sus pobladores son personas amables y alegres. Maritza es una mujer muy trabajadora, sobre todo porque es madre de 5 hijos a los cuales saca adelante sola ya que el padre de sus hijos la abandono cuando ellos eran muy pequeños y por ella ha luchado y lucha cada día, sobre todo por sus 2 últimos hijos que aun son menores de edad. Maritza trabaja cada día en su pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas y comidas, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al dia y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y tiene muy buena sazón para la preparación de sus platillos.

Maritza está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda ya que podrá comprar materiales como madera, clavos, calaminas, entre otros y realizar la reparación de su techo, ya que cuando llueve su vivienda se inunda por el techo agujereado, así ella mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y sobre todo podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser una gran empresaria”.

loans.use: Para la mejoramiento de vivienda (arreglo de techo)

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Parbati is 36 years old. She is married and has 2 children, aged 11 and 5. 

In 2000, Parbati established her own grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she is able to support her family. 

Parbati has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan Business and Professional Women, and she used her most recent loan to increase the inventory of her store. 

In the future, Parbati plans to raise the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, known as a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. 

Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase their profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light-source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Angelita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase of solar lamp

loans.name: Lovisa

texts.en:
Lovisa is a widow with five children in her family.

In East Africa, "Hotel" is a restaurant. She started her small business by baking pan cakes, chapatti and mandazi in 2000; Village Enterprise Fund gave her a donation of 100 dollars.

Then, she continued with her same business in a largr scale. Later, she received training in business skills conducted by VEF. After knowing the method of choosing a profitable business, she decided to open a eating house in the local trading centre.

Her hotel is now doing progressing in her daily service to her customers. Given a loan of 500 dollars, she plans to buy new saucepans, cartularies, plates, improve on the diet, and improve on the hotel structure.

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Francisca Orfilia

texts.en:
My name is Francisca A. and I make and sell corn tortillas. I have had my business for 4 years and I have my daughters' help packing and distributing my product. I have loyal customers because my product is sold in different grocery stores and markets in our neighborhood. My goal is to increase production and with the additional earnings, I will be able to build another furnace and hire a woman to work it, and I will have a higher production rate, as well as be able to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Francisca A. me dedico a la venta y produccion de tortillas de maiz, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, tengo la ayuda de mis hijas para el empacado y reparticion de mi producto, mis clientes son fijos ya que mi producto lo repartimos en diferentes pulperias y mercaditos de nuestra localidad, mi meta es incrementar mi produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder hacer otra estufa de adoquin para poder darle empleo a una muchacha y tener mayor produccion asi mismo alimentar a mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase: cornflour, lime, salt, water, firewood, matches and coal.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.en:
Mrs. M. has a grocery store, she has stayed a long time at her current location, which she rents and despite this, her business does well as there are many customers in this part of the city. She says: " My intention is to have my own store, not rented, which is located in front of the storefront I have now, but to acheive this, I need financial support to be able to build my (new) store, I believe that $1,200.00 would help me to achieve my goal."

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La Sra. M. tiene su tienda de abarrotes ella lleva tiempo en ese lugar rentando, a pesar de esto le va bien pues tiene mucha clientela por el sector de la ciudad. "Mi intención es tener mi tiendita en mi propio terreno el cual está ubicado enfrente de donde estoy, para lograr esto requiero de su apoyo para construir el local creo que con $1,200.00 dlls lograré mi objetivo".

loans.use: To change to location of her grocery store.

loans.name: Agamir

texts.en: H. Agamir Mirish Oglu is one of the newly established farmers in the region. He lives in the Imishli region. He has a very small farm and to run such a small farm is not efficient. He keeps calves. To become more efficient, Agamir is going to extend his farm by purchasing additional calves. His farm has a sufficient amount of land to provide the animals with food. He requested from Agroinvest USD 950 in credit to buy 3 calves.

loans.use: To purchase 3 calves

loans.name: Srey Aun

texts.en:
In 2005, Mrs. Srey Aun P.'s sister taught her how to weave silk, and she has been weaving silk since then. She also spends time raising pigs at home. She was married in 2005 and has one son. Her husband is a construction worker and rice farmer.

This is the first time that Mrs. P. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA. She is requesting $100 to buy silk material and sewing thread for weaving.

loans.use: Purchasing silk material and sewing thread for weaving.

loans.name: Leata Mauigoa

texts.en: Leata helps run her family plantation and also raises chicken to augment her income. Poultry is in high demand on special occasions such as funerals, weddings, and even birthdays. On her plantation, she grows crops such as taro and bananas. When all of the poultry cannot be sold, it can be used as food for the family. Feeding the chickens is one of Leata’s daily tasks, which take place early in the morning and again in the evening. She likes to feed the chickens “penu,” a type of feed made from coconuts instead of rice, as she believes that the chickens grow faster this way. She does not have to spend the extra money to buy rice and can simply collect the coconuts in her backyard. Her next loan of US$500 will be used to buy wires for fencing to protect the the chickens from dogs. In addition, some of the money will be used to purchase fertilizers and chemicals for her plantation.

loans.use: Purchase of fence wire for her poultry farm and chemicals, fertilizers, and knives for her plantation

loans.name: Reyna Adilia

texts.es:
Reyna M. is married and has a daughter. She started her business selling used clothes about 10 years ago with a capital of US $500.00. At the same time she helped her husband in the sale of beds and mattresses. With time and helping each other, the couple managed to start a shoe store in the market Israel Lewites in the city of Managua, in a locale enclosed by sheets of plastic.

Her work with CEPRODEL since two and a half years ago has made her sales increase, thus achieving greater profits. At the same time, she has improved the locale's infrastructure. Her credit record is of 14 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Reyna M. es casada y con una hija,. Inicia su negocio vendiendo ropa usada hace alrededor de 10 años con un capital de US$500.00 y al mismo tiemp ayudaba a su esposo en la venta de camas y colchones. Con el tiempo y ayudandose mutuamente la pareja logra poner el negocio de calzado en el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de managua, en un local cerrado por plasticos.

Su trabajo con CEPRODEL desde hace 2½ años ha hecho que sus ventas incrementen logrando asi mayores ganancias. Asi mismo ha mejorado la infraestructura del local. Su record es de 14 creditos.

loans.use: Buying shoes to stock inventory (Compra de calzado para retroalimentacion de inventario)

loans.name: Minakhanim

texts.en: Minakhanim (her husband is pictured) has 5 children. She and her family live in Khachmaz town. She was born in 1965. Her husband has repaired vehicles for a year. Now they need a loan of $850 to buy necessary materials for repairing the vehicles to improve their business.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for repairing the vehicles

loans.name: Kallé Djivente Ii Kadokor Group

texts.fr:
This project consists in the creation of a chicken coop in the ecovillage of Oussouye, where, despite previous initiatives by the villagers, the supplying of edible chickens is still lacking. Thus to fill this void, we have decided to set up a project of poultry farming. This will enable us to provide for the population and for the different restaurants in the region. This will also allow us to create permanent employment for young boys and girls.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Le présent projet consiste à la création d'un poulailler dans l'écovillage d'Oussouye, qui bien que des initiatives ont été prises par des habitants du village, les besoins en ravitaillement de poulets de chair font toujours défaut. Ce qui fait que pour combler ce manque, nous avons décidé de mettre sur pied un projet d'élevage de poulets. Cela nous permettra de fournir les populations et les différtents restaurants de la zone. Cela permet aussi de créer des emplois fixes pourt des jeunes garçons et filles.

loans.use: Purchase of chicks and poultry feed, poultry farming equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas A. is a single man with 2 children.  Thomas has been fulfilling his dream of running a filming/photo studio for the past 3 years. He is requesting a loan of $525 to buy video tapess, CD's and additional filming equipment.  Thomas is also a member of a lending group called “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy video tapes, CD's and additional filming equipment.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 42 years old and is a widow with 7 children, ages 5 to 21 years old. Mary has been a vegetable seller since 1998. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

Mary now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en: Rafiq A. is a 42 year old trader who keeps a general store in Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement. He has sold food and bath equipment such as shampoo, soap and powder since 2000. He is married and has three daughters. His shop is very popular among local people because he is very polite to everyone – that’s why all goods in his shop sell out more quickly than new goods coming in. To improve the situation, Rafiq needs to expand the number of goods he sells and purchase more equipment. For this purpose he applied for $800 USD.

loans.use: Rafiq would like to expand the number of goods he sells at his general store.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia is the owner of a motor taxi and also works selling meals. She has two small children as a single mother and has a cousin who is in charge of driving her vehicle. Slivia needs a loan in order to invest in the maintenance and repair of her tool of work, her motor taxi, as well as to improve her food sales and to eventually construct a kiosk for selling her meals with greater ease. Let's help this mother who, with strength and dedication, continues working tirelessly to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Silvia, es propietaria de un mototaxi y al mismo tiempo se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene dos hijos menores. Ella es madre soltera y tiene a su primo quien se encarga de la conducción de su vehículo.Silvia requiere una suma de dinero en préstamo para invertirlos en el mantenimiento y arreglo de su herramienta de trabajo, mejorar su venta de comida y posteriormente construir su kiosco para vender sus platillos cómodamente. Apoyemos a esta madre que con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue trabajando arduamente por progresar.

loans.use: To repair a motor taxi

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sorn C., 64, and his wife, Mrs. Thoeun Non, 47, live along National Road Number Five, about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia. They were married in 1993 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. Two of them attend the local school.

Mr. Sorn has been farming and working as a hairdresser since he was young. He grows rice in the village, while his wife sells fruit in front of a factory. Now he is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase rice seed and to pay the fee for plowing his rice plot.

loans.use: To pay the fee for plowing and to buy rice seed.

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr:
Mrs. Florence A. was born around 1976 in Abomey in the counties of Zou-Colline. She is married and the mother of 2 children, Brice and Clarisse, 10 and 5 respectively and in 4th grade and kindergarten. She sells bowls and coolers that she purchases in the Dantokpa market. In order to reduce the cost of her goods, she has decided to go, herself, to Lomé, Togo, to make her purchases. She is requesting this loan with a view to achieving that goal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Dame A. Florence est née vers les années 1976 à Abomey dans les départements du Zou-Colline. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, Brice et Clarisse âgés de 10 et 05 ans et respectivement en classe de CM1 et CP au cours primaire. Elle vend des bols et des glacières qu'elle achète au marché DANTOKPA. Pour amoindrir le prix de revient de ses marchandises, elle a décidé d'aller elle même à Lomé au TOGO pour faire ses achats. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour réaliser ce projet.

loans.use:
Purchase of 30 coolers and 10 dozen bowls

Achat de 30 glacières et de 10 douzaines de bols.

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Ung S., born in 1970, is a widow who sells fruit at the local market making US$5 each day. She lives with her four children and her parents. Two of her children are still too young to attend school, and the other two work at a local garment factory to help support the family. Her parents live with her as well and raise cows, while her father also does some fishing for extra income. Ung S. has asked CREDIT for a loan of US$500 to purchase fishing nets and other fishing tools for her father to increase his catch and improve his business. With any leftover money she would like to purchase more cows for her parents to raise and breed. The parents' businesses are small and expansion can increase income, helping to support the whole family.

loans.use: Purchase fishing net and tools

loans.name: Sonia Galán

texts.es: Esta señora empezó su negocio con la venta de refrescos ya que tenía la oportunidad de ofertarles a los estudiantes del colegio “Dulce Sonrisa” porque está ubicado frente a su casa de habitación. Ella ha ido ofertando mas productos  entre los cuales están la venta de helados puestos que un crédito de Adim; además compró una refrigeradora. Para así surtir y ofrecer frutas y golosinas a los estudiantes. Sueña con tener una pulpería, debido a su tenacidad ella sabe que lo va lograr, ya que cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo, quien ha sido muy colaborador en los proyectos que emprende su mama.
texts.en:
Sonia began her business selling drinks, as she had the opportunity to offer them to the students of "Sweet Smile" school because it's located opposite her house. She has started offering more products, among these the sale of ice-cream, thanks to an Adim credit: she also bought a refrigerator. In this way, she stocks and sells fruits and sweets to the students. She dreams of owning a convenience store, and thanks to her tenacity she knows she will achieve this dream, especially as she can count on the help of her son, who has been very supportive of his mother's projects.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales cuatro todavía dependen de ella. Es una madre de familia bastante dinámica, porque se da tiempo primero en atender a su familia, y después en horas, dos veces a la semana se va a las chacras en busca de plátanos verdes, una vez que ha almacenado cierta cantidad, procede a realizar el proceso de maduración con el liquido “etrel”, que lo mezcla con agua en cantidad suficiente para sumergir los plátanos. Esta actividad la viene desarrollando hace 2 años, pero recién en estos tiempos se ha vuelto más rentable, le agrada la actividad que realiza y no tiene grandes dificultades. Este es el primer préstamo que solicita a MFP. Con este dinero comprará plátanos en mayor cantidad, la arroba cuesta S/.15, asimismo comprará plantitas pequeñas de plátanos, para empezar a cultivar sus propios frutos y así pueda tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Olga is 43 years old, married, and has five children (four of whom are her dependants). She is a mother of a dynamic family because she devotes her time to them first, and then she two times a week she goes to the fields to look for green bananas. Once she has collected a sufficient quantity, she rippens them with a liquid called "Etrel", which is a water based mixture in which she submerges the bananas. She has been developing this trade for two years, but recently it has been more profitable. She likes this job and it does not have many difficulties. This is her first loan with MFP. With this money, she will buy bananas in a greater quantity, a bunch costs S/.15, and she will also buy baby banana plants in order to develop her own fruit to earn more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a large amount of banana plants

loans.name: Mr. Vantha Meas Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-nine people who all live in Anlong Romeit Thbong village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan request, and they will use the loan they obtain in different purposes. 

Mr. VanT. M. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. He and his wife are farmers. It now is the time for harvesting; unfortunately, they do not have enough money to hire laborers to harvest the rice padD., so Mr. VanT. M. decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers for his purpose. He is 63 years old and the father of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factoR. while the other two are construction workers. The remaining three are attending the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the veR. end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest the rice paddy.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El Sr Edgar D. el mismo es soltero vive con su mamá en la colonia Yatytay de 32 años de edad es soltero de profesión Médico clínico el mismo presta servicios en el Hospital de la ciudad de M.AUX. Con 4 años de antigüedad percibiendo un salario fijo. También posee una pequeña empresa de prestación de servicios de trabajos de construcción de empedrado en la zona de San Pedro del Paraná.
El mismo solicito la suma de 5MM a 12 meses para gastos de combustible que estaría comprando de la ciudad de Posadas a menor precio lo que le estaria siendo más rentable para su negocio por el menor costo de combustible.
texts.en:
Edgar D. is single and lives with his mother in the town of Yatytay. He is 32 years old, single, and a medical professional working in a hospital. He has been receiving a fixed salary for 4 years. He also has a small business offering construction services (paving) in the San Pedro del Paraná area. He is requesting a loan of 5MM for 12 months for fuel: he will buy fuel for resale in the city of Posadas where prices are lower in order to make greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fuel and maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Komlan John

texts.fr: Monsieur K. john est un revendeur de produits d’alimentation générale  depuis 2007 dans la rue prince à adjidogomé. Il n’a jamais obtenu de prêt de chez WAGES , son stock s’épuise c’est pour cela qu’il sollicite son 1er prêt  de 375000Fde WAGES pour pouvoir se réapprovisionner et relancer son activité. Il est marié à Une dame qui est une revendeuse, ensemble ils ont à charges 04 enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. John K. has worked as a general food retailer since 2007 on Prince Street in Adjidogomé. He has never had a WAGES loan before, but is now requesting his first loan of 375000 XOF ($775) to restock his products and reopen his business. He is married with four children and his wife also works as a retailer.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of general food products for resale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice O. recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya.

As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

Alice is a 40-year-old married mother of 5. The family lives in the Nyalenda neighborhood of Kisumu.

Alice sells both raw and fried fish in the Nyalenda area. She began the business in 1980, and it has been faring well for over 28 years now. The fish, tilapia, comes fresh from Lake Victoria. She buys from fishermen at the lakeside as well as from middlemen near the Kisumu Bus Station.

She has applied for her first loan from K-MET, requesting approximately $150. Alice will use this loan to increase her stock of fish.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Grimalda

texts.es:
Grimalda es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Grimalda es viuda, tiene 52 años y 2 hijos, Grimalda tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa variada, productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además los días lunes vende en la feria de las Nazarenas.
Grimalda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas.
Grimalda sueña con tener una tienda propia, capital propio y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Grimalda is a member of the communal bank, Sonrisa. Grimalda is a widow. She is 52 years old and she has 2 children. Grimalda has a stand at a market, where she sells a variety of clothes and products that she acquires in the city of Lima. As a matter of fact, on Mondays she goes out and sells stuff at the carnival of Nazarenas. Grimalda needs a loan of $325 (1000 Soles) which she will invest buying sweaters. Grimalda dreams about having her own store someday and making a house for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sweaters to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru: Ахмад работает в коммунальном хозяйстве города Исфары. Ему 61 год, женат. Его единственный ребенок уже имеет свою семью и проживает отдельно от родителей. Ахмад собирается отремонтировать свою квартиру и поэтому давно планировал это. Но после скрупулезных подсчетов увидел, что ему не хватает некоторой суммы денег. Поэтому он пришел в МикроИнвест и подал заявку на займ. Собирается купить доски и шифер.
texts.en:
Ahmad works in a collective farm in the town of Isfara. He is 61 years old and married. His only child already has own family and lives separately from the parents. Ahmad wants to repair his apartment and has been planning this for a long time. But after careful calculation he has found that he is short of a certain amount of money. This is why he has come to MicroInvest and applied for a loan. He plans to buy boards and slates.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boards and slates for home repairs

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela C. is 30 years old and married with five children. She sells provisions like noodles, tooth paste, etc. She is hoping for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more stock to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.en:
A. Olimjon is 36 years old. Together with his wife, who works to help pay household expenses, he has three children. His goal for his children is to support them so that they may complete their studies, leading to professional careers.

Olimjon has worked as a farmer for the past 10 years. The greatest obstacle for him is pests. He began his work with his own efforts, and the help which IMON International, Kiva's partner, was able to offer led to better production. With this second loan Olimjon will invest in the purchase of fertilizers and high quality seeds to get a better harvest which he will be able to sell at a better market price. Let’s support this hard-working man so that he can attain his goals!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Hoàng Thị

texts.en:
L. Hoàng Thị (614990671) is a 43-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has three school-aged children. To making a living, L. owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling incense products to local businesses and community members. L. has been engaged in this business for over 16 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1999, L. joined Kiva partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. L. is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be the tenth she has taken out from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Gladys Clara

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=71109&_tpos=12&_tpg=1
Gladys es socia del Bancomunal El Roble.
Gladys es casada tiene 47 años. 
Gladys  se dedica a las ventas, ha experimentado diferentes clases de productos para vender  y   decidió  vender  lencería y ropa de cama, ella hace sus compras al por mayor en  el emporio de gamarra. 
Desde que Gladys esta en Finca su capital de trabaja ha crecido, puede comprar mas mercadería.   
Gladys necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de lencería, ropa interior de mujer. 
El sueño de Gladys es tener un negoció propio, para vender lencería y otras cosas.
texts.en:
First Loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=71109&_tpos=... Gladys is a member of the El Roble Community Bank. She is 47 and married. She works in sales. She has tried selling different products, but she decided to sell lingerie and sleepwear. She shops wholesale in the Emporio de Gamarra. Since Gladys has been in Finca her working capital has grown, and she can buy mO. merchandise. Gladys needs a loan of 1,200 PEN to buy lingerie and women’s sleepwear. Gladys’ dream is to have her own stO. selling lingerie and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lingerie and women's underwear

loans.name: Miriam Oneida

texts.es:
la sra. MIRIAM ONEIDA ORDOÑEZ E. se dedica al comercio, tiene una pulperia y venta de frutas que se encuentra ubicada en la terminal de transporte de buses de esta ciudad. 
Su negocio es apto para este lugar ya que aqui transitan muchas personas que viajan todos los dias y con los ingresos que genera cubre los gastos de su hogar ya que su esposo emigro hace 3 años a los Estados Unidos para poder mejorar su condicion de vida, ya que en sus planes es tener su propia vivienda,  con las remesas que ha recibido y recibe de su esposo son para la construccion de su vivienda misma que se encuentra en construcion todavia teniendo terminadas todas las 
paredes y techado faltandole todos los arreglos internos a la misma. 
Doña Miriam se ha sabido ganar los clientes por su carácter personal.
texts.en:
Ms. Miriam Oneida Ordonez E. has dedicated herself to her business; she has a grocery store and sells fruits. This business is located at the bus terminal in the city.

Her business is in the right place as there are a lot of people travelling back and forth all day. With the profits generated from the business she has been able to cover all her household expenses as her husband emigrated to the United States 3-years ago to provide for better living conditions. They plan to have a proper dwelling with the funds they’ve saved and continue to receive from her husband. The construction of the dwelling is still going on to the walls, the roof and internal arrangements.

Mrs. Miriam has been able to win many clients with personality.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Aun

texts.en: Mrs. Aun N. lives in Doem Pour village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to cultivate rice this season. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides and to hire laborers to work on the field. Her husband, Mr. Noun Rith, is a fisherman. This couple has a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband and child are with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer, pesticides, and to hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en: T. Alice is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is 38 years old and the mother of five children in school and she takes care of two dependents. Alice has been in the tailoring business for nine years. It is located in Mbaba trading centre and at the moment, she is able to make some profits. The way her business operates is that customers bring her clothing materials with their own designs and she charges for the services. For some, she sells the clothing materials to them plus the sewing, hence making twice the income. Alice needs a loan to be able to buy more clothing materials for resale plus to buy threads and needles for quick services.

loans.use: Buying clothing materials, threads, needles and other accessories for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Sol De Verano_Kantutas Group

texts.es: Cinco son las integrantes del grupo Sol de Verano Kantutitas, que pertenecen al Centro Focal Juan Pablo II,Benita de 38 años se dedica a vender muebles, tiene su puesto propio en la feria "16 de Julio", Lizzeth de 28 años vende juguetes en la "Garita de Lima", Irma de 36 años vende muñecos de yeso y Rosario y Florencia dan productos al crédito. Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y seguir operando ens us negocios.
texts.en:
There are five members of the Sol de Verano Kantutitas group who belong to the Juan Pablo II Focal Center. Benita, 38 years old, works selling furniture and has her own stand at the "16th of July" market. Lizzeth, 28 years old, sells toys at the "Garita de Lima" market. Irma, 36 years old, sells plaster figurines, and Rosario and Florencia offer products on credit. All of these women need the loan to purchase merchandise and to continue operating their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Edvin Laureano

texts.es: El joven Edvin Lauriano S. C. Cuanta con 21 años de edad soltero vive conjuntamente con su madre, único hijo el reside en el lugar conocido como paraje chopoclaj del cantón Paqui, Totonicapán en la actualidad se dedica elaborando diferentes tipos de muebles lleva 3 años a esta actividad productiva por lo que la necesidad lo obliga y adquirió un pequeño préstamo para la compra de madera ya que el tiempo de invierno se acerca y para poder seguir trabajando y almacenar un poco de materia prima por lo que la demanda de su clientela es muy buena, también aprovechando mejorar sus ingresos para poder sufragar sus gastos mensuales.

loans.use: Artesania (compra de materia prima)

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal Jadat, es casada, tiene 49 años, tres hijos de 22, 17 y 10 años que esta estudiando en la escuela estatal, ella estudio corte y confección y se puso a confeccionar por tallas, empezó ofreciendo a sus vecinas, familiares, hasta que decidió llevar su mercadería a los puesto de los mercados donde poco a poco fue haciéndose clientas y en tiempos de campaña tiene una amiga que le ayuda en las confecciones.  
Desde que empezó a recibir las capacitaciones de Finca Perú su negocio ha crecido, en el Bancomunal  aprendió a ser paciente, tolerante y solidaria, tiene un lindo grupo de amigas animosas y trabajadoras.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para la compra de tela de verano por metros, de diferentes colores. 
Su anhelo es tener una tienda propia para vender la ropa que diseña y confecciona.

loans.use: compra de tela de verano por metros

loans.name: Ahlonkobu

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente en détail de serviettes et de draps dans le quartier de Baguida à Lomé, elle fait ce commerce de façon ambulante. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins et d’apporter financièrement ses aides dans l’éducation scolaire de leurs enfants. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de hédzranawoé à Lomé mais aussi au Grand Marché de Lomé. Elle reçoit beaucoup de commandes de la part de ses clients et leur réserve ses meilleurs produits à l’ouverture de nouveaux bals. Elle a approché WAGES pour pourvoir acheter de nouveaux bals ; le prêt lui permettra de commander 02 bals de draps et une bal de serviettes. Elle est confiante pour le remboursement.
texts.en:
This woman is married and is the mother of 03 children. To generate revenue, she retails napkins and sheets in the Baguida neighborhood of Lomé. She runs her business in a traveling fashion. This business allows her to meet the majority of her needs and to help financially with her childrens' schooling. She gets her supplies in the Hédzranawoé market in Lomé but also in the Grand Marché of Lomé. She receives many orders from her customers and sets aside the best products for them when she opens new bales. She has approached WAGES in order to be able to purchase new bales. This loan will allow her to order 02 bales of sheets and one bale of napkins. She is confident she will be able to reimburse this loan.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase sheets, napkins and other items

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is divorced and has three children. She has received a senior high school education.  Since 2004, Elizabeth has been selling shoes, bags and cosmetics at the Elmina market.  Elizabeth uses her income to pay for school fees and utility bills.  Elizabeth will use this loan to purchase more wigs and cosmetics to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more wigs and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Benjamin Changotèlou

texts.fr: A. Benjamin Changotèlou est née vers 1947 et réside à Ahito à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin, depuis environs 50 ans.  Benjamin Changotèlou est une veuve qui est mère de cinq enfants, dont trois sont à sa charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Benjamin Changotèlou vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte les charges de la famille. Benjamin Changotèlou n’a pas été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Benjamin Changotèlou vend de l’igname frit, des patates frites ainsi que des beignets d’haricot à Allada. C’est à Houègbo au Bénin et à Acassato au Bénin, que Benjamin Changotèlou fait ses achats. Benjamin Changotèlou est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de l’institution, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. En vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et augmenter la quantité de repas produite par jour, Benjamin Changotèlou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Benjamin Changotèlou A. was born around 1947, and has lived in Ahito, in Allada, in the Atlantique Department of Bénin for about 50 years. She is a widow with five children, 3 of whom she is currently supporting. Although Benjamin Changotèlou never attended school herself, all of her children are students. To support her family, Benjamin Changotèlou sells fried yams, potatos and bean fritters in Allada. She purchases her ingredients in Houègbo and Acassato. Benjamin Changotèlou is a long-time client of ALIDé, having already received and repaid two previous loans. She has requested this third loan to increase her working capital in order to purchase more ingredients and prepare more meals every day.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bags of beans, yams, vegetable oil, and firewood

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en:
Enhbayar N. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Hovd province, one of western provinces. His three oldest daughters go to secondary school in the town and the youngest daughter is 5 years old and goes to a local kindergarten. Enhbayar is a trained welder. He has been doing welding work for the last ten years. Besides his welding work, he sells meat including mutton and beef at the local food market. His meat selling business is actually the main source of family income. His wife also helps in selling meat. His dream for his family is to have their own piece of land where they can live because currently they live on rented land. He is requesting a loan to purchase more meat for his business. 

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: to purchase more meat

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Ganbaatar is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent called a “ger”. Both of his sons attend a local secondary school, his wife is employed as a dress maker, and Ganbaatar operates a leather clothing making business. He began his company in 2008 after working as a specialized dress maker in a private company for several years. While working in this company, he gained many skills that have helped him when he formed his own business. He makes a variety of leather coats and jackets for his customers, each one according to his or her specifications. He hopes to grow his business in the future so that he can hire employees and train them in sewing. He says, “I plan to have a leather clothing factory in the future.” Ganbaatar is requesting a 900,000 tugrug (~650 USD) loan in order to purchase leather for his business.

loans.use: Purchase leather for clothing

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 26 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

Comfort works hard to be able to provide for herself. She is a hairdresser by profession. Comfort works in a shop by the roadside in her community. She has been in business for three years and currently has seven apprentices under training. Comfort wants a loan to buy artificial hair, pomade and other working materials to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair

loans.name: Mery Del Carmen

texts.es:
La  Señora  Mery del Carmen Pérez Martínez, Labora como  Conserje en el Instituto Manuel Olivares de Managua.                                                                                                                                                                            Ella es casado  tiene dos hijos a su cargo y  estos se encuentran en edad escolar, ha trabajado dos créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos  crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de  materiales de construcción como: piso y cemento para su casa de habitación.
Mery dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel ha venido mejorando su casa de habitación, por lo que ahora cuenta con una casa más segura para su familia.
texts.en:
Mery del Carmen Pérez Martínez works as a caretaker at Managua's Manuel Olivares Institute. She is married and has two, school-age, children under her care. She has had two loans with CEPRODEL that she has used to improve her home. The financing requested now will be used to buy building materials like flooring and cement for her home. Mery told us that, thanks to CEPRODEL's loans, she has been making improvements to her home which has led to her having a safer home for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make home improvements.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda P. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Hilda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Hilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Hilda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will again be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pedro R. se dedica al servicio de Transporte "Fletes"  el cual consiste en traslado de Arena, Grava y Piedra de un lugar hacia otro, mismo que realiza con su camion, ya cuenta con clientes fijos en su mayoria son ferreterias. Realiza viajes dentro y fuera de la ciudad, tiene cinco años de 
experiencia en este tipo de actividad, cuenta con dos empleados los que le ayudan a cargar y descar
el material, don Pedro esta casado con la señora Candida la cual tambien tiene un negocio de Venta de Golosinas, juntos se ayudan y han logrado salir adelante, el necesita el credito para poder comprar  
el material a las ferreterias y distribuirlo directamente a sus clientes y asi poder obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Pedro R. has a delivery service specializing in the transportation of sand, gravel and stone from one place to another. He uses his truck and his regular customers are, for the most part, hardware stores. His deliveries are done both within and outside the city. He has five years experience in this type of work and has two employees that help him load and unload the materials. Pedro is married to Candida, who sells snacks and sweets. Together, they have managed to get ahead in life. He needs funding to buy materials from the hardware stores to then distribute directly to his customers thus obtaining higher income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Brisas Del Rio Group

texts.es:
el grupo Brisas del Rio esta ubicado en la colonia Brisas del Rio, esta formado por tres mujeres las cuales son muy trabajadoras. a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la sra. Exdulia C. es una persona emprendedora y muy dedicada a sus estudios y a su trabajo.
Exdulia se dedica a la produccion y venta de torillas, todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana  para fabricar sus ricas tortillas y luego se va a estudiar, a pesar que no tiene padres a salido adelante,  quedo guerfana a los 6 años de edad y poco a poco a estudiado. Usara el credito para incrementar sus ventas y asi tener mejores ganancias.

la sra. Emerita M. es madre de 2 hijos, Emerita se dedica a la venta de Baleadas a domicilio, todos los dias se levanta  a las 4 de la mañana para poder hacer sus ricas  baleadas.
tiene la ayuda de su esposo para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos. utilizara el credito para comprar materia prima para la fabricacion de las baleadas.

la sra. Felix M. es muy dedicada a su familia, es madre de 2 hijos y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, todos los dias se levanta a la 4 de la mañana para hacer sus ricas tortillas y luego salir venderlas a los alrededores de su casa de habitacion, utilizara el credito para comprar harina de maiz, cal, leña para tener una mayor produccion y por ende muchas ventas y mas ganancias las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
The Brisas del Rio group is located in the Brisas del Rio neighborhood. It is composed of three hard-working women. Following are detailed the different activities that they do: Senora Exdulia C. is an enterprising woman, very dedicated to her studies and to her work. Exdulia produces and sells tortillas, getting up every day at 4 am to cook her rich tortillas, then going to study. She has no parents, they have passed on, and she has been an orphan since the age of 6, studying little by little. She will use the loan to increase her sales, earning a better income. Senora Emerita M. is the mother of 2 children. Emerita sells baleadas (tortillas filled with beans) house to house, getting up every day at 4 am to make her rich baleadas. She has the help of her husband to care for the expenses of the household and of the children. She will use the loan to buy raw materials to make the baleadas. Senora Felix M. is very dedicated to her family, she is the mother of 2 children, she cooks and sells tortillas. Every day she gets up at 4 am to make her rich tortillas, then she goes out to sell them near her home. She will use the loan to buy corn flour, lime, firewood so she can have increased production, more sales, and greater earnings needed to take care of household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Nimatou

texts.fr:
Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de cola. Elle a démarré ce commerce en 2008 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Faisant face à une baisse de son stock de marchandises, elle sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt pour acheter 40 sacs de cola.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, le revenu de son commerce lui permet de contribuer aux dépenses du foyer.
texts.en:
This lady retails cola nuts as her revenue-generating activity. She began business in 2008 and gets her supplies from the main market in Lomé. Confronted with a depletion of her stock of merchandise, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 40 bags of cola nuts. She is married and mother of two children. With the income generated by her business she can participate in managing household expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cola nuts

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: A sus 40 años, Teodora vive junto a su esposo Virgilio y sus cuatro hijos, en su domicilio propio, construido a base de carrizo y hojas de árbol. Ella se caracteriza por ser abnegada madre y muy hogareña. El trabajo de agricultura lo aprendió desde muy pequeña, pues su padre le enseño este oficio, aunque es un poco sacrificado su trabajo, le gusta, quizá por eso cuida con esmero sus cultivos de palta, plátanos y frutas cítricas, siendo su esposo quien la acompaña en cada jornada. Paralelamente a este trabajo, cría gallinas y cerdos, que luego son comercializados en el mercado de su ciudad, cuya ganancia le ayuda en algún imprevisto que se presente, ya que no quiere coger sus ahorros que están destinados para la compra de terrenos productivos, en donde renovará y alternará nuevos productos que crece en la zona. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, y se muestra satisfecha de pertenecer a su grupo comunal, por ser un grupo muy unido y con mucho ganas de superarse. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 20 sacos de fertilizantes para nivelar la producción de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
At 40 years of age, Teodora lives with her husband, Virgilio, and their four children in their own home, built with bamboo and tree leaves. She is known for being a devoted mother and homemaker. She learned farming work when she was very young since her father taught her this work. Although her job requires sacrifice, she likes it. Perhaps this is why she protects from harm her crops of avocados, bananas, and citrus fruits. Her husband accompanies her every working day. Along with this job, she raises hens and pigs which are then sold in the city market and whose earnings help her with some inexpected problems since she doesn't want to take her savings that are intended for the purchase of productive land where she will renew and alternate new products that grow in the area. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is satisfied to belong to her community group since it is a very unified group with a log of desire to get ahead. With the loan that she is requesting, she will purchase 20 sacks of fertilizer to level the production of her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar 20 sacos de fertilizantes.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana P. is from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 31 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ana owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Ana has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Ana joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ana is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en: Zaituni is married with four children and all her children go to school.  Zaituni takes care of additional family members. She works and lives in Kisaasi Kulambiro Zone, Kawempe Division, in Kampala District. She changed her business from food vending to charcoal selling. Currently, Zaituni owns a store at her home where she sells charcoal. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She has been in this charcoal business for just a few months. Besides this charcoal business, she owns rooms to rent, which brings in some income. Her major customers are her neighbors. Zaituni works seven days a week. Her business challenges include defaulters and seasonality. Zaituni aspires to go directly to the villages for charcoal. She  joined MCDT because of their timely loans. She lives in and owns a two-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bgas of charcoal

loans.name: Sonia Angelica

texts.es:
