Sonia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo pequeño, de profesión Obstetriz, tiene una botica en un local alquilado que se encuentra cerca al hospital de la ciudad, su negocio se inicio en la casa de sus suegros, sus ventas eran pocas, ahora se han incrementado y necesita implementar con mas productos que tiene demanda en la zona, Sonia cambio la ubicación de su negocio hace 1 mes y esta cada día mejor, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de su esposo, lo que mas le agrada de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la facilidad del préstamo. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de medicamentos antibióticos. 
Sus sueños son ampliar su botica y tener un mayor capital.
texts.en:
Sonia has a common-law husband and one small child. She is a midwife by profession, and she operates a pharmacy in rented quarters near the city's hospital. She began her business in her in-laws' house, but she had few customers. Now, sales have improved and she needs to stock her business with more products which are in demand in the area. Sonia changed the location of her business one month ago, and each day it is going better and better. She works every day, sometimes with her husband's help. What she likes most about her communal bank are the savings and the ease of obtaining a loan. Her loan will be invested in buying antibiotic medications. Her dreams are to expand her pharmacy and have a higher level of capital.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying antibiotic medications

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia de 59 años, ella vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su esposo vende cangrejos y tienen cinco hijos, ella tiene una papelería (en Ecuador se llama “bazar”). 

Julia comenzó vendiendo tres blusas a sus conocidos, poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo comprar mas para venderlas, ahora ella pudo construir una parte de su casa y comprar papelería para su negocio, trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm.

Para tener mas surtido el negocio ella quiere comprar cuadernos y bebidas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is 59 years old. She lives in a suburb on the outskirts of Guayaquil, and runs a stationer's shop (or a "bazar", as it is called in Ecuador). Her husband sells crabs, and they have five children together. Julia started by selling blouses to people she knew. Little by little, with hard work and dedication, she was able to buy more things to sell. She works from 8am to 8pm. She has now managed to build part of their house and to buy stock for her stationery business. She wants to buy notebooks and drinks to increase her stock. In the future she would like to improve her home and continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks; drinks

loans.name: Shareef

texts.en:
Shareef is a 22-year-old man from Rafah, a city in the Gaza Strip. He has a BA degree, but couldn't find a job in Rafah due to the current situation in Gaza. Therefore, he decided to start a small business to cover his personal expenses.

A small general store was the fastest business to start, and Shareef did so with the help of his father.. Shareef wanted to increase the goods he offered in his small store, so he came to FATEN and took a $1,000 loan.

In the photograph, Shareef appears in his store.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is 48 years old and married with four children between 9 and 17 years old.  Jean de Dieu is known for selling clothes and he has been in this business for about five years.  The hours of his business are from 8 am to 6 pm every day. 

Jean de Dieu is a proven entrepreneur and he is now requesting his second loan after paying the first one in full.  With the use of the first one, he managed to increase his business. Now he wants to start selling in different areas.  To end this, he hopes that access to the second loan will allow him to reach his target.  If successful, he hopes that his profits will increase and a number of people from his community will get a job.

loans.use: To buy different styles of cothes to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother of four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of her aged mother and some orphans. She owns a restaurant in Nakulabye selling all types of food, both African (like bananas, cassava, and potatoes), and Western (like chips and sausages). She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas, rice, sacks of cassava and potatoes.  She buys foodstuffs from Nakulabye market and so incurs little transport costs to and from shopping.

Mary works from her home and so doesn’t pay rent for her business. She sells to all categories of people but on retail only. She works six days a week. Her business challenge is the rainy season because she works from a muddy place and so this hinders her customers to reach out to her.

Besides this food business she also gets additional income from rental rooms.  She has been in the hotel business for over ten years.

She is aspiring of improving her standards of living.   She decided to join MCDT because of the low interest charged.  Mary resides in and owns a three roomed house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: restocking restaurant with bananas, cassava, rice, and potatoes

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: La Señora Maria Guadalupe se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, ella tiene 2 hijos menores de edad de 4 y 2 años. Ella sale a vender todos los días pues no tiene un lugar estable, solo algunos vecinos que llegan a buscarla a su vivienda cuenta con más de 11 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio, Maria lo administra personalmente y durante todo este tiempo le ha ido muy bien pues. El crédito lo utilizara para surtir mejor su negocio y que sus ventas sean mejores para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Ella sueña con establecer su negocio pues así tendrá más afluencia de clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe sells general merchandise. She has two minor children, ages four and two. She leaves to sell everyday, but she does not have a fixed location. Some of her neighbors come to look for her in her house. She has over 11 years of experience managing this business. Maria personally runs the business, and during all of this time it has gone very well for her. She will use the loan to better stock her business so that her sales will improve. She will do that so that she will be able to improve her living conditions and those of her family. She dreams of setting up her business in order to have a greater influx of customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en:
Desiree S. is from the village of Gusa. She is 32 years old. Desiree is widowed and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Desiree owns and operates an agricultural business venture raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Desiree has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 600 PHP a week for these activities.

In 2007, Desiree joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Desiree has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Desiree is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be her fourth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en:
Rasul M. is 34 years old, married and is the father of three children. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children.

Rasul is an enterprising man who constantly tries to do things better and to improve, day after day. He works hard in his fields where he spends as much time as possible cultivating and fertilizing his land and spraying it to prevent diseases that might affect his yield. He raises tomatoes and cucumbers. Rasul also keeps cattle.

Rasul is applying for a loan of 1000 AZN. He needs seed and fertilizer to continue raising his crops and would like to purchase two head of cattle.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and two head of cattle

loans.name: Tataisai Group

texts.en:
In the photo are the members of the “Tataisai” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mabinty B..  Mabinty is age thirty-four; she was born in a place called Walla. Currently, she is residing in Waterloo together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a tailor and her children are attending primary and secondary schools respectively. For ten years now,  Mabinty has been selling palm oil (the country’s favorite cooking oil) and rice. With this loan, she will buy gallons of palm oil and bags of rice to sell.

loans.use: Buy gallons of palm oil and bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Domingo's Group

texts.en:
Domingo C. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. He is 44 years old. Domingo is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Domingo is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Domingo owns & operates a business selling fish balls and other dimsums to the local community. Domingo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Domingo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Domingo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Domingo is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Domingo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ieng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ieng S., who was born in 1986, has been selected by the members as the leader of this group loan located in Preaek Samraong village in Kandal province. Each member will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose. 

She is a seamstress in a garment factory where she is able to earn a small salary to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Vanna Chav, is a motorbike taxi driver. Although they both try to work hard, they can earn only a little income.

So, to start a new business and improve her family's standard of living, Mrs. Ieng S. is applying for a loan to buy clothes and shoes to resell. This couple has two children who are both too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes to resell

loans.name: Edgardo Jose

texts.es: El señor Edgardo tiene en su residencia un taller de zapatería en el cual fabrica sandalias, bolsos, carteras, correas y todo tipo de calzado, especialmente para damas. Su experiencia en el oficio la adquirió por trabajar durante 9 años en una empresa grande de calzado que funcionaba en una Zona Franca Industrial, allí, a pesar de estar en un cargo administrativo, aprendió todas las técnicas y etapas del proceso de producción. Después de haberse retirado de la empresa, perfeccionó sus conocimientos al realizar varios cursos de zapatería en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje, SENA, que es la más importante escuela de artes y oficios del Estado. Actualmente, el microempresario produce todo tipo de calzado que vende por docenas en misceláneas y almacenes de la ciudad. Las ventas las realiza de contado y en ocasiones otorga de 30 a 45 días de plazo para el pago. El margen promedio de ganancia de su negocio es del 43% y sus ventas mensuales son en promedio de $2.700.000. El taller, a pesar de ser pequeño, está dotado de una máquina de coser industrial y todas las herramientas manuales para producir cualquier tipo de calzado. Normalmente el señor Edgardo trabaja sólo, pero en la temporada de fin de año los pedidos suelen incrementarse considerablemente y contrata a un ayudante que le colabora en el corte del sintético y el cuero. El aspira a su primer préstamo con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por $1.000.000 que planea invertir en la compra de cuero, sintético, goma, suelas y herrajes. El microempresario dice que uno de sus mayores logros ha sido posicionar sus productos a pesar de la fuerte competencia que significa las importaciones de productos similares a menores precios, pero de menor calidad. Sueña con tener un gran taller de zapatería, equipado de modernas máquinas y muchos empleados. Con su pequeño taller, el señor Edgardo ha logrado darle educación superior a todos sus tres hijos que son su mayor orgullo
texts.en:
Edgardo has a shoemaker's workshop in his home in which he makes sandals, bags, purses, belts and all kinds of shoes, especially for women.  His experience in the trade was acquired when he worked for 9 years in a large footwear company which operated an industrial free-trade zone.  There, in spite of being in an administrative position, he learned all the techniques and stages of the production process.  After leaving the company, he perfected his knowledge by attending a number of shoemaker's courses in the Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje, SENA (the National Apprenticeship Service).  

Currently Edgardo produces all kinds of footwear which he sells by the dozen in stores and warehouses across the city.  He makes his sales for cash and occasionally allows 30 to 45 days for his customers to pay.  His average profit margin is 43% and his monthly sales are on average $2,700,000.  His workshop, although it is small, has an industrial sewing machine and all the manual equipment he needs to produce any type of footwear.  Normally Edgardo works alone but in the end-of-year season his orders usually increase considerably and he hires an assistant who helps him cut his synthetic material and leather.

This is Edgardo's first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He is requesting $1,000,000 which he plans to invest in the purchase of leather, synthetic material, rubber, soles and iron fittings.  Edgardo says that one of his biggest achievements has been to sell his products in spite of the strong competition which he has seen from imports of similar products at lower prices but of inferior quality.  He dreams of having a larger shoemaker's workshop, equipped with modern machinery and many employees.  With his small workshop, Edgardo has managed to pay for his children to study in higher education which is his biggest pride.

loans.use: To buy leather, synthetic material, rubber, soles and iron fittings

loans.name: Alex William

texts.es:
Alex es un padre de familia de  26 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Paiján, un distrito comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ascope en la región La Libertad, se encuentra ubicado a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.  

Alex cuenta con una mototaxi, un vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte. Con este vehículo el brinda servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros dentro de su  localidad y con las zonas aledañas. El negocio es su fuente principal de ingresos con la que cuenta para sacar adelante a su familia.

Alex desea realizar algunas reparaciones y brindar mantenimiento a su mototaxi, ya que el continuo uso y el estado accidentado de los caminos de la zona ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Alex es una persona que goza de buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos, es una persona trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
Alex is a 26-year-old father who lives with his wife in Paiján district, a commercial area located in Ascope Province of La Libertad Region.  This site is two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque Region.  

Alex has a mototaxi, a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin for transportation activities.  With this vehicle, he offers transportation services for cargo and passengers in town and to neighboring areas.  The business is his main source of income for making ends meet for his family.

Alex wants to make some repairs and do maintenance work on his mototaxi since continual use and the rough roads in the area have caused it to start having some problems.  For this reason, he thought it a good idea to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 new soles.

Alex has good references from his neighbors and friends.  He is a hardworking, responsible person.

loans.use: Repair and maintenance costs for mototaxi

loans.name: Erkul

texts.en:
Erkul M. is 36, married and has two children of school age. He graduated from Kyrgyz Architectural Institute but couldn’t find a well-paid job to cover all the expenses of his young family. In order to find a means of subsistence, Erkul decided to start his own business selling foodstuffs – frozen chicken meat and sausages – at the local market. His start as an entrepreneur was successful due to his great efforts and strong will to provide his children with the essentials. 

Erkul was able to open his own small shop and purchase tracks for products transportation. In June 2010, when violent clashes caused by the deposed political regime broke out in the Osh city, Erkul lost his business. His sales shop at the market was robbed and looted, and his storage was burned. But Erkul didn’t give up and decided to resume his lost business and continue his activities. For this very reason, Erkul is applying for a loan of 100,000 soms (KGS), which he needs to restart his business. Erkul is a very optimistic and hardworking person who moves his family ahead and makes every effort for it. 

======================================

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase goods for reselling

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria forma parte del banco comunal “Caminando Juntos” de la comuna de Quilicura. Su negocio consiste en la preparación y venta de desayunos y colaciones, desde hace 30 años. Trabaja con dos de sus 4 hijos (todos adultos). Tiene dos empresas, como clientes frecuentes,  a las que vende todo el año sus productos. 
Con este préstamo comprará alimentos para preparar sus platillos. Su meta es cambiar su vehiculo, ya que el que tiene es antiguo y  ha tenido varias fallas. 
Gracias a Fondo Esperanza, Victoria dice que ha mantenido su negocio. Además también le ha sido muy grato compartir con sus compañeros de grupo.
 Quilicura es una comuna perteneciente a Santiago, capital de Chile, ubicada en el extremo noroeste de región metropolitana. El origen del nombre de la comuna viene del mapudungun (lengua mapuche): "kila", que significa “tres” y "kura" que significa “piedra”, por lo que se deduce que el nombre de Quilicura equivale a "tres piedras", como  el nombre que le dieron los primeros habitantes de este valle en referencia a los tres cerros que son perfectamente visibles y que delimitan la comuna.
texts.en: Victoria is part of the communal bank “Caminando Juntos” in the municipality of Quilicura. Her business has been in the preparation and sales of breakfasts and light meals since 30 years ago. She works with two of her 4 sons (all adult). She has two businesses, frequent customers, to whom she sells her products year round. With this loan, she will buy foods to prepare her plates. Her goal is to exchange her vehicle, since the one she has is old and has various faults. Thanks to Fondo Esperanza, Victoria says that she has been able to maintain her business. Furthermore, she has been very pleased to share with her companions in the group. Quilicura is an area of Santiago, the capital of Chile, located in the extreme Northeast of the metropolitan region. The origin of the name of the municipality comes from mapudungun (Mapuche language): “kila” means “three” and “kura” means “rock,” which means that the name Quilacura means “three rocks,” such is the name that the first inhabitants gave to this valley in reference to the three hills which are perfectly visible and which border the municipality.

loans.use: To purchase foods

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem M. A. is 45 years old, married to M. A., and has given birth to three children. They all left school and started to work in their teenage years to help financially support the family. The family lives in Kasur, which is a small city within Punjab, Pakistan. It is famous for its leather industry.

Milk sales have become the family's business since most of the members are involved in it. Naseem’s husband has some buffaloes at home that he milks early in the morning and then sells the milk to his neighboring clients. He has run his dairy for the past twenty years. Naseem’s eldest son sells buffalo milk, her middle child works in the fields and grows different crops, while her youngest son also sells milk.

Naseem works at home doing embroidery and stitchery work. She receives orders from her neighboring clients and is paid after completing the orders.

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah to further expand her husband’s milk business. She is a regular borrower from Asasah; this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit and never missed any meetings.

With the loan, Naseem will buy another buffalo to increase their dairy’s output of milk and to serve many more clients. She is hopeful that such an investment will improve her family’s business to a great extent.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong T. T. is 39 years old and has two children who are in high school. She is a farmer who grows rice and is raising ten pigs to sell for meat. Every three months, merchants come to her house to buy her pigs and Luong can make 5,000,000 VND from her work as a pig seller.

Luong joined SEDA’s credit program over four years ago and has a good attitude about repayment. She is requesting a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy fertilizer and food for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pig food

loans.name: Maria Selva

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria D. tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos, vive en el asentamiento Clarita Calle Gimenez de la Ciudad de Coronel Oviedo.
La Sra. Maria se dedica a la venta de empanadas, milanesas y bebidas en general, con clientela formada. Recuerda haber comenzado su negocio con un pequeño local vendiendo empanadas y fue creciendo con los años. Ella es una persona luchadora, se levanta a las 5:00 de la mañana para iniciar su trabajo para tener listo sus ricas empanadas y comestibles en general. La Sra. comenta que antes de este negocio tenía un Cyber, el cual vendió para hacerse de capital e invertir en su negocio actual.
Solicitó apoyo crediticio a la Fundación Paraguaya  para comprar más carne para sus alimentos, de esa manera podrá aumentar sus productos y el buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria D. is 25 years old, single, without children, and lives in Clarita Calle Gimenez, a residential area in the city of Coronel Oviedo.

Mrs. Maria sells meat pies, breaded meat and beverages to an established customer base.  She remembers having established her business in a small stand selling meat pies and has been able to expand her business over the years.  She is a hard-working person who gets up at 5:00 a.m. to begin her work day and prepare her delicious pies and food in general.  Maria says she used to have a cyber-café which she sold to obtain the necessary capital to invest in her current business.

She plans to use the loan obtained through the Paraguaya Foundation to buy more meat for her products.  In this way she will be able to increase her products and improve service to customers.

loans.use: To buy meat and beverages

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es:
Ricardina, tiene 43 años de edad, es padre y madre para sus tres hijos, ella nació en la ciudad del cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. 

Ricardina es una madre  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella tienen un pequeña tienda de abarrotes y está ubicado en su domicilio donde expende sus productos a sus vecinos, ella abre muy temprano la tienda aproximadamente a las 6 de la mañana y cierra la tienda a las 10 de la noche. Ya son 12 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. 

Ricardina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo azúcar, fideos, arroz y otras cosas más.    

Ricardina pertenece al banco comunal “Sol de Oro” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ricardina is 43 years old and assumes the role of both father and mother to her three children. She was born in the city of Cusco and still lives there. Ricardina is a hardworking and enterprising mother who succeeds on behalf of her family. She has a small grocery store located in her home where she offers her products to her neighbors. Ricardina opens her store very early at approximately 6am and closes at 10pm. She has been in this business for twelve years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. Ricardina is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy more merchandise such as sugar, noodles, rice, and other products.

Ricardina is a member of the Communal Bank “Sol de Oro” (Golden Sun), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity being given to her and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, noodles, rice, and other products for her store.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita L. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old. Nenita is married. To make a living, Nenita owns & operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) shop selling products for daily use, such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & beverages, in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & beverages to sell. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Nenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & beverages to sell

loans.name: Martha Olivia

texts.es:
La clienta Martha Olivia A. Gutiérrez.   Vive en el municipio de el Sauce Frente al granero del departamento león, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo trabaja actual mente en su propio negocio donde le brinda el servicio a los habitante del municipio. 
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación su negocio de brindarle servicio a la población en general, y un negocio de comediría. 
El destino del crédito es para darle mantenimiento y reparación a su propio molino. 
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones el bien estar de su familia y obtener un mejor ingreso
texts.en:
The client is Martha Olivia A. Gutiérrez.  She lives in the El Sauce municipality, in front of the granary of the department of León.  She has one child in her care, and currently works in her own business providing services to the residents of the area.

She has a house where she has her own food business.  The loan would be destined to maintain and repair her mill.  This will allow her to obtain better income, and therefore support her family under better conditions.

loans.use: make repairs to her mill.

loans.name: Dagbegnikin1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement DAGBEGNIKIN1 est composé de 13 membres qui habitent tous le même quartier et qui pratiquent tous la même religion. La présidente de ce groupement, du nom de Sylvie Estelle, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé.
Sylvie Estelle est née en 1973 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé. Sylvie Estelle est mariée à un agent commercial nommé Ibrahim et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple supporte ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Il y a près de neuf ans que Sylvie Estelle et sa famille se sont installées à Logbozounkpa dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Sylvie Estelle mène comme activité la vente de tissus, des mêches et de chaussures par le système de distribution, ce qui l'aide à subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Sylvie Estelle achète ses produits au Nigéria, État voisin du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Sylvie Estelle sollicite ensemble avec ses autres membres, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est de renforcer davantage son activité afin d'accroître son revenu.
texts.en:
The group DAGBEGNIKIN1 is composed of thirteen members who all live in the same district and who practice the same religion. The group's president, named Sylvie Estelle, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. With the goal of elevating their business in order to cope better with customer demand, this group is requesting for a second time financial support from ALIDé.

Sylvie Estelle was born in 1973 in Adjohoun, in Ouémé county. She is married to a business representative named Ibrahim and is the mother of four children, who are all in school. Together, the couple meet the various household expenses. 

Almost nine years ago, Sylvie and her family settled in Logbozounkpa, in the community of Abomey Calavi. Her work involves selling cloth, hair extensions, and shoes via the distribution system. This helps her to support herself and her children. She buys her products in Nigeria, a state neighboring Benin.

With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying her customer base, Sylvie, along with the other group members, is requesting a loan from ALIDé. Her ambition is to strengthen her business further, so as to grow her revenues.

loans.use: to buy cloth, hair extensions, and shoes

loans.name: Perpetua Wanjiku

texts.en: Perpetua Wanjiku is 39 years old, married, has two children and has for the last two years made a living by running a pharmacy and cosmetics shop. She earns about 13,000 Kenyan shillings a month. She learned about KADET from one of our staff members and is now applying for her first loan. She wants to use the loan to buy more medicines and cosmetics to sell to her customers. She hopes to expand her shop and become a wholesaler because she believes this will allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy medicines and cosmetics to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is a 34-year-old married man and a father of three children. He lives in Botwa on the outskirts of Kitale town. Caleb keeps poultry, which he sells when they have matured. He has been in this business for three years now and earns a monthly income of 16,000 Kenyan Shillings.
This will be Caleb's second loan from Kiva partner, KADET. He plans to use the entire loan to buy more chicks to rear and then sell later at a profit. With the income that he will get, he plans to plough back into the business. In the future, he wants to expand his business and also support his family financially.

loans.use: to buy poultry for resale.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.en:
Eloy is married with three children, two in college and one in high school.  He has had a small grain business for the last ten years, the skills for which he learned working on farms in his earlier years.  Eloy works long hours each day selling his basic grains in an effort to provide a better life for his family.  His dream is to make enough money to be able to finish construction on the rooms in his house.  

The loan will assist Eloy buy more basic grain products that he will then be able to sell to his willing buyers.

loans.use: to buy more basic grain products.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith, de 54 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Arnulfo de 54 años y su querida nieta Angi de 8 años, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Edith toda su vida ha trabajado mucho por salir adelante, actualmente tiene una tienda donde vende de todo, la cual es muy visitada por sus clientes, ya que ella es muy alegre y siempre los atiende muy bien. A ella le gusta mucho conversar con sus clientes, lleva 9 años en este negocio y anhela que su tienda se convierta en la principal de su barrio, pero sabe que tiene que trabajar duro para lograrlo. Lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda y soportar el calor que hace ahí, ya que su trabajo le exige quedarse tiempo completo y no tiene tiempo para dedicarle a su familia o salir a distraerse un rato. Pero su fin es salir adelante y tener un futuro mejor. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, se siente muy feliz de haberlo obtenido y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ella es nueva en su banco comunal y ha sido bien recibida por el resto de las socias, por lo cual se siente muy contenta. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para mejorar el stock  de su tienda.
texts.en:
Edith, 54, is a very friendly and straightforward woman. She lives in her own home along with her husband Arnulfo, 54, and her dear granddaughter Angi, 8, on whom she wishes to bestow a better future. Edith has worked long hours all her life to get ahead. Currently she has a shop where she sells a bit of everything, and which is frequently shopped by her customers, since she is very cheerful and always very attentive to their needs. She really enjoys conversing with her customers. She has had this business for nine years and would like her store to become the main shop in her neighborhood, but she knows she must work hard in order to achieve that. What she likes the least is having to stay indoors all day and tolerate the heat inside the store, since her work demands that she remain there full time and she does not have time to devote to her family or to go out and amuse herself for a bit. However, her goal is to get ahead and have a better future. 

This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is very happy to have received it and is willing to make all her payments on time. She is new in her communal bank and has been well received by the rest of the members which makes her very happy. With the twenty-five hundred nuevos soles she has requested she will buy more products to improve the line of merchandise in her store.

loans.use: to purchase staple items for stocking her store.

loans.name: Dimas Marin

texts.es:
Dimas, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 11 y 15 años de edad, es empleado como vigilante de la alcaldía, además es albañil, su familia depende de él.
Actualmente esta remodelando parte de su vivienda, para lo que solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en materiales de construcción, arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra, esta financiamiento le ayudara a mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y mantenerla más segura en la época más lluviosa.
Su misión es trabajar por ofrecer a su familia una vida digna, mejorando las condiciones de la vivienda y ofreciéndoles alimentación y salud.
texts.en:
Dimas lives with his wife and 2 children, who are 11 and 15.  He works as a security guard for the city.  He is also a construction worker, and his family depends on him.

He is currently remodeling part of his home, which is why he is requesting a loan to invest in construction materials like sand, cement, and labor.  This financing will help him improve the condition of his home and keep it safe in the rainy season.  His goal is to work to offer his family a decent life, to improve their living conditions, and to offer them nutrition and health.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Juhudi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Christine, leader du groupe d’affaire « Juhudi »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 50 ans, mariée, mère de 10 enfants qui étudient tous et d’autres ont leurs propres foyers. Elle est  vendeuse de tissus dames. Son mari est un hôtelier cuisinier. Elle installe ses marchandises au long de la rue ambiante des avenues. Il y a 9 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  20 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  2 ballons de tissus (draps de lit).  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et acheter une parcelle pour y construire confortablement.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Juhudi» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en:
The customer, Christine, is the leader of the Juhudi business group. She is a fifty-year old entrepreneur, married, and a mother of ten; all the children have schooling, and some have their own families. She retails fabrics to ladies. Her husband is a hotel cook.
She displays her merchandise along active streets and avenues. She has been doing business in this way for over nine years. However, she just went through 20 loan cycles with Hekima's lending. This new loan should allow her to stock up with two bundles of fabrics (bed sheets). In addition, her ambition is to keep her children in school and to buy a lot to build a comfortable house.
The customer thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women excluded from traditional banking. It should be noted that a majority of group Juhudi's members are women.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of fabric (bed sheets).

loans.name: Flor De San Antonio Group

texts.es:
La señora Elvira Lucia es casada, tiene 52 años D. edad, a cursado los 5 años D. educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos y ninguno está estudiando, se dedica a las actividades pecuarias, a la crianza D. animales domésticos, específicamente a la crianza D. cerdos, inicia este trabajo criando pollos ponedoras, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo en el trabajo que realiza.

DeciD. organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital D. trabajo,  va a comprar as cerdos para crianza, y cuando estos crezcan los pueda vender y pueda recuperar su inversión. Ya que quiere contar  con una pequeña granja. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades: crianza D. animales, confección D. prendas, y a la venta D. ropa.
texts.en:
Elvira Lucia is married and is 52 years old.  She has a 5th graD. education, and has 4 children, none of whom are in school.  She works in livestock raising domesticated animals, particularly pigs.  She started out raising layer chickens, and she has the support of her husband in this work. 

She decided to organize a group to request a loan that will allow her to increase her working capital.  She is going to buy pigs to raise; when they grow she will be able to sell them and recoup her investment.  She wants to have a small farm.  The other members of this group have different businesses, including: raising animals, making garments and selling clothing.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise

loans.name: Bolivar

texts.es: Bolivar, tiene la edad 52 de  años, está soltero y vive con su madre. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de lechones para la crianza y engorde de ellos. El cuenta con un chiquero y lo que pretende es comprar lechones para darle alimentación con concentrado para su engorde más rápido. El quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su madre y crecer con el proyecto de cría de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Bolivar is 52 years old. He is single and lives with his mother. With this loan he hopes to purchase piglets to raise and fatten them. He has a pig pen and he wants to purchase piglets so that he can give them food with concentrate to fatten them up faster. He wants his animals to reach an ideal weight so that he can then sell them in the town market and in neighboring areas. He wants to generate a greater amount of income for his well-being and for that of his mother and to expand his business raising pigs.

This is his first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. Previously he had not received other loans from state-run banks, but FUDECOSUR granted him this loan with more ease and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to fatten.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support 5 children. She is married and has a sari-sari store in the Philippines.

Susan requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.  She is getting the Envirofit stove because she wants to save money by using the dried wood she can pick form her surroundings.  Susan is aware that by using the Envirofit stove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Sarun (in the photo) is a rice farmer. She lives along National Road Five, about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has one son and two daughters. One of her children is married and the other two are garment workers. 

Sarun is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase one more cow to assist her by plowing her rice farmland.

loans.use: To purchase one more cow for plowing her farmland.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es: Yenny, de 26 años es una mujer feliz. Cuenta que convivió con Juan desde hace 10 años, pero hace 3 se caso. Producto de su amor nacieron sus 2 hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Su principal pilar es su familia, junto a ellos comenzó a laborar en la agricultura. Su principal sembrío consta de papa en toda su variedad. Lo que más le gusta es pasar tiempo con su familia y poder dedicarse a otras actividades. Ya tiene 5 años de experiencia y en todo este tiempo logró obtener buenos clientes, pues cuenta, que en cada cosecha vende su producción al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma pero la semilla lo comercializa en el mismo terreno productivo. Asimismo cuenta con 2 toros para el arado, pero en tiempos de escasez lo alquila para obtener un dinero extra. Como también las 2 vacas lechera con los que hace queso. Ahora tiene sembrado papa, según cuenta espera obtener 30 sacos de producción. Con ello logrará buenos ingresos para está temporada. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Progreso Cayan” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Yenny tiene sembrado papa de la variedad “canchan” por ello de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Yenny, age 26, is a happy woman.  She has lived with Juan for ten years, and three years ago they got married.  They have two children who she takes care of in her own house, which is in the rural community of Cumutay.  Her family is her mainstay.  

She started working in agriculture together with her family.  Her main crop consists of potatoes of all varieties.  What she likes the most is spending time with her family and being able to engage in other activities.  She has five years of experience, and in all of that time she has managed to get good customers.  She sells the production of each harvest at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  However, she sells the seeds at her fertile land.

She also has two bulls for the plough.  However, during times of scarcity she rents them to get extra money.  In addition, she has two dairy cows.  She uses their milk to make cheese.

She now has potatoes planted, and she says that she hopes to get 30 sacks of production.  With that she will manage to get good income for this season.

She belongs to the Progreso Cayan Communal Bank, and this is her first loan with MFP.  She hopes for support from all of you in order to continue working towards her objectives.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments.

Yenny has planted the “canchan” (has a pink, thin skin; the meat is of a pale whitish color) variety of potato.  Upon receiving your support she will use the requested money to buy natural fertilizers in order to improve her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy everything for his store (PlayStation, billiards, food, furniture)

loans.name: Rito

texts.es: El Sr. Rito es un hombre que  gracias  a su esfuerzo  y dedicación a  salido  adelante  día  con día, gracias  a su esfuerzo a  lagrado  adquirir   su  vivienda y   continuar   brindándoles   a  sus  hijos  una excelente   estabilidad  económica,  en   esta ocasión  el esta   muy contento  de  habernos  encontrado  ya  que  en este  momento como   apenas  inicia   el periodo  escolar  requiere   realizar  la compra de uniformes  y útiles  escolares  para  que  sus  pequeños  hijos  continúen con el estudio  ya que  esta es  la mejor  herencia  que  les  puede   brindar, en esta  ocasión sus  hijos   no pudieron  salir   en la   fotografía   por   el  horario  que   ellos  tienen  en su  escuela.
texts.en:
Rito is a man who, thanks to his effort and dedication, has gotten ahead day by day.  Thanks to his effort he has managed to acquire his home and continue giving his children excellent economic stability.

Right now he is very happy that he has found us, since currently the school year is beginning and he needs to buy uniforms and school supplies so his little children will continue with their studies.  This is the best legacy he can offer them.

His children couldn't be in this photograph because of their school schedule.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms and supplies.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 42 years old and married with two children.

Jennifer works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Jennifer has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for ten years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Jennifer aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, a 24-year-old married father of one, operates a fruit-vending enterprise in Malindi town. In business for the past five years, he earns a monthly income of about Kshs. 12,000 which he uses to help support his family.

Peter has applied for his second loan of Kshs. 50,000 from KADET LTD. in order to purchase assorted fruits and vegetables to sell. He will use the anticipated additional profits to continue supporting his family as well as his child's education.

loans.use: to buy more assorted fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a resident and a farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya. He is married with 5 children, all of school-going age. His farm currently produces tea, which he sells to Kenya Tea Development Authority, as well as milk and maize, which go to the local market. 

Elijah has requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chuff cutter at 50,000 KES and to construct a dairy unit at 30,000 KES. He says he expects improvement in his milk production due to better feeding and protection with the existence of the dairy unit. He adds the income will ensure a better livelihood for his entire family.

He says that the high cost of dairy feed takes up much of the farming costs, especially during dry seasons.

loans.use: To purchase a chuff cutter and construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Nasieko

texts.en:
Nasieko is a modest business lady from the Nkararo area of Kilgoris County in Kenya. She is married to her husband Elijah and they have two children, both over 18 years although both are still under their care.

Nasieko sells cereals in Nkararo and has been running this business for the last ten years and thus has vast experience. She sells mainly maize cereals due to its big demand and ready markets and makes a monthly income of 11,400 Kenya shillings (KES). She is taking her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more maize cereals to boost her current stock.

She hopes to make enough profits, which she will use to invest in farming. Her dream is to expand her business and support her family through provision of basic needs and wants.

loans.use: To buy more maize cereals for sale.

loans.name: Sayyora

texts.ru: Сайёра проживает в районе Пяндж. Ей 41 год. Она разведена. У нее один ребенок. Сайёра занимается торговлей. Она в основном продает яблоки. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для покупки фруктов.
texts.en: Sayyora lives in the Pyandj district.  She is 41 years old, divorced and has one child.  Sayyora is involved in sales.  She primarily sells apples and has been in this business for four years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fruits.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, tangerines and oranges

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 28-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of one and ten. Two of them go to school. 

Monica runs a small food business, and she has been in the business for four years. She has two employees. Monica heard about Finance Sudan through the fellow clients and outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of 1,500 SSP to purchase more food items like cabbage, meat, flour, and many other things. In addition to this business, Monica has no other source of income.

In five years time, Monica would hope to change it to a restaurant. Her major challenges include paying school fees and home expenses. 
Monica says that, she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support, especially for women, for helping them get capital to start up a small-scale business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like cabbage, meat, flour, and many other things

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a responsible house wife, Mary Jane owns and manages a variety store in their village to generate income. She is 37 years-old and has one school-age child. She and her husband aim to improve their variety store and their rice farming business in order to have a viable source of income in the future. 

In this regard, Mary Jane wants to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demand. But due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an a loan of P25,000 in order to buy soft drinks, biscuits, candies, noodles, canned goods, junk food, rice and load wallets for sale. She believes that her patience and hard work will make her business grow and be profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, biscuits, candies, noodles, canned goods, junk food, rice and load wallets to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Cristina Berenisse

texts.es: Cristina, solicita otro crédito con el objetivo de solventar varias deudas como cancelando letras de artículos electrodomesticos del hogar y de matrículas de colegio, el préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho pues pudo solventar lo que tenía pendiente y de esa forma mejoro en los ingresos y pudo ayudar mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Cristina is requesting another loan with the goal of paying off various debts, such as canceling the payments for household electrical appliances and for school enrollment.  The previous loan helped her a lot because she was able to pay what was pending and so she improved her income and was better able to help her family.

loans.use: to cancel the payments for appliances and school enrollment.

loans.name: Christian Robert

texts.es:
Christian Robert tiene 20 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la tía en ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Cristian se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz además tiene animales para poder criarlos. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para arrendar más terrenos y poder sembrar en mayor cantidad para obtener mejores ingresos.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar abonos y arrendar más terrenos. El sueño es poder comprar una casa y un carro.

 En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar villa y pelota.
texts.en:
Christian Robert is 20 years old.  He is single and doesn't have any children.  He lives with an aunt in Ventanas, in los Ríos province.

Christian is a member of "LA UNION" community bank which is located in Aguas Frías, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Christian is a farmer who grows corn.  He also raises animals.  He makes his sales and purchases in Ventanas.

Christian is requesting this loan to rent more land and to grow his crops in larger quantities so that he can make better income.  The help of this loan will enable him to buy fertilizers and rent more land.  His dream is to buy a house and a car.

In his free time, Christian enjoys playing pool and soccer.

loans.use: to rent more land and grow crops in larger quantities

loans.name: Adjedji Joslyne's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la premier fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Adjedji Joslyne (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 38 ans, a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Adjedji Joslyne est mariée à un certain Adeoyé. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Adjedji Joslyne et son mari. Pour cette raison, Adjedji Joslyne vend des tout cousus de façon ambulante depuis dix ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Adjedji Joslyne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Adjedji Joslyne sollicite ensemble avec les membres de son groupe, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des tout cousus.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 52 years old and has six children.  Erlinda is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising goats in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goats to sell.

Erlinda has been raising goats for 10 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goats to sell

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
This description was written by Moses Onygano, who represents Kiva and Village Enterprise Fund in Uganda.

VEF donated 100$ grant to her in the year 1999. She started with a small business of clothes selling. Her business continued well for a period of six months, where she was realizing good profits. In 2002, VEF, organized a training for all the beneficiaries in Tororo District and she was one of the beneficiaries who attended the training.

Eunice sells in a crowded market in Tororo. She ventures from her village to this market every day. She displays the clothes both in and outside the her shop.

She learned how to choose a profitable business strategies. She then decided to widen her business by beginning to sell second hand shoes and creams together with clothes.

Here she got better market where by her profit became so high in her business. A loan will help her because it will allow her to buy in bulk at prices she could have never dreamed of before. Having this loan will allow her to buy from a larger wholeseller who can give a better rate. This will easily double her profit margins on clothes she sells.

Being a focused business woman, I know that she will be helped a lot with this loan for the increase of her business and family as well.

loans.use: Buy bells of used clothing

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda began with a small home business exactly one year ago. She is married and lives with her family in Santa Catarina, Nuevo Leon. Her husband is a day laborer and earns just minimum wage, which does not meet their expenses. She started her business to help cover the household expenses for her husband and their children. With her strength and dedication, and above all with her good humor and love, Rosalinda has been able improve the life of her children and help her husband. Now she needs a loan of $USD925 to purchase merchandise which will increase her sales having a greater variety of products for her customers. You can help Rosalinda and her family with your generosity; you just need to decide. She will be sincerely grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Rosalinda comenzó con un pequeño negocio de abarrotes en su propio domicilio, hace exactamente un año. Ella es casada y vive con su familia en la localidad de Santa Catarina, en el estado de Nuevo León. Su esposo es obrero y gana el salario mínimo, con esto no les alcanzaba, antes de iniciar con el negocio, para cubrir todos lo gastos y necesidades del hogar y de sus hijos. Pero con esfuerzo y dedicación, pero sobre todo con buen ánimo y amor, Rosalinda ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y sobre todo ayudar a su esposo.

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo de $925 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para la compra de mercancía, lo que hará que aumenten sus ventas al tener más surtido para sus clientes. Tu puedes ayudar con tu generosidad a Rosalinda y su familia, únicamente hace falta que te decidas, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: purcahse merchandise

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Eusebia would like to improve the area that she uses for clothing sales. She has had her business for 3 years, and is assisted by her daughter. “The vegetation around my house provides the area with nice shade, but it isn’t enough when the rain interrupts sales and damages the merchandise. I am requesting a $1,200 dollar loan.”

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Eusebia manifiesta el deseo de mejorar el lugar que ocupa para la venta de su ropa ella tiene 3 años haciendo esto, le ayuda su hija. "Tengo muy buena sombra producida por la vegetación de mi casa pero no es suficiente pues las lluvias interrumpen la venta y maltratan la mercancía, el préstamo solicitado es de $1,200.00 dlls".

loans.use: Construction of a thached roof to cover merchandise offered for sale.

loans.name: Mohamed Omari

texts.en: Mohamed opened a hardware shop two years ago near the main road to the southern regions of Tanzania. The shop sells hardware materials and equipment. Among other items in his shop, cement and iron sheets have higher turnover. He want to add a stock of these items before they are depleted in the store. Construction in his area (Mbagala) is on the increase. Mohamed does not like to loose his customers due to stock-outs. The income generated from the business is used to raise the family and any extra is reinvested back into the business. Mohamed is married and has three children. He is in need of USD 1200.

loans.use: To add stock of cement and iron sheets

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru:
Halima J. is 56 years old. She is married with six children. Her husband is retired; three of her older children have their own families; and three younger children work. The youngest son is in school and helps with his mother's business after his studies. For the past fifteen years, Halima has been selling plastic bags. She began her business with only $20 when she did not have a permanent business location. Halima sold material bags that she sewed herself and plastic bags while holding them in her hands.

Halima has been a client of MicroInvest since 2002 when she borrowed $50. After receiving this loan, she purchased a permanent selling spot and increased her sales by $600. In the future, she wants to expand her business to wholesale and to acquire a better selling location.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

Чураева Халима – 56 лет. Замужем, мать шестерых детей. Муж пенсионер, трое старших детей имею свою отдельную семью, трое младших работают. Самый младший учится в школе, после школы помогает матери в торговле. Она занимается реализацией пластиковых пакетов, вот уже 15 лет. Начала свою деятельность с 20$ без определенного место деятельности. Она продавала держа в руках пластиковые пакеты и пакеты которые шила дома сама.

Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» стала в 2002 году, тогда активы её составляли 50$. После получения займа она приобрела постоянное место деятельности, увеличила товарооборот на 600$. В будущем хочет перейти на оптовую продажу и улучшить место деятельности.

loans.use: To move to wholesale operations and acquire a better business location

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Mrs. Hang S., in her mid-30s, grows rice crops in her rice paddy while her husband works as a fisherman. Together they earn about $2.50 per day. They have five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory earning $70 per month each, two are students, and one is unemployed. To take full advantage of the rainy season, she would like to borrow $800 to purchase a boat with a motor and a fishing net to catch fish more efficiently during the plentiful rainy season. The extra income they can save during the monsoon season helps them survive during the dry months of the year when there is no fishing. The increased income will also help finance their children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase a boat with a motor and a fishing net.

loans.name: Marta Nidia

texts.es:
Before starting her business, Marta Nidia worked in a shoe store, which is where she got the idea for her own business. She lacked the capital to start herself, so she saved some, and with the help of her ex-husband, managed to save $70 and started to work as a traveling salesperson in the Israel Lewites district in the city of Managua.

Her family – husband and children – is what drove her to look for a way to help with the monetary needs of the household, but after her separation, she is driven entirely by the need to sustain and educate her children.

Marta has worked with CEPRODEL for two years and feels that it has had a good impact on her working life as well as her income. The financing that has been granted has improved her inventory, and her inventory has led to successful financing. Her current record consists of thirteen credits, which have helped her progress in the last few years.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Marta Nidia trabajaba antes de tener su negocio en un local de venta de zapatos, de ahí surge la idea de su propio negocio. Sin embargo no contaba con el capital para empezar por si sola, es entonces que ahorra un poco y con la ayuda de su ex-esposo (asalariado) logra reunir U$70.00 y comenzar a vender por su cuenta de manera ambulante en el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de managua.

Su familia (matrimonio e hijos) fue lo que la llevo a buscar como ayudar en las necesidades monetarias de su hogar, sin embargo luego de una separacion se dedico a trabajar por entero para el sustento de sus hijos y para la educación de los mismos.

Hace 2 años que Marta trabaja con CEPRODEL, y siente que ha tenido un buen impacto en su vida laboral como en sus ingresos, ya que con el financiamiento otorgado logra retroalimentar su inventario, su récord es de 13 créditos, mismos que la han hecho progresar en estos últimos años.

loans.use: Purchase shoes for merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue investing in a variety of fruit

loans.name: Myrian

texts.en:
Myrian is a young woman entrepreneur who owns a convenience store. This is thanks to the help of her parents who gave her the initial capital. Apart from running the convenience store, Myrian is also a university student. Both attending school and working at her grocery store has proven to be difficult. However, she enjoys the challenge and has managed to keep up good grades. She was awarded an initial loan from the Fundación Paraguaya and invested and utilized it to purchase more merchandise to sell.

Myrian thought it would be impossible to survive running a convenience store while attending school; however with the help of Fundación Paraguaya she was given a loan to help with the expenses of her store. She knows that in order to be financially secure in the future she must continue with her studies and graduate with a degree. Her plan is to follow the same road as her sisters who now work in business and live in Spain. With this loan, Myrian will continue to increase the size and quality of her store, and will also continue to advance in the business world.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her convenience store.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María is 37 years old and married with a 10-year-old son. Her husband works in an auto mechanic workshop and she helps him with the household expenses. She does this through a small business selling cosmetics and perfumes door-to-door. Her clients are her neighbors, friends and relatives. She would like to buy cosmetics so she can offer and distribute them to the people she visits. She wants to help her young son get ahead and to be able to provide him with the education he needs to become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Maria, tiene 37 años de edad y es casada, tiene a un hijo de 10 años de edad a su cargo. Su esposo trabaja en un taller de mecánica automotriz, ella lo apoya en los gastos de la casa. Y esto lo hace mediante un pequeño negocio que realiza de forma ambulante, vende cosméticos y perfumes. Los clientes son vecinos de comunidad, amigos y familiares. La señora desea comprar cosméticos para ofertarlos y distriburilos entre las personas que visita. Desea poder sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo y poderle dar los estudios necesarios para que llegue a ser un profesional.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en: Amina I., Zakia M., Rehema M., and Helleni K. make up the Saana group. For the past 10 years, Amina I., the group leader, has run a shop selling traditional medicine. She travels in different parts of the country selling her products, and getting the medicine, as most of it is made from herbs. She and her group members are requesting a loan to help them expand their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase herbal medicine and sell products

loans.name: Roze's Group

texts.en:
Roze B. is married and a mother of two boys. She has been living in Mian Channu, a small city in Pakistan, for the last twelve years. Her husband has been trading livestock for the last five years. They are requesting a loan to improve their livestock trading; this way their income will increase and they will renovate their house.

Roze B. has several other members in her group: Nasreen B. and Rozeena B. both require buying animals for their livestock trading; Elizbeth will use the loan to improve their farming, and Mariam B. needs to start a grocery store. In this group loan, the funds will be distributed among group members, each of whom will invest in their own or their household businesses.

loans.use: Improve their livestock trading business

loans.name: Agbuidohoin

texts.fr:
Born in 1968 in Tabligbo (Prefecture of Yoto), Mrs. Agbuidohoim A. currently lives in the village of Amégnran.

Married to a man, she is the mother of five (5) children. Thanks to the sale of foodstuffs, she is able to take care of her needs and those of her family. But ever since she faced a lack of funds, her business has declined considerably.

For her stability and the security of her business, she is asking for a loan in order to respond to her problems. She is absolutely sure that this project will be very beneficial to her, in that it will let her respond to her difficulties.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1968 à Tabligbo (préfecture de Yoto), madame Agbuidohoin A. vit présentement dans le village d’Amégnran.

Marié d’un homme, elle est mère de cinq (05) enfants. C’est à l’aide de la vente de denrées alimentaires qu’elle arrive à prendre en charge ses besoins et ceux de sa famille. Mais depuis qu’elle a eu manque d’argent, son activité a considérablement déchu.

Pour sa stabilité et la mise en confiance de son commerce elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir répondre à ses problèmes. Elle est certainement sûre que ce projet lui sera très avantageux dans la mesure où elle répond à sa difficulté.

loans.use: To stock and sell foodstuffs

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is a 40-year-old mother of five children who lives in Saida South, Lebanon. She owns a lingerie shop and has been working in this sector for the past 12 years. This is the first time Sabah has requested a loan from Al Majmoua, having heard about the institution from a friend who is already a Majmoua client. Sabah needs $800 to purchase new lingerie outfits based on the demand from her clients. She is a trustworthy person who will make sure to fully repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase new lingerie outfits to be sold in her shop.

loans.name: Maïmounatou

texts.fr:
Born around 1982 in Cotonou in Littoral County in the south of Benin, Mrs. Maïmounatou L. is married to Razack Oke, a transit agent at the Autonomous Port of Cotonou. Mrs. Maïmounatou L. is the mother of two children: Idriss (8) in grade 3 and Awèni (4). A skilled cook, she prepares rice, beans and voandzou (a type of groundnut) which she sells in a little shop. In view of her ever growing clientele, she is asking for this loan to grow her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née vers 1982 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral au sud du Bénin, dame L. Maïmounatou est mariée à OKE Razack Agent de transit au Port Autonome de Cotonou. Dame L. Maïmounatou est mère de deux enfants Idriss âgé de 8ans en classe CE1 et Awèni âgée de 4 ans. Douée en restauration, elle prépare du riz, du haricot et du voandzou qu'elle vend dans une boutique. Compte tenu de la clientèle grandissante; elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son activité.

loans.use:
Purchase of 2 sacks of rice, one sack of voandzou (a type of groundnut), and one sack of dried beans

Achat de 2 sacs de riz, d'un sac de voandzou et d'un sac de haricot

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.fr: Née à Cotonou le 11 Janvier 1969 au sud du BENIN et d'ethnie Goun, dame L. Marcelline est mariée à monsieur BAKARI Mamadou, peintre automobile de profession et exerçant à Cotonou. Elle voyage régulièrement sur le GHANA, un pays de la sous région pour l'achat des ustensiles de cuisine, de plastiques, de glacières et de tissus qu'elle livre au détaillant à Cotonou. Il s'agit pour elle d'une activité bien rentable mais nécessitant beaucoup de moyens financiers. Elle vient demander ce prêt pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de satisfaire au mieux ses clients.
texts.en:
Born on January 11, 1969 in Cotonou, southern Benin, Mrs. Marcelline L. is from the Goun ethnic group and is married to Mr. Mamadou Bakari, a car painter by trade who works in Cotonou. She travels regularly to Ghana, a country in the West African sub-region, to buy cooking utensils, plastic containers, iceboxes and cloth, which she supplies to retailers in Cotonou. This is a very profitable business for her but requires considerable financial resources. She is requesting this loan in order to strengthen her working capital so that she can best satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 iceboxes, 3 dozen saucepans, 2 dozen plastic buckets and 15 pieces of cloth.

loans.name: Mwatum's Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Mwatum B. is 30 years old and married with two children aged 10 and 14. She has been a food vendor since 2003. Every day, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mwatum now hopes for a loan to buy more food items to improve her business. She will share this loan with her group members, who also have businesses dealing with shop ownership, home utensils sales, tailoring, firewood and charcoal sales, and bites sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items to improve her business.

loans.name: Nem

texts.en: Nem N., 43, is married and lives with two of her three children in the Kampong Cham province. Working a farm together with her husband, Morm Vin typically makes US$1 each day. Besides farming her husband also works in construction. Her family is also supported by two of the children who work in the garment factory. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Nem N. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$400 to purchase palm leaves to sell, a purchase that she believes can bring an increase to her daily income. Poor people take the palm leaves to build the roof cages for their animals like pigs or cows.

loans.use: Nem would like to purchase palm leaves to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 21 años, convive con su pareja y sus tres hijos Noemí de 6, Yuri de 4 y Roni de 2. Es una joven madre que trabaja muy duro para brindarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro, es así que desde hace 6 años incursionó en el negocio de la venta de combustible con ayuda de su pareja. A Edith se le hace muy gratificante su trabajo, ya que los 6 años de experiencia le han dado ganas de crecer y seguir progresando,  siendo este un negocio muy rentable, ya que tiene muchos clientes, los cuales se han hecho asiduos a su pequeño puesto ambulatorio, lo único complicado es tener que estar constantemente inhalando el olor del combustible que algunas veces llega a marearla, pero estos inconvenientes son mínimos, sabiendo Edith sobrellevarlos. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma y es muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más combustible para poder vender y aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Edith is 21 years old, and lives with her partner and three children: Noemí who is 6 years old, Yuri who is 4, and Roni, 2 years of age. She is a young mother who works very hard to provide a brighter future for her children. It’s for this reason that, six years ago, she started in the business of selling combustible/fuel with the help of her partner. Her work is very gratifying for Edith given that the six years of experience has made her want to grow her enterprise and continue to progress. It is a very profitable business, and she has many customers who have made themselves regulars at her small ambulatory post. The only complication is that she has to constantly inhale the fuel fumes that, at times, make her dizzy. But these inconveniences are minimal, and Edith knows how to endure them. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is very punctual with the payments. With the funds sought, she will buy more fuel to sell and increase her income.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of combustible/fuel that she sells.

loans.name: Taye
