She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory. This will be the fouth loan taken out by Mae Darlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snacks to sell

loans.name: Corazón De Mejia (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
Mejía está localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos, se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Corazón  Mejía. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como el comercio de comida, venta de productos de belleza y prendas de vestir. También prestan servicios como cabinas telefónicas o salones de belleza. Ellos hace seis ciclos se unieron para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Dolores, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 17 y 12 años los mismos que estudian en colegio. El marido es agricultor.

Ella y su esposo  con la ayuda de sus hijos siembran maíz, maní, frutas como melón y sandias, estos los cultivan en todo el año ya que cuentan con terrenos que están cerca algún rio y bombean el agua hasta los cultivos,  trabajan de lunes a viernes desde  las 7h00 hasta las 12h00 y de13h00 hasta las 15h00, los productos cuando es tiempo de cosecha los entregan a los comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para comprárselos y llevarlos a otras ciudades.

Este crédito es para comprar, insumos agrícolas, fertilizantes químicos y abono para tener una buena cosecha. Ella está en el Banco Comunal dos ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda y porque no piden tantos requisitos para otorgar los créditos.

Su sueño es que su casa sea de cemento ya que la que tiene es de caña.
texts.en:
Mejia is located a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo, a city of people who generally work in agriculture and in growing and selling coconut.  Every 15 days, the Corazon Mejia Village Bank meets.  The members of the bank work in various industries such as food sales, beauty product sales, and clothing sales.  They also offer services like telephone service and beauty salons.  Six seasons ago, they formed a group to be able to take advantage of the benefits offered through Fundacion Espoir.

In this place, we got to know Dolores: she is 40 years old and is in a common-law marraige with her spouse, with whome she has two children who are 12 and 17.  Both of her children are still students.  Her husand is a farmer.

With the help of their children, she and her husband raise corn, peanuts, and fruit like melons and watermelons.  They can raise these crops all year as their land is close to a river and they are able to easily irrigate their crops.  They work Monday to Friday from 7 am to noon and from 1 pm to 3 pm.  When it is harvest time, they deliver their crops to the salesmen who come to their home to buy them; the salesmen take them to other cities to sell.

This loan to buy agriculture products, seeds, chemical fertilizers and other fertilizer to have a good harvest.  She has been in the village bank for 2 seasons and she likes it beause of the help she receives and because they don't ask for so many prerequisites to give loans.

Her dream is have a house made of cement since her current home is made of cane/reeds.

loans.use: to purchase agriculture products, chemical fertilizers, and other fertilizers.

loans.name: Zoryana

texts.en:
Zoryana is a market entrepreneur from Novomoskovsk. She sells household supplies and fishing items in the central marketplace of her home town. She is an entrepreneur of determination and focus. She has been working in this sphere of trade for over ten years. Currently, she makes over $1010 of net profit each month. 

Zoryana is seeking a loan of 20,000 UAH to purchase additional merchandise and to re-stock her inventory for the summer season. She likes working with this type of merchandise even though many think it is strange that she sells men’s fishing supplies along with other items like knives, axes and blades. Zoryana is hoping to continue growing her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise and to re-stock her inventory for the summer season.

loans.name: Jose Manfredis

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 14, 13 y 12 años de edad, todos estudian y dependen económicamente de él, residen en la ciudad de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de tortas mexicanas, hamburguesas y tortillas, fue iniciativa propia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos para elaborar los platillos: pan especial, lechugas, carnes, jamón, aderezos, y más ingredientes que son usados en su producción.
Este préstamo le ayudara a surtir el negocio y tener la disponibilidad para aumentar sus ventas; Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio, poder estabilizarse y generar mayores ganancias para su familia.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his wife and their three children, aged 14, 13, and 12. They are all in school and they are financially dependent on him. They live in the city of San Miguel. He sells mexican hamburgers, hamburgers, and tortillas. He started under his own initiative.

He requests a loan to purchase products to prepare his foods: special bread, lettuce, meats, jam, salad dressing, and other ingredients that are used in preparation.

This loan will help him supply his business and to have the capacity to increase his sales. His aspiration is to expand his business, to stabilize it, and to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase special bread, lettuce, meats, jam, and dressings.

loans.name: Ahadi Group

texts.fr: Le client Bembeleza, représentant du groupe d’affaire « Ahadi », est entrepreneur, âgé de 34 ans, marié, père de 5 enfants, tous étudient. il est vendeur de souliers. Il s’entraide mutuellement dans les affaires  avec son epouse dans la vente de souliers  au marché central de Virunga. Il ya 3 ans révolus qu’il exerce cette activité avec son epouse. Cependant, il démarrait son activité avec un fonds reçu de son beau père sous forme d’assistance non remboursable. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’acheter  35 paires de souliers à revendre. En plus, il ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et avoir sa propre parcelle. Le client, représentant du groupe d'affaires Ahadi, remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres et gagnes petits exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire «Ahadi» est majoritairement féminins. Parfois, les maris (hommes)agissent valablement au nom de leurs femmes lors des opérations de remboursement et d’octroi de crédit pour la bonne marche des affaires.
texts.en:
Representing the loan group "Ahadi" is a businessman aged 34, married and the father of five children, all enrolled in school. Hesells shoes. He and his wife work at selling shoes together at the Virunga central open-air market.   

They have been working at this business together for three years. They were able to start it up with money given them by their father as a gift, not a loan. The present loan will be used to buy 35 pairs of shoes for resale. Moreover, they would like to grow their business, pay school fees for their children, and have their own plot of land. 

This client, who represents the Ahadi group, thanks Hekima for its work on behalf of the poor and of those who earn little, who are excluded from the conventional banking system. It must be noted that the business group "Ahadi" is mostly made up of women. Sometimes husbands are authorized to act in the name of their wives when repayments are made or the loan amount is handed over, to facilitate such transactions.

loans.use: to buy 35 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el departamento de Managua la señora Maritza Del Carmen es una persona que se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy trabajadora en campo de comercio, para darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia y así salir adelante para el futuro de sus hijos.
En esta oficina de Ceprodel se presentó a solicitar crédito la señora Maritza Del Carmen para invertir en su negocio de un pequeño taller, este crédito lo utilizara para compra de materiales como tela tales como delantales, gabachas, cobertores.
texts.en:
In the Department of Managua, Maritza Del Carmen stands out for being a woman that works very hard in commerce to be able to provide a his family with a better standard of living and to get ahead for her children’s future this way.

Maritza Del Carmen came by this Ceprodel office to request a loan to invest in her small workshop.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise like fabric, aprons, “gabachas” (vest style smocks) and coveralls.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Grassi

texts.es: Grassi, de 40 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El puesto de comida de Grassi es el más concurrido de su barrio en la ciudad de Pucallpa, todos los días sus clientes se dan cita en su puesto para degustar los deliciosos platillos que prepara. Ella es una cocinera muy hábil y es que desde muy pequeña aprendió a cocinar observando a su madre y ahora se siente muy feliz realizando este trabajo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar es por eso que lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender sola a todas las personas que concurren a su puesto de comida.  Con el paso de los meses, espera mejorar la infraestructura de su puesto de comida y así tener más clientes. Este será su décimo segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas ollas y utensilios, ya que los que usa están deteriorados.
texts.en:
Grassi, age 40, is a friendly and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her four beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Grassi’s food stand is the busiest in her neighborhood within the city of Pucallpa. Every day her customers gather at her stand to enjoy the delicious dishes she prepares. She is a skilled cooked who learned her trade at a young age by watching her mother prepare food. Now she is happy to be performing this type of work. What she enjoys most about her job is cooking with great care. Grassi has been in business for four years and considers the most difficult part to be attending to all of her customers when her food stand is busy. Within a few months, she hopes to improve the infrastructure of her food stand so that she can serve more customers.

This will be her twelfth loan with MFP. Grassi hopes to gain everyone’s support. She is a very active participant within her Communal Bank. The loan of 2000 PEN what she is requesting will be used to buy new pots and utensils since the equipment she currently uses is deteriorating.

loans.use: to purchase pots and utensils.

loans.name: Union Obregon Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Union Obregon" porque asi se llama la colonia donde esta el grupo, esta ubicado en el estado de Morelos en Mexico, el grupo esta conformado por 8 integrantes y es la cuarta vez que solicitan un prestamo. Fabiola es integrante del grupo, tiene 26 años, estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria, es comerciante, tiene en total 3 hijos una mujer y 2 varones, ella se dedica a la venta de parguas, negocio que inicio hace 6 años, solicita este prestamo para comprar más paraguas por mayoreo para que le den mejor precio y de diferentes modelos, tamaños y colores ya que es la temporada de lluvias y es cuando tiene mayores ventas, sus clientes se sienten contentos porque con ella encuentran una gran variedad en paraguas, ademas de los precios accesibles que les brinda, al momento de solicitar el prestamo se siente contenta porque tendra la oportunidad de invertir en su negocio, quiere este prestamo para comprar mercancia, con las ganancias que obtenga pagara las inscripciones de la escuela de sus hijos.
texts.en: This group is called  "Union Obregon" because this is the name of the colony where they are located.  It is in the Morelos state in Mexico.  The group is made up of 8 members and this is the fourth time that they request a loan.  Fabiola is a member of the group.  She is 26 years old, attended through the third year of high school and is a merchant.  She has 3 children, one girl and two boys.  She sells umbrellas, a business that she started 6 years ago.  She is requesting this loan to buy more umbrellas at wholesale, this way getting better pricing and different styles, sizes and colors. Since it is the rainy season, this is when she has the best sales.  Her customers are happy because she provides a good variety of umbrellas and also reasonable prices.  At the time of the loan request, she feels happy to be able to invest in her business.  She wants the loan to buy merchandise and she will use the income that she obtains to enroll her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more umbrellas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Margarita Del Rocío

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Margarita tiene 30 años de edad, está casada, y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 5, 3 años y un bebé de 8 meses, el mayor de ellos este año empezó a estudiar el primer año de escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de atún en Manta.
op>
Ella para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de  ropa de todo tipo y bisutería, trabaja los viernes, sábados y domingos y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta. Además de esto también se está dedicando a la cría de pollos y chanchos, nos cuenta que lo hace en su casa y que le está dejando muy buenos ingresos, además como es en su casa está al tanto del cuidado de sus animalitos y tampoco descuida a sus hijos que están pequeños, ella entrega sus animalitos a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, bisutería y alimento para los animales. Es socia del Grupo De Crédito hace ya 8 años y le gusta por la responsabilidad de sus compañeras. 

Su sueño es tener un bazar.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora community bank meets twice a month in Montecristi, an Ecuadorean town famous for being the birthplace of El Viejo Luchador (The Old Fighter), Eloy Alfaro, and for the straw hats that are made here and so admired inside the country and out.  

We met Margarita, 30, at the bank.  She and her husband have three children, 5-years, 3-years and 8-months old, respectively.  Her oldest child just started school.  Her husband works in a tuna processing plant in Manta.

In order to help her husband with household expenses, Margarita operates a business selling clothing and jewelry.  She works Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays, going door to door in search of customers.  She earns extra money raising chickens and pigs, a business that she operates at her house.  The business makes good money and she's happy with it because she can work at home and take care of her young children at the same time.  She sells the animals to passing wholesalers.

Margarita will use this loan to buy merchandise for her retail business and feed for her animal-sales business.  She has been a member of the community bank for 8 years and likes it because the other members are responsible.  

She hopes one day to open a shop selling all kinds of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business and feed for her animal-sales business.

loans.name: Ivania Regina

texts.es: La señora Ivania Regina, vive en el departamento del sauce, tiene 3 hijos es madre soltera y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Posee un negocio que es una pulpería donde comercializa productos de primera necesidad. La señora es muy conocida en su comarca por lo que ya ha formado una gran cantidad de clientes. Ella se considera una persona muy trabajadora, ella lucha por generar más ingresos, para que de esa forma pueda solventar los gastos de la casa. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, lácteos y granos básicos para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en: Ivania Regina lives in Sauce Department.  She has three children and is a single mother with a strong desire to get ahead.  She has a grocery store where she sells basic need items.  She is very well known in her area so has acquired a good number of customers.  She considers herself to be a very hard working person who strives to generate more income so that she can cover household expenses.  She’s asking for the loan to buy beverages, foodstuffs, dairy products and basic grains to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Doña Amelia tiene 54 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de abarroteria, es casada, tiene cinco hijos y un nieto, es una persona servicial aunque de caracter serio, y junto a su familia reside en la Comunidad de La Vega en el municipio de Trojes. Inicio con su pulperia hace mas de 25 años y lo aprendio empiricamente, actualmente sigue haciendolo pero ahora tambien se dedica a cultivar cafe. Con el cultivo de cafe inicio con una manzana pero ahora cuenta con seis, algunos trabajadores y su esposo la ayudan con el trabajo de la finca mientras ella atiende los quehaceres del hogar y la pulperia. La ventaja tener dos negocios es que cuenta con varias entradas de dinero y eso le permite no pasar tantas necesidades economicas, la desventaja es que la zona donde reside es cafetalera y hay varias fincas y eso limita la mano de obra. El prestamo que Doña Amelia esta solicitando lo necesita para abonar el area de cultivo y pagar la mano de obra. Con el apoyo de este prestamo su produccion dara un mejor rendimiento y podra venderla a un buen precio. Su mayor sueño para ella y su familia es mejorar su condicion de vida. Doña Amelia tiene nueve ciclos en FAMA y es una de las mejores clientes de la institucion.
texts.en:
Amelia, 54, sells groceries. She is married, has five sons and daughters, and one grandson.  She is a helpful person and very serious.  She lives with her family in La Vega community, in the town of Trojes.  She began with her grocery store more than 25 years ago and she learned by doing.  She still has the store but now she also grows coffee.  She started with one acre but now she has six.   A few laborers and her husband help her with the farm work while she takes care of the housework and the grocery store.  The advantage of having two businesses is that she can count on several sources of income and this allows her to keep up with her expenses.  The disadvantage is that where she lives is a coffee producing area with other  farms and this limits her access to farm labor.  She will use the requested loan to buy fertilizer for the fields and to pay the farmhands.  This loan will help her achieve more production and she can sell the crop at a good price.
Her greatest dream for herself and her family is to improve their standard of living.
Amelia has had nine loan cycles with FAMA and she is one of the institution’s best clients.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Pichthary

texts.en:
Pichthary, 28, is a farmer. Her husband sells food, and their income is $8 per day. She has two children, three and one year old. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she hopes to have enough money to send all of her children to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family

loans.name: 01 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Hòe is 59 years old and she is married with three children and one dependent. She is the group leader of the 01 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Mrs Hòe works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise to sell. This is Hòe's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital. With her business profits, Hòe hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise to sell.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en: Husam is a 29-year-old single man from Gaza.  He is hoping that throughout this loan he will be able to start running his own business, which is a clothing store. He hopes that he will be able to buy stands and goods for the store. This will increase his income and bring in customers, too.

loans.use: to purchase stands and goods for the store

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jessica has a retail shop that sells fruits like ponkans, mangoes & oranges. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of fruits to sell.

Jessica is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jessica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Genevive

texts.en: Genevive is married with 3 children. She is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. Genevive is a farmer who grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 8 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase fertilizer for her crop raising. Genevive has been a member of Kiva's partner, PMPC, for 1 year. In the future, Genevive hopes to improve her living situation.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her crop raising

location.town: Ozamis-Kinuman Norte, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 37 years old. She is a single mother of two children aged 18 and three years old. She operates a cosmetic shop and has been in the business for one year. She has a monthly income of KES 20,250.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan amount to purchase stock of cosmetics and hair pieces to sell. She will expand her business with the anticipated profits. Her dream is to be the best cosmetics supplier in the area.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cosmetics and hair pieces to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 22 years old and live in Paynesville. She is single and has two children, ages 8 months and 6 years old. They are in school and live at home. For the past five years she has been selling bitter ball and pepper. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bitter ball and pepper for her business. She says her main challenge is a goods shortage. Josephine says she started this business by rock crushing and she learned this business from her mother. What she like about her business is that it gives her money to support her home. She hopes to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bitter ball and pepper for her business

loans.name: Bidii Shg A Group

texts.en:
Damaris is the facilitator of the Bidii SHG A group. Damaris and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Damaris and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Damaris takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. With income from her maize sales, Damaris will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing and business as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Bidii SHG A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Damaris with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Shivembe Shg Group

texts.en:
Daniel is the facilitator of the Shivembe SHG group. Daniel and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Daniel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Daniel takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Daniel had a good maize yield harvesting 11 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Daniel was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from his maize sales, Daniel will educate his children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Shivembe SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Daniel with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Freddy Ramiro

texts.es:
Freddy es una persona de 38 años de edad, tiene dos hijos pero es soltero, vive con sus hijos en Bolívar provincia del Carchi. Freddy se considera una persona trabajadora y honesta.

Freddy tiene un negocio de cerrajería en el patio de su casa, este negocio le ayuda a mantener a sus hijos ya que es el único ingreso que el tiene, su negocio se ve perjudicado ya que actualmente hay mal clima y no le permite trabajar ya que su negocio no tiene un techo, es por eso que realiza su séptimo crédito a Fodemi que va a invertir en la construcción del techo para su negocio.

Su sueño es poder tener un taller grande para que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Freddy, 38, has two children but he’s single.  He lives with his children in Bolívar, El Carchi Province.  Freddy considers himself to be a hardworking, honest person.

Freddy has a metal shop in his yard that helps him support his children since it’s his only source of income.  The business is being damaged because the weather now is bad and he can’t work because he has no roof over his shop and this is why he’s taking out his 7th loan with Fodemi that he will use to build a roof over his ship.  His dream is to have a large shop so that his business will continue to grow.

loans.use: to install a roof.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул 47 лет, замужем и имеет пятерых детей.  Для того, чтобы покрыть ежедневные расходы семьи, Айнагул в 1990 году начала свой бизнес в разведении скота, ставший затем основным источником финансирования ее семьи.  Использовав стартовую сумму в 5,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной коровы, Айнагул смогла развить хозяйство, насчитывающее на сегодняшний день две дойной коровы, четыре бычка, четыре лошади и пятьдесят овец. Ежемесячная прибыль от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов составляет около 10,000 сом.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнагул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. В будущем, Айнагул планирует увеличить поголовье скота, а доходы вложить в оплату контракта на обучение детей.
texts.en:
Ainagul is 47 years old, married and has five children. In order to cover the daily expenses of her family, Ainagul started her business of breeding cattle in 1990. This later became the main source of income for her family. Using a starting sum of 5,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow, Ainagul was able to develop the farm. It currently numbers two dairy cows, four bulls, four horses and fifty sheep. The monthly income from selling dairy products and meat is around 10,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further develop her business, Ainagul turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional livestock. In the future, Ainagul plans to increase the number of livestock, and use the income to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Paulo Juan

texts.es:
el señor Paulo Juan es casado, tiene 40 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 6 hijos 3 de los cuales estudian, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos y servilletas, lleva 10 años de experiencia en su labor, había iniciado como operario, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de materiales para tejeduría consistentes en hilos de mish, alta seda, y mejorar su producción, espera tener empleados en el futuro.
texts.en: Paulo Juan, 40, is married; he completed third grade.  He has six children three of whom attend school.  He weaves traditional fabrics and napkins.  He has ten years’ experience having started out as an employee.  His wife, who does domestic chores, helps him out.  He’s asking for a loan to buy knitting supplies consisting in “hilos de mish” [six-strand rayon thread with a silky appearance] and silk to improve production.  He hopes to hire employees in the future.

loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Renad

texts.en:
Renad is a years old married woman from Marka, Amman; Jordan and a mother of four children. 

Renad sews bags and operates from her home. Renad is requesting a loan of 600 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase fabrics and materials needed in producing bags. 

Renad's home based project is at the beginning stage and she is looking to expand it through opening a shop.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials needed in sewing bags

loans.name: Nassouroulah Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Nassouroulah du Banc Villageois de Nimzatt Keur Momar Sarr est créé le 27 décembre 2010; il est composé de cinq femmes qui sont des amies et voisines le petit commerce et l’embouche constituent leurs activités principales.

La responsable Mintou est âgée de 51 ans, elle est mariée mère de huit enfants , elle vend des fruits et de l'arachide  avec une bonne expérience.Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en sari blanc.
Elle achéte ses produits ( orange, pastèque, mangues, jujubes, arachide....)au marché du village et revend à domicile où elle a un étal.
Son prêt lui servira à acheter en quantité les produits à revendre pour ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus.


Son mari a la charge de toutes les dépenses de la famille donc avec ses bénéfices elle renforce son épargne.
texts.en:
The Nassouroulah solidarity group, which belongs to the Banc Villageois in Nimzatt Keur Momar Sarr, was set up on 27th December 2010. It is made up of five women, who are friends and neighbors; their main activities are small trading businesses and animal fattening. 

The person responsible for the group is Mintou, who is 51 years old. She is married and mother to eight children. She sells fruit and groundnuts and has good experience in this domain. In the photo she is standing on the right and dressed in a white sari. 

She buys her products (oranges, water melons, mangoes, jujbes, groundnuts) at the village market and resellls them from home where she has a stall.

Her loan will enable her to buy a large quanitiy of products to resell and thereby make a lot of money. Her husband has responsibility for all the family's expenses, so that she can boost her savings with her profits.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru: Это Гулноза.  Ей всего 27 лет. Она молодая мать и жена. У нее двое детей. Муж Гулнозы занимается животноводством. Гулноза сама занимается земледелием больше 4 лет. Она каждый сезон сажает урожай. Работать на земле тяжело, но Гулноза несмотря ни на что продолжает работать в этом направлении. В этом году она планирует посадить картофель. Из-за нехватки денег она обратилась за кредитом. За счет кредита она купить семян картофеля и будет ждать наступление следующего сезона для сбора урожая.
texts.en: Meet Gulnoza.  She is only 27 years old but already married and the young mother of two children.  While her husband raises livestock, she has been involved in crop farming for more than four years.  This is her only source of income.  Gulnoza sows her land at the beginning of each planting season.  Working the land is hard work, but Gulnoza is determined to keep on working in agriculture because it is her main source of income.  This year, she is planning to sow potatoes.  Because of insufficient personal funds, she is taking a loan.  Thanks to this loan, she will be able to buy potato seeds and will harvest her crops at the beginning of next season.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is an experienced smallholder woman farmer. She is based in Kenyenya, which is a small rural town in the Nyanza region of Kenya. Maria and her husband have been blessed with a lovely family. 

For 10 years Maria has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows maize, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Maria is kindly seeking for a loan to buy animal feeds through the loan she will buy high quality feeds that she will use in feeding her cows. Better feeding of the cow will result in high quality milk production. Increased milk production will result in increase in income hence improved living conditions.
During this festive season you can be part of this dream by granting her a loan!

loans.use: To buy animal feeds

loans.name: Santa Teresita 2 Group

texts.en:
Eight entrepreneurial women have gathered together to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Santa Teresita 2” with the mutual goals of empowering themselves, expanding their small businesses, sending their children to school and raising the standard of living for their families. The ladies live in Patulul in the South Coast of Guatemala where it is hot and humid. An immense quantity of fruit is grown here like papaya, mango, pineapple and sugarcane. 

The Secretary of the group is Beyd,i who is 24 years old and  about to graduate from school as a lawyer. She is very happy that she has been able to move ahead in her life and has been a great role model for the rest of the women in the Trust Bank.  She is married and has a daughter.  Beydi has a blacksmith shop that is the family business. Some of the products manufactured in the shop include windows, doors and balconies. She is the administrator of the business. Because of the large demand, Beydi is requesting a loan that she will use to buy raw materials like metal sheeting, tubes, aluminum and other supplies to expand the business. She, along with her husband, share the common goals of moving the family ahead and realizing their dreams.

Friendship Bridge calls the combination of small loans and education “Microcredit Plus”. Topics covered include violence against women and women’s rights, health and hygiene, as well as self-esteem and empowerment. Also discussed are effective business management practices including planning, budgeting, pricing, marketing and accounting.

Thank you, KIVA investors, for reading about Beydi and her friends in the “Santa Teresita 2” Trust Bank. They are poised to step into a much brighter future, benefitting themselves, their families and their community in Patulul, Guatemala.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like metal sheeting, tubes, aluminum and other supplies for her blacksmith business.

loans.name: Alda

texts.en: Alda is 53 year old married with two children living in Malibangcao, Clarin Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she owns and operates an agriculture business. Planting and harvesting vegetables for sale in the local community while her husband works as a security guard. In 2009, she joined Gata Daku MPC and successfully repaid her previous loans that she used to purchase fertilizer. Recently, she requested a new loan of 25,000 to buy seedlings and fertilizer, such as manure, to be used for farm expansion. She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Doudou

texts.en:
This is a group loan. This group of 33 will each receive $25 to plant their own share of crops. They will share the risk of the loan together with a representative being responsible for delivering the repayments. Since this is an agricultural loan, it will be repaid in its entirety at the end of the growing season rather than in installments.

Louly Ngogom is a village of about 500 inhabitants of the Serrer ethnic group, under the leadership of Doudou D., the resident local government counsel member. Located among majestic baobab trees about 20 miles inland from the beach resort area of Mbour, Louly Ngokom is a poor village that depends on its youth in the cities to send money and rice home in the hungry months of August and September. In the summer of 2004, villagers lacked capital to buy seeds to plant their main cash crop, peanuts. For the initial lending, 15 household heads were chosen by Doudou and a counsel of village elders to receive a loan of $25 each to purchase of seeds before the planting season. After the harvest, 99.5% reimbursed the loans with an interest rate of 6%. In 2005, with continuing donations through John Fay, GENSEN and the village counsel were able to increase the loan and the number of beneficiaries to 33 persons, 17 men and 16 women selected on a rotating basis.

In its goal of becoming a self-sufficient model village, Louly has in its favor a partnership with a new modern ecovillage group, introduced with the facilitation of the GENSEN NGO, SOS Environment. In fact, the ecovillage of Louly Ngokom consists of the existing traditional inhabitants plus this new group of about 20 incoming settlers, who already have started to employ local youth to grow organic bananas and produce and to construct modern ecological dwellings.

loans.use: 33 individual loans of $25 to purchase seeds for cash crop - peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jacinta would like to buy cereal, laundry detergent, beverages, and snacks for her shop

loans.name: Eduardo David

texts.en:
Eduardo is 31 years old and is originally from the city of Monterrey, in the state of Nuevo León. he is married and the father of two small children. Eduardo has been a metalworker and automotive painter for over five years. When he became unemployed, he decided to start his own business and provide this service in order to obtain the resources he needed to support and educate his family. Little by little, with his efforts, he has been able to improve his business, becoming known in his area and expanding his client base.

At this time, he needs credit in the amount of $475 because he is going to work on automotive paint projects and improve the quality of service he offers to his customers, which will allow him to obtain better revenue. Eduardo needs your help to be able to grow his business. Your help can improve his and his family's lives should you decide to support them.

Translated from Spanish by Naomi Baer, Kiva volunteer.

Eduardo tiene 31 años es originario de la ciudad de Monterrey, en el estado de Nuevo León, es casado y padre de dos pequeños hijos. Eduardo hojalatero y pintor automotriz desde hace más de cinco años, al verse desempleado decidió iniciar su propio negocio y brindar este servicio por la necesidad de obtener los recursos que necesita para el sustento y la educación de su familia. Poco a poco y con base en su esfuerzos ha logrado mejorar su negocio, dándose a conocer en la zona y ha logrando tener más clientes.

En este momento requiere el crédito por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares porque va a trabajar en proyectos de pintura automotriz y mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece a sus clientes, esto le permitirá obtener mejores ingresos. Eduardo necesita de tu colaboración para poder crecer con su negocio, tu ayuda puede mejorar la vida de él y su familia, decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Protected

texts.en:
Mr. Najdat is 35 years old has a small bakery in Kirkuk. He lives with his big family in one house. This is his first application for a loan. He wants to develop his shop and purchase new bakery machines to improve his life and increase his business income. Mr. Najdat wants $1200 and he is looking for the more in the future.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new bakery machine

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei has a small shoe sales business located at the Central market in Novaya Kohovka, Ukraine. In business for two years, he has built up about $2500 worth of inventory on hand and makes about $700 per month. Sergei is married. He and his wife have one daughter who is two years old. Sergei likes what he does for a living and hopes to continue supporting his family.

One of the challenges of Sergei’s business is his high rate of inventory turnover. He has requested a loan of $1100 to give him some extra working capital to use to purchase more shoes for his business. Additional inventory and a variety of selection will help keep Sergei’s sales brisk and his business successful.

loans.use: Purchase shoe inventory

loans.name: Imamverdi

texts.ru:
Mr. Imamverdi Z. lives in the town of Saatly, Azerbaijan. He is 55, married and has 5 children. Imamverdi makes a living by raising cattle and selling cows on a market. He asked the local branch of NorMicro, a Kiva partner, for a $500 loan to finance business expansion. A calf costs $100 on a local market, so the loan will let Imamverdi buy 5 more animals in addition to his annual purchase.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мр. Имамверди живет в городе Саатлы Республики Азербайджан, расположенном в Закавказье. Ему 55 лет, он женат, имеет 5-х детей. Имамверди занимается закупкой телят, их варащиванием и в дальнейшем продажей уже зрелого крупного рогатого скота на местном рынке. Таким образом он обеспачивает свою немалую семью тем необходимым минимумом, на который можно жить в условиях небогатой деревни. Но дети растут так же быстро, как растут и их потребности. Сегодня Имамверди подумывает о увеличении прибыли с его бизнеса путём вкладывания инвестиций. Он обратился в местный филиал микрокредитной организации "Нормикро" - парнёру КИВА - с просьбой предоставления ему кредита с суммой в 500 долларов для расширения бизнеса. На местном рынке цена одного телёнка 100 долларов. Так что Имамверди сможет на эту сумму кредит купить 5 телят дополнительно к тем, которые он уже закупает ежегодно.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru:
After graduating from school Shoira A. got married. Her husband used to work seasonally (he helped his uncle to grow grapes). After the birth of their 4th child, Shoira had to begin trading at the market while her oldest daughter took care of the children. Initially, Shoira purchased goods from wholesale traders, but the prices were very high when she had to take out loans. In the summer of 2006, she found out about a credit program called "Microinvest". After receiving her first loan, she was able to secure lower prices for the goods she purchased wholesale, which allowed her to gain additional income. One part of the income was spent on family needs and the remaining part Shoira invested in her business. In order to be more competitive in her business, she plans to travel to Bishkek (Kyrgyz Republic) to purchase goods. This way, she will expand to a wholesale business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Аюбчонова Шоира после окончания средней школы вышла замуж. Муж клиентки имел сезонные заработки (помогал своему дяде выращивать виноград). После рождения четвертого ребенка в семье Шоира вынуждена была выйти на базар торговать оставив детей на попечение старшей дочки. Сначала она приобрела товар у оптовиков под реализацию, но стоимость товара был гораздо выше чем по наличке. В середине 2006г она узнала о программе кредитования «Микроинвест». Получив первый кредит она приобрела товар у оптовиков по более низким ценам, что позволило ей получить дополнительную прибыль. Часть прибыли она тратила на нужды семьи, а оставшуюся часть вложила в свой бизнес. Чтобы быть более конкурентноспособным она намеревается ездить сама за товаром в Бишкек (Республика Кыргизстан), что позволить ей перейти в оптовую торговлю товарами.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene is 48 years old and finished secondary school. She lives in the district of Salaverry in the province of Trujillo, and runs a business from her home, selling stuffed animals and fabric bags, as well as perfumes, gifts and other novelty items. She used to just take care of her home, but she took advantage of a course offered in her neighborhood, and since then she has practiced what she learned to build her business.

With the first loan she received from the communal bank, JERID - Camino al Exito (road to success), she purchased the material she needed to make the stuffed animals such as fabric, stuffing, buttons and decorations and the tools she needed to create the toys. With this loan, which she will repay in 4 months, Irene will travel to Lima to buy clothing, kitchen items such as glasses, plates and cups, and toys to for the Christmas season. Her dream is to one day have a large store.

La señora Irene tiene 48 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz del Distrito de Salaverry, Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad. Actualmente la señora Irene se dedica a confeccionar peluches, carteras tejidas los cuales vende en la tienda que tiene en su domicilio a parte de eso vende perfumes, regalos, adornos, etc. Anteriormente solo se dedicaba a su hogar pero aprovechó un curso que dictaban en el comedor de su zona, desde allí pone en practica lo aprendido. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que obtuvo en el Banco Comunal “JERID – Camino al Éxito” compró el material que necesita para confeccionar los peluches como: ojitos, tela, rellenos, perlas, etc. y sus herramientas. Con este préstamo de S/.1,300.00 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, viajará a Lima para traer ropa, menaje de cocina (tazas, platos, vasos, etc.) y juguetes aprovechando la campaña navideña. La señora Irene pertenece al club de madres “Purísima Concepción”, su mayor sueño es tener una gran boutique.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE CLOTHING AND OTHER ITEMS,  TAKING ADVANTAGE OF THE HOLIDAY SEASON TO GROW HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Lucre

texts.es:
Lucre is a member of the communal bank "Love and Peace" in Moyobamba, San Martín, Perú. She sells parts for cars, motorcycles and motor-taxis in a repair shop run out of her house. She started the business over a year ago after separating from her husband, wanting to provide her children with a good education, cover all life's daily necessities, and move forward as a woman.

With a 6 month US $425 loan, she will stock up on car parts and a diverse array of accessories to service the daily flow vehicles that come to her shop.

Lucre is 38 years old with 2 children. She is a cheerful woman and a fighter who wants to continue improving her business and in the future hopes to open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lucre es socia del banco comunal “Amor y Paz” del distrito y provincia de Moyabamba, departamento de San Martín. Se dedica a la venta de repuestos y auto partes para motocicletas, motocarros y carros en un taller mecánico ubicado en su propia casa del Jr. Coronel Secada Nº 118 desde hace mas de 1 año al separarse de su esposo y motivada por dar a sus hijos una buena educación y satisfacer las necesidades diarios del hogar y salir adelante como mujer. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará repuestos y accesorios diversos por docena para vehículos motorizados que a diario asisten a su taller de motos para ser reparados y encuentran en este establecimiento lo necesario para seguir circulando. Tiene 38 años, 2 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Lucre se muestra siempre como una persona jovial y luchadora y anhela desarrollar más su negocio y además desea tener un restaurante.

loans.use: Stock up on motor vehicle parts and accessories

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.en:
María Lourdes is one of the few older women who give special importance to education. In spite of her age – she’s fifty years old – María Lourdes attends school for adults and she will finish secondary school next year. María Lourdes, a mother of five well-loved children, is also an entrepreneur. She sells men’s and women’s clothing in the Batey de Palavé community of San Cristobal. The entrepreneur has been running this business for six years, shortly after her husband’s death.

Marie Lourdes explains that there are a lot of entrepreneurs who are competing to attract the customers and to be the best supplier of clothing in the community. She adds that she’ll do her best to lead in this competition and have a successful business.

With her loan, Marie Lourdes will buy more clothing for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing in bulk to restock a small business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is an enterprising woman and the mother of a family of 11 children, who are 27, 26, 25, 24, 22, 21, 19, 17, 16, 16, and 14. Her husband is a mechanic, but since their family is extensive, his salary doesn't cover all of their expenses. To take good care of their children, Francisca started to sell products by catalog. Thanks to her effort, she has now become a promoter of this line of products, and two of her children help her with her work.

Due to low sales, she needs a credit of $575, which she will repay in 6 months, to remodel her presentation area that she uses with her promoters. Let's support Francisca and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Francisca es una mujer emprendedora y madre de familia de 11 hijos 27, 26, 25, 24, 22, 21,19, 17 2 de 16 y 14años, su esposo es mecánico, debido a que su familia es extensa con el sueldo de su esposo no les alcanzaba para los gastos familiares y sacar adelante a sus hijos por lo que ella empezó a vender productos por catalogo. Gracias a su esfuerzo ahora se ha convertido en promotora de esta línea, y 2 de sus hijos la ayudan en estas labores.

Debido a las bajas ventas ella requiere un crédito de US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar el área de presentación que utiliza con sus promotoras. Apoyemos a francisca y su familia.

loans.use: To remodel her location.

loans.name: Tedi

texts.en:
Tedi is 45 years old and is married with one child. Tedi owns a small grocery store and since 1982 she has also worked as a tailor. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Tedi now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Pouwereou Group

texts.fr:
The Pouwoereou Association was created by five energetic women who have businesses in the Agoè Kitidjan neighborhood. Their main line of business consists of making and selling local beverages. In addition, some members of the association sell cereals and vegetable oil. Their goal is to help one another. The first loan that the Pouwoereou Association just repaid allowed the group to purchase cereals when they were in season and sell them in times of high demand. These sales allowed them to quickly repay their loan, and they are now requesting a new one to purchase two bags of millet, one bag of beans, two bags of rice and three containers of vegetable oil.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

L’ Association POUWOEREOU est créée par Cinq (5) femmes dynamiques qui exercent des activités commerciales dans le quartier d’Agoè Kitidjan. Leur activité principale est la préparation et la vente boisson locale. En dehors de celle-ci, certain membre de cette association exerce le commerce de céréales et d’huile végétale. Elles se sont données comme objectif l’entraide mutuelle. Le premier crédit que l’Association POUWOEREOU vient de solder lui a permis de faire l’approvisionnement des céréales en leur période d’abondance et de les revendre en temps de pénurie. C’est ce qui leur a permis de vite rembourser et de solliciter ce nouveau crédit pour acheter 2 sacs de mil, 1 sac d’haricot 2 sacs de riz et 3 bidons d’huile végétale.

loans.use: Purchase of cereals and vegetable oil

loans.name: Douglas Jeovany

texts.es:
Douglas is 26 years old and lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe, in Managua, Nicaragua. He is married and has two children ages 4 and 7. His children are in school and his wife is a stay-at-home mother.

Douglas is a pineapple farmer and he has ten years of experience in the field. He began with hard work, and with this loan he would like to maintain and purchase a variety of agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and seeds.

In the future he would like to increase his production and sales, improve his living conditions and provide his children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Douglas tiene 26 años de edad, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, es casado y tienen dos hijos de 4 y 7 años de edad, los niños están estudiando, su esposa es ama de casa. El Sr. Douglas es agricultor de piña y lleva diez años de experiencia en los cultivos e inició con esfuerzos propios, y con este préstamo que le otorguen es para mantenimiento y compra de insumos agrícola. Sus planes futuros son tener una buena producción de sus productos y ventas, tener mejores condiciones de vida y brindar educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies used for cultivating pineapples

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 45 year-old Hawa M.. She is married, and has five children aged between 15 and 29. She has two other dependents, who live with her because they are orphans. In 1997, Hawa established her grocery business. Working 6 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about US $330 every month from this business. She is assisted by her brother, sister and three employees.

Hawa has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetebles in bulk. In the future, Hawa plans to to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetable in bulk.

loans.name: Dominga Clementina

texts.es:
Mrs. Dominga lives in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliacion in Managua. She is 50 years old and married. Her husband sells cattle, and he spends most of his time on the road. They have three children, all of whom are independent. Mrs. Dominga has a neighborhood store in her own home, and in occasions she also sews. She has been working in her business for the past three years, and she has worked very hard in order to keep it afloat. Mrs. Dominga wishes to improve her quality of life through her business, and that is why she is requesting a loan with which she will buy basic home products in order to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Dominga habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación de Managua. Tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, su esposo se dedica a la comercialización de ganado, la mayor parte la pasa fuera de su vivienda. Tienen 3 hijos que ya son independientes a ella. Doña Dominga tiene una pulpería en su vivienda, y en ocasiones se dedica a la costura, tiene 3 años de estar en este negocio, por lo que ha trabajado fuertemente para poder mantenerlo y salir adelante. Doña Dominga desea mejorar su nivel de vida y esto espera lograrlo a través del negocio, es por eso que está solicitando el crédito, para la compra de productos básicos para el hogar y así seguir adelante con el crecimiento de la pulpería.

loans.use: To buy basic home  products for her business.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin C., 41, is a widowed farmer who lives with three of her children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Since she is self-employed as a rice farmer, her farm supports the family from day to day. She makes no profit. Two of her children are garment workers and one other is a farmer like her. To double the family's income, she needs a loan of US$650 to set up a new business selling groceries.

loans.use: To set up a new business selling groceries.

loans.name: Manzurahon

texts.ru:
Муйдинова Манзурахон, 1964 года рождения. Она замужем и у нее 2 детей. От матери ей в наследство осталась швейная машинка, которая является необходимым в личной жизни. Она вспоминая слова своей матери «женщина должна уметь шить» решила развивать свои способности в шитье. И начала свой бизнес с шитья национальной одежды. Развивая свой бизнес часть своего жилого дома Манзурахон переоборудовала под швейный цех и установила там 6 швейных машинок.
Теперь она кроме шитья национальной одежды занимается вышивкой и набивкой цветных узоров на материях и одежде. Хочет получить займ в сумме 4000 сомони для закупа сырья: нить, материал, хлопок-волокно и другие принадлежности.
texts.en:
M. Manzurahon was born in 1964. She is married and has two children. She inherited a sewing machine from her mother which has been a necessity in her life. By remembering her mother's words "a woman must know how to sew" she decided to develop her skills in sewing. She started her own business by making national Tajik dresses. To develop her business Manzurahon has reconstructed part of her house to make a sewing shop where she installed six sewing machines.

Right now, besides making national clothes, she also does embroidery and printing of colorful designs on fabrics and clothes. She wants to receive a loan for 4,000 somoni (USD$1,200) to buy raw materials: thread, fabrics, cotton fiber and other supplies.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials: thread, fabrics, cotton fiber

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 21 años, vive en casa de sus padres. Es una muchacha muy trabajadora, se dedica desde hace 3 años a realizar trabajos de Artesanía, arte que aprendió de su madre, la cual le enseño desde niña los singulares bordados que realiza. Lo que le gusta a Juana de su trabajo es que ella puede dar rienda suelta a su imaginación cuando realiza cada uno de estos trabajos, pero no es tan fácil como parece, ya que debe dedicarle tiempo y mucha precisión, lo cual hace que la clientela prefiera su trabajo, resultándole muy rentable, ya que las ventas cada vez son mejores. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado Juana comprará material para seguir realzando sus bordados e incursionar en otro tipo artesanías.
texts.en:
Juana is 21 years old and lives at home with her parents. She is a very hardworking young woman and has worked for the past 3 years making handicrafts. She learned this from her mother, who has taught her this unique embroidery since childhood. Juana likes that her work allows her imagination to run free when she creates a piece, but it's not as easy as it looks. She requires a lot of time and precision, which is why her clients prefer her work. Because of this her work is very profitable and her sales are getting better and better. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money requested Juana will buy material to continue her embroidery and expand into other types of craftwork.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing materials for embroidery

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en: Shavkat B. is a 46 year-old married man who lives with his three children and owns a small farm. He lives and works in the small village of Khujand. Shavkat and has been selling sheep for fifteen years. Since sheep selling is a profitable business, Shavkat has become a very successful businessman in a very short period of time. The income has been enough to cover family needs, but as his children grow, covering family needs has become harder, so Shavkat is applying for a loan to expand his activities and to purchase more sheep.

loans.use: Purchasing sheep in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María es madre soltera, vive con sus tres hijos que son solteros, trabajan y la apoyan mucho. Ella se dedicaba a la crianza de pollos, a razón de no ser una actividad muy productiva, y también decidió vender bebidas (cervezas y gaseosas), actividad que viene realizando recientemente (2 meses atrás), lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes y mantener amistad con ellos, además, su nuevo negocio de bebidas es muy rentable, ya que son productos que tiene mucha demanda. Por lo general, le va bien. Con este, suman 10 créditos con MFP, y desde que inició su trabajo con su banco comunal, ha demostrado ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita esta vez mandará a construir un local adecuado para la venta de sus bebidas.
texts.en:
Maria is a single mother. She lives with her three single children, who work and help her a lot. She was raising chickens, but because this wasn't very productive, she also decided to sell beverages (sodas and beers), something she started doing just two months ago. The thing she likes about her work is giving her customers good service and maintaining a friendship with them. Besides, her new business of selling drinks is very profitable, as her products are in high demand. In general, it's going well for her. This loan will be her 10th loan from Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma, and since she began working with her communal bank, she has shown herself to be responsible and timely in making payments. With the money she is requesting this time, she will begin construction on a location for her drink sales.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction on her place of business

loans.name: Sopha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopha N. is a group leader of five who all live in Chrouy Dang village in Kandal province. She is a dessert seller. She is a 51-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is employed by the CMAC organization, while another helps in her business and the third is attending the local school. 

Mrs. Sopha N. is requesting a loan to dig a well for her family for personal use.

loans.use: To dig a well for her family for personal use.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es: el grupo esta compuesto por tres integrantes que son: Adriana Z., ella vive en la aldea de Lajero Blanco donde  tiene su pequeño negocio de pulpería, vende a las personas de ese mismo lugar, ella desea crecer la unión familiar a  pesar  que es  madre  soltera . Alba Tomasa N. se dedica a la venta de golosinas, se levanta temprano y viene a la ciudad a vender su producto, vende baleadas, pan blanco con mantequilla, panqueques, café y avena con leche. ella compra todo lo que necesita para elaborar sus productos en la ciudad, en estos momentos ella necesita darles educación a dos nietos que viven con ella los cuales a criado desde que son bebes, ya que sus padres murieron ,vive sola con sus dos nietos.  Maria Josefa R. se dedica a la venta de golosinas como: tacos, enchiladas, pastelitos de papas, tajaditas de plátano, yuca con chicharrón y refrescos naturales. vende el producto en la exportadora de melón que  esta cerca del lugar donde vive, se levanta temprano para salir a vender su producto y regresa a las dos de la tarde a su casa descansa un poco y luego a preparar las golosinas del siguiente día. es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos los cuales ya están casados, una de sus hijas vive cerca de su casa y ella le ayuda a la preparación del producto.
texts.en:
This group has three members. The first is Adriana Z., a single mother who lives in the village of Lajero Blanco and runs a small juice stand for the community in the hopes of increasing her family's income. The second is Alba Tomasa N., who dedicates herself to selling sweets and snacks. She gets up very early in the morning to travel to the city and sell her products, she sells tortillas, buttered bread, pancakes, coffee etc. She also buys all her supplies when she is in town. Right now, she is working so that she can provide an education for her two grandchildren, whom she has raised since they were infants. Ever since their parents' death, they have lived with her. The third member of the group is Maria Josefa R., who dedicates herself to selling snacks. She sells tacos, enchiladas, potato pastries, fried plantain, yuca with sausage, and natural juices. She gets up early in the morning to sell her products at a melon exporting business near where she lives, and returns home at two in the afternoon every day to start preparing the next day's snacks. She is a single mother and has three children who are already married. One of her daughters lives near Maria's house and helps her with food preparation.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy drinks, beans, bread, butter, cheese, vegetables and meat

loans.name: Floria

texts.es:
FLORIA P. B., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Edén” con domicilio en el Jr. Ruperto Pérez N° 445 del distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 59 años, 09 hijos, y su cónyuge tiene trabajo eventual.

El primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el que inició un trabajo en la preparación y venta de comida,  actualmente tiene un puesto en el mercado de Yarinacocha en la sección de comida, con muy buena clientela.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,300. Nuevos Soles, se ha propuesto implementar bien su establecimiento. Comprará vajilla nueva e insumos en mayor cantidad, así como la carne que utiliza en su preparación.

Ella comenta que le gusta la forma como trabaja Manuela Ramos y como iniciadora del Banco Comunal Nuevo Edén se siente feliz de contribuir con sus amigas y vecinas, y se siente comprometida con ellas.
texts.en:
Floria P. B. belongs to the Nuevo Eden community bank in Yarinacocha. She is 59 years old and has 9 children. Her partner is a day laborer. Her first loan, for S/.300 new soles, was used to start a business making and selling food. She now has a stall in the food section of the Yarinacocha market with many good customers. With this S/.1,300 new-soles loan, she plans to set up a new business. She will buy wholesales supplies of tableware and supplies such as meat that she uses to make the food dishes she sells. She says that she likes the way that Manuela Ramos works and, as someone who started the Nuevo Eden community bank, she's happy to have helped her friends and neighbors and feels a commitment to them.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies for restaurant business.

loans.name: Zubia Tajamul Tajamul Hussain Group

texts.en:
My name is Zubia T. and I am a citizen of a city named Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. I am uneducated because my parents could not pay for my education. I am married to a man whose name is T. H., and he also lives in Lahore. He runs his own grocery shop in the community. I have three children, all of whom are boys. They are getting an education from a school located near our house. I keep myself busy by embroidering clothes. Through this work I share the family's financial burden and pay the school fees for my children. My family is very happy with my supportive behavior. I am applying for a loan to diversify my husband’s grocery shop. 

I am the group leader of four another women from my locality. Bushra baji wants a loan to pay the remaining installments of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).  Shazia baji wants a loan to buy another sewing machine for her tailoring center. Zubaida baji and Shagufta baji each want a loan to buy garments to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Various, including items for grocery shop

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter N. is married with two children and received an education through junior high school. Peter works as a trader in Siwdo, selling items such as milk, Milo, sugar and soap. He has been trading since 2006, along with his wife who also works as a trader. Peter uses his income to help support his family and pay for their expenses.

Peter will use the loan to purchase additional groceries to sell and with the new profits from his expanded business, Peter plans to reinvest back into his enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries for his store

loans.name: Hour

texts.en:
Hour C., 46, pictured here with her husband and her children, is married and lives with seven of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband sell rubber, typically making about US$6 each day and are supported by four children working as workers.

Hour C. needs to earn more money to support her family. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a truck to transport rubber. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase a truck.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. is thirty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, three sons and two daughters. She says they are in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Margaret’s husband is a farmer while she is a petty trader.

Margaret sells maize. She procures bags of maize from the farmers in nearby communities and sells in the local market to retailers. She also treks to other towns to sell. Margaret has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Wédayamana 6 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Wédayamana 6  est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Sirakélé de la ville de Koutiala région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles soeurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles excellent uniquement   dans la culture de l’arachide.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe   Wédayamana 6 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre prêts précédents, elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter,  de semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de Koutiala ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Wédayamana 6 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 45 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Wédayamana 6 is a group of married women in the Sirakélé neighborhood, in the city of Koutiala (Sikasso Region, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large extended traditional families with their children, husbands, in-laws, etc. They average 35 years of age, and have at least 5 children. Their only business consists in growing peanuts. Eager to make their farming activities profitable, they decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, five years ago. After having repaid the previous four loans without problems, they are now seeking their fifth farming loan. The loan will be used to buy, exclusively at the grand market in Koutiala, peanut seeds, small material, and fertilizers for the fields. After the rainy season, crops are stocked for a while to gain market value, before being sold at the grand market in Koutiala and in the surrounding villages, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities. After selling their production, the members of the Wédayamana 6 group count on turning a profit of XOF 45000 (ca US$ 100), to be used to repay the loan and to pay for the daily expenses of the family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seed, small material, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma M. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Emma is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling river-caught fish in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes A. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 51 years old. Mercedes is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Mercedes owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling nipa (thatched) hut products to local businesses and community members. Mercedes has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Mercedes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Mercedes is requesting a new loan of 6,500 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Mercedes from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Yulia

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 28 year old Yulia Makula from Mwanza. She is married and has one 4-month-old child. She is also responsible for supporting one dependent who is is an orphan. 
 
Yulia has been selling ornaments business since 2008. She works at the business for 12 hours per day 7 days per week. Yulia currently earns about $120 USD a month from her business.
