She is requesting a loan of 500,000 TSHS to purchase more ornaments and sell them to different customers. In the future, she plans to modify her business.Yulia thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro- Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more ornaments to sell

loans.name: Betzabeth

texts.es: Betzabeth es una joven madre de 24 años, vive al lado de su esposo y sus 3 hijos en una casa arrendada. Hace 6 años empezó vendiendo comida de forma ambulante y en la actualidad tiene una tienda de comestibles, donde recientemente implementó una sección de útiles escolares. Su tienda está ubicada en su misma casa y esto le permite atender a sus hijos y no descuidar las tareas de su hogar. Debido a la rentabilidad de su negocio Betzabeth está planificando seguir incrementando la cantidad y variedad de productos que ofrece. Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella una de las socias con mayor tiempo de permanencia en su banco comunal, por lo que renueva su compromiso de pagar sus cuotas programadas. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de comestibles, útiles escolares y otros artículos para surtir su tienda.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Cesinia

texts.en:
Cesinia B., 46 years old, resides at Piao, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and is blessed with five children. Her husband is with the Philippine National Police but his income is not enough for the needs of their family, since their children are all in school.

The school tuition fees had been increased and Cesinia has to find ways on her own to support her husband. She owns a small sari-sari store started with a small amount of capital and she has been an active member of Paglaum since June 2007. She's thankful that Paglaum came to their place because she believes that it can help to put more capital into her business. She also enjoys its programs and services.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Graciela es casada, tiene 41 años y 2 hijos, Graciela junto a su esposo tienen una carpintería en su casa, además Graciela tiene una tienda en su casada en donde vende abarrotes en general, bebidas y artículos de librería.
Graciela necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera.
Los sueños de Graciela son tener una ferretería.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the communal bank "Obreras." Graciela is married, 41 years old, and lives with her husband and 2 children. She and her husband have a woodworking business in their home. In addition, Graciela has a store in her house where she sells general groceries, drinks and office supplies. She needs a loan of 1200 soles which will be used to purchase wood. Graciela dreams of having a hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Aquiles Lanao Flores Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Aquiles Lanao inicia su ciclo once con 21 socias.
Las socias además realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. Libros, verduras, panes, condimentos, emoliente, ropa, abarrotes en general, cosméticos, plásticos, celulares y tejidos D. chompas.
Sus ventas los realizan en sus casas, en locales alquilados, en mercados D. la ciudad y D. manera ambulatoria.
Como es el caso D. Maritza que es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Maritza tiene una librería en donD. brinda servicios D. fotocopiado, tipeos, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo.
Mientras que Berta es soltera, tiene 28 años y 1 hijo, Berta teje bellas chompas a maquina y mano dependiendo D. los pedidos que tenga.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 1050 soles haciendo un total D. 13950 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. papel, verduras, ropa, azúcar, arroz, maquina D. cocer, papa, cosméticos, bolsas.
Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, surtir con mas productos sus negocios, sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Para la compra de papel, verduras, ropa, azúcar, arroz, maquina de cocer, papa, cosméticos, bolsas.

loans.name: Reynaldo Jose

texts.es: El señor Reynaldo José Cuaresma , tiene la edad de 32 años , habita en el barrio Pablo C. , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como operaria en pollos Tip-Top , para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene dos hijos , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda , ya que quiere agrandar un poco mas la casa y hacer cuartos para cada uno de sus hijos , desde hace once años don Reynaldo se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es el humo del volcán , agradece a Afodenic por la buena aprobación de su noveno préstamo , el cual lo va a invertir en insumos para la producción de piña lo cual espera venderlo a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. Reynaldo José Cuaresma is 32 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Pablo C., located in the municipio of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife who works as an operator at Tip-Top chickens to help him with the household expenses. They have two children and the plans for their family are to improve living conditions since they want to partially extend their house to make rooms for each one of their children. For 11 years Reynaldo has worked in agriculture, with the biggest affectation that he is confronted with being volcanic smoke. He is grateful to Afodenic for providing him with his ninth loan which he is going to invest in consumables for the production of pineapple which he hopes to sell at a good price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of consumables and fertilizers for farming use

loans.name: Elba Yesenia

texts.es: Elba Yesenia R. reside en Las Talpujas, del departamento de Chalatenango. Elba tiene 35 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con sus cinco hijos. Elba ha logrado establecer su negocio con muchos sacrificios en su vida, ya que por no poseer ayuda económica de nadie se le ha sido muy difícil la carga económica que está bajo su responsabilidad, Elba mantiene alegría gracias al cariño y apoyo e incondicional de todos sus hijos, quienes son la fuerza que la motiva para continuar en su negocio aunque hayan momentos difíciles, ella  maneja su propia tortillería donde el margen de ganancias es mínimo, es por eso que ahora tiene la idea de poder expandirse en su negocio, con producción de pupusas que vendería a diario, ella solita esta crédito para comprar de materia prima para su negocio.
texts.en:
Elba Yesenia R., 35, lives in Las Talpujas, Chalatenango department. She is a single mother and lives with her 5 children. Thanks to many sacrifices in her life, Elba has managed to set up her business since she doesn't have economic help from nobody and it has been very difficult to carry the economic burden that is her responsibility. She stays cheerful, however, thanks to the unconditional love and support she gets from her children who are the motivating force for her to continue working despite the difficult moments. She runs her own tortilla shop where her profit margin is very small. She would like to expand into pupusa (stuffed corn dumplings) production which she would sell daily She requests this financing to buy ingredients for her product.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her products.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 44 years old. He is married and has four children between the ages of 7 and 26 years. He has a tailoring business and has been in business for 12 years. He describes himself as focused in life.

He requested this loan of Kes. 20,000 from Faulu to add to his inventory of material. He says that his training from Faulu taught him how to keep business records. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and become a leading supplier.

loans.use: To buy materia for his tailoring business

loans.name: Dara

texts.en:
Mr. Dara C., age 28, and his wife, Mrs. Preyvan Vanna, age 35, have been married for ten years and have seven children, five sons and two daughters. Three of the children live with their aunt in Phnom Penh, two children are in school, and another one is still too young for school. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia

Mr. Dara C. has been driving a Motor Remorque taxi (a motorbike with a trailer on the back) for more than eleven years. He carries goods and people from his village to Takhmao and Phnom Penh, and from Takhmao to his village. His wife is a garment factory worker. 

Dara has taken a previous loan from Kiva. He now is applying for another loan, again in the amount of $200, to repair his kitchen.

loans.use: To repair his kitchen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy jewelry

loans.name: Early Fredy

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Early pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 28 años y tiene un hijo llamado Manuel que tiene 1 año. El vive en el departamento del Cusco, provincia del Cusco y distrito de Santiago.  
 
Early es policía y trabaja patrullando las carreteras del Cusco. Ya son dos años que es policía. Early, su hermana Sandy y su papá tienen un negocio familiar que es una quinta bar restaurante llamado “LUCHITO” y esta ubicado en la ciudad de Izcuchaca. El negocio funciona los domingos donde se prepara comida típica de la región como chicharrón, asado, abobo y mucho más.    
Early es un padre joven, trabajador y emprendedor que requiere el préstamo para apoyar al negocio familiar y desea ampliar el local. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Early, 28, is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "COMUZONE" communal bank. He has a one-year-old son, Manuel. He lives in Cusco department, Cusco province, Santiago district. Early has been a police officer patroling Cusco's streets for the last 2 years. Early, his sister Sandy, and their father have a family business that is a restaurant-bar, called "LUCHITO" in the city of Izcuchaca. The restaurant opens on Sundays and serves typical regional dishes like: fried pork rinds, grilled meats, adobo (a marinated meat), etc. Early is a hard-working, enterprising, young father who needs funding to enlarge the family's restaurant. He is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge his restaurant.

loans.name: Santa

texts.es:
Santa, D. 50 años, es una madre muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en la casa que heredó D. sus padres junto a sus 2 hijos; Norma D. 29 y Néstor D. 24 años, quienes ya tienen sus respectivas familias.

Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado Cerro Colorado (mercado importante D. la ciudad D. Juliaca). En su pequeño puesto venD. toda clase D. productos comestibles; como harina, huevos, mantequilla, aceite, etc. Es por eso que es muy concurrido, ya que sus clientes saben que siempre encontrarán lo que necesitan.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus compañeras D. venta, lleva 17 años realizando este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día cuidando su negocio, ya que siempre hay personas que esperan que tenga un descuido para llevarse algo sin pagar. 
Para más adelante, anhela tener una tienda propia donD. pueda vender con mayor comodidad y brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Este es el quinto préstamo D. Santa con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal participa activamente y siempre está al tanto D. las decisiones a las que llegan las demás socias. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para incrementar la cantidad D. mercadería que tiene en su puesto.
texts.en:
Santa is 50 years old. She is a very hard-working and happy mother. She lives in the house she inherited from her parents with her two children, 29 year-old Norma and 24 year-old Néstor, both of whom have their own families. Her business is located in the market Cerro Colorado, a very important market in the city of Juliaca. At her small stand Santa sells all kinds of foodstuffs, like flour, eggs, butter, oil, etc. Her stand is always very busy because her customers know they will always find what they need. What Santa most likes about her business is talking to her fellow vendors. She has been doing this for 17 years. She considers having to stay at her stand all day taking care of her business the most difficult part of the job since there are always people who wait for the opportunity to take something without paying when she is not looking. In the future, Santa wants to have her own store where she can more easily sell her products and offer better service to her customers. This is Santa's fifth loan with MFP. She has always been very punctual with her payments and hopes to be this time also. She actively participates in her community bank and keeps up to date with the decisions maD. on behalf of her partners. With a loan of 1200 nuevo soles Santa will buy more products to increase the amount of merchandise she sells at her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying more merchandise

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu E., currently in the business of selling groundnuts at the market, is requesting a loan to stock more groundnuts to make paste to sell. Dudu is 50 years old and a widow with eight children, all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and construct houses for renting.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more groundnuts to make paste to sell

loans.name: Faatafunaina

texts.en:
Faatafunaina F. is 54 and married with 7 children (ages 8 - 24).  She owns a business venture,  selling smokes to the local community.  Faatafunaina has 3 years of experience in this business.  Faatafunaina needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Faatafunaina joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Faatafunaina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faatafunaina F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.3 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mikaela Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento Mikaela  es uno D. los grupos màs antiguos D. nuestra agencia ya que se encuentra en su 8º ciclo. Esta compuesta por la siguientes personas:

La Sra. Barbara es la Presidenta ya que la identifican como a su lider por ser una persona responsable y trabajadora que siempre llega temprano y paga sus cuotas a tiempo; ella tiene 2 hijos y tiene el negocio D. Venta D. comida ambulando por la cancha (La Cancha es un centro comercial al aire libre que se encuentra en Cochabamba, dicho centro es el más granD. D. Bolivia; ya que no contiene ningún tipo D. desconcentración en cuanto a las ventas D. diversos productos se refiere, que pueden ser desD. alimentos básicos hasta automóviles D. todo tipo), el dinero del credito lo utilizara para la compra D. insumos e ingredientes para la preparacion D. sus riquisimos platos.

Como secretaria esta la Sra. Adelaida no tiene hijos es joven y tambien venD. comida ambulando por la cancha y el dinero del credito lo utilizara para la compra D. insumos e ingredientes para la preparacion D. sus platos.

Como Tesorera esta la Sra. Susana  quien es casada y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, y su negocio es la venta D. cosmeticos  ambulando ella es una D. las fundadoras del grupo, todas sacaron el prestamo para aumentar su capital y hacer crecer su negocio.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que en mucho D. los casos tiene que sacar a su familia adelante solas,estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianz abrindada en la otorgacion del credito.						
Si quieres ver un video D. la cancha visita esta pagina						
http://videos.lugarlatino.com/video/rGLmg40fBCc/la-cancha-cochabamba-bolivia.htmlnte
texts.en:
The Mikaela communal bank is one of the oldest groups in our agency; it’s in its 8th loan cycle. It’s composed of the following members: Barbara is president and identified as the group leader because she’s a responsible, hard-working woman that always arrives early and pays her installments on time. She has two children and her business is selling food throughout La Cancha (La Cancha is an open-air shopping center in Cochabamba; it’s Bolivia’s largest and has no limits on the kinds of products available, which can be everything from basic food items to automobiles of all kinds). She will use the funds to buy ingredients and supplies to make her delicious meals. Adelaida is group secretary. She is young and has no children. She also sells food throughout La Cancha and will use the funds to buy ingredients and supplies to prepare her dishes. As treasurer we have Susana. She’s married and has two, small children. She sells cosmetics door-to-door and is one of the founding members of the group. All the members took out the loan in order to increase their capital to help their businesses grow. They are all responsible, hard-working people who, in many cases, are the sole providers for their families. They are grateful to Empreder and Kiva for the trust placed in them by granting the loan. If you’d like to see a video of La Cancha, visit this webpage: http://videos.lugarlatino.com/video/rGLmg40fBCc/la-cancha-cochabamba-bolivia.htmlnte

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en:
Aiga Silafai M. is 25 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture, selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  Aiga Silafai has 1 year of experience in this business.  Aiga Silafai needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.  

Aiga wishes to join the program to assist in her business development.  In 2010, Aiga Silafai joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Aiga Silafai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

You can view pictures of sewing lavalavas and puletesis, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at:http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/SewingLavalavasAndPuletesi#

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy L. is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Already a widow at 53, she is blessed to have her three children. She makes sure that she earns so that her family can have a better life. She has been managing her variety store, while also maintaining a piggery, for quite some time now.

Nancy has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business. She will be buying more quantities of products to be incorporated into her current stock inventory. She also will invest some of the loan to maintain their pigs.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: Towards buying more quantities of products to be incorporated into her current stock inventory. She also will invest some of the loan to maintain their pigs.

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kotognontala, composé de femmes mariées et d’une célibataire,  a une moyenne  d’âge de 34 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de la région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de commerce et de voisinage et font la restauration, le commerce des habillements, la location des robes de mariés et le maquillage des nouvelles mariées.                                          
Ces femmes du groupe Kotognontala sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire  et Fatoumata D. qui excelle dans la restauration compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, deux sacs de 100kg de riz, quelques kilos de tubercules (pomme de terre et igname) et des paquets de condiments alimentaires pour la restauration.
Elle s’approvisionne en produits sur place et  souvent à Bamako pour les produits rares. Elle effectue sa vente sur place dans le restaurant à Dioïla, au comptant, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The Kotognontala group is mostly composed of married woman, with one single. The women are on average 34 year-old, with an average of 2 children. They all live in traditional extended families in the city of Dioïla, the prefecture of the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met through business and neighborhood proximities and work in food service, clothing retail, bridal dress rental and bridal makeup services. This is the fourth solidarity loan requested by these women of the Kotognontala group. Fatouamata D., who excels in food service, intends to use her loan to purchase two 100-kilo (220 lb) bags of rice, several kilos of tubers (potatoes and yam) and condiments packets for restaurants. She procures her stock locally and often in Bamako as well, for rarer products. She retails locally in her Dioïla restaurant, selling cash to a clientele of women and men. She plans on an average monthly benefit of 30,000 CFA francs to be used for her family everyday expenses, with the remainder being reinvested in her trade activities.

Translated from French by Charlotte Buecheler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for a restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as cassava, potatoes, vegetables and oil.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia es separada, vive en casa propia con un hijo  en la  zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Silvia trabaja en el Ministerio de Medio Ambiente y con el sueldo que gana mantiene su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de insumos (carne de vaca, de pollo, chorizos, tomates, cebollas, etc.) para la preparación y venta de comida rápida para mejorar sus ingresos.
Esta es la séptima  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Silvia is separated and lives in her own house with one child in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz. She works in the Ministry of the Environment and with the salary she earns is able to maintain her home. Silvia is soliciting a loan to buy supplies (beef, chicken, sausages, tomatoes, onions, etc.) to prepare and sell fast food in order to improve her income. This is the 7th occasion on which she has requested a loan and our socioeconomic analysis finds her to be qualified and grants her access to credit.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING BEEF, CHICKEN, PORK AND OTHER INGREDIANTS FOR PREPARING FAST FOOD

loans.name: Claudia Aracely

texts.es: La Señora Claudia Aracely Z. usara su credito para invertir en su negocio, quiere comprar una maquina para hacer Chorizo, ya que la señora desea prosperar y hacer crecer su clientela y que mas personas se den cuenta de los productos que ella vende. La Señora Claudia es una persona muy trabajadora y le gusta mucho su negocio por lo mismo quiere invertir y hacerlo crecer ya que sera el patrimonio de sus hijos pequeños.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claudia Aracely Z. will use her loan to invest in her business. She wants to buy a machine that makes sausages. She wants to be successful, to grow her client base, and for more people to know about the products she sells. Claudia is very hardworking and loves her business. She wants to invest in and grow her business so that she will be able to better provide for her young children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy a machine to make sausages

loans.name: Horm

texts.en: C., a 32-year-old resident of Kompong Tom Province, located about 200 km from the capital, Phnom Penh, currently makes rattan furniture. She has three children, two of whom are teenagers attending school, while the third is a baby. C. constructs ten sets of rattan and then sells them to her buyers for profit. Generally, her valued clients need to order a few days or a week in advance. Additional family income comes from her husband driving a motor taxi. C. is happy to request a loan to purchase raw materials to make rattan furniture to better meet the needs of her buyers.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make rattan furniture to better meet the needs of her buyer.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is married with eight children and all of them are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She owns a charcoal store in Kyebando Nsooba market. She has been in this charcoal business for two years and buys charcoal from delivery trucks so she doesn’t incur any transport costs to and from shopping. She plans to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She has no additional income. She operates her business from the market and her customers are fellow market vendors. She works six days a week. Her business challenge is seasonality. She resides in and rents a two-room house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water.  Florence’s monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
El Señor Wilder A. V., es soltero y trabaja para ayudar a su padre ya que él es el mayor de sus hijos, el es un joven muy dedicado a su trabajo, el trabaja diariamente con su motocicleta para ayudar de alguna manera a sus hermanos y su padre. Wilder vive en el Trópico de la Ciudad de Cochabamba en la zona conocida como Ivirgarzama.

El aun no cuenta con vehículo (motocicleta) propio para generar ingresos. El señor Wilder Alcázar  se apersono a las oficinas en busca de un crédito para la compra de un vehículo (motocicleta) para así poder cumplir las metas que él tiene. Y poder tener una parcela agrícola propia para así poder cultivar cítricos al igual que su padre y en un futuro más cercano tener una familia con todas las comodidades que él no pudo tener.

El mayor sueño que tiene es darle a su padre todo lo que pueda y de esa manera pueda vivir el resto de su vida feliz y cómodo.
texts.en:
Mr. Wilder Alcázar V. is single and works to help his father since he’s the oldest of his sons. He is a young man who is very dedicated to his work. He works every day with his motorcycle in order to help his father and siblings in some way. Wilder lives Cochabamba’s Trópico area in a zone known as Ivirgarzama. He still doesn’t own his motorcycle with which to generate income. Mr. Wilder Alcázar came by the offices personally to request a loan to buy a motorcycle in order to reach his goals. He also wants to have a field to grow citrus fruits like his father and in the near future have a family with all the comforts he wasn’t able to have. His greatest wish is to give his father everything possible so that he can live the rest of his life happy and comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es: Gisela tiene 45 años de edad, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y comunicativa, vive en su casa heredada por sus padres, en compañía de sus 2 hijos y su nieto  Piero de 6 años. Por muchos años vendía ropa por medio de pedidos de sus clientes, pero hace 10 meses logró tener su puesto de ropa, en el interior del mercado más grande y concurrido de su distrito. Desde entonces, todas las mañanas se levanta para preparar los alimentos de sus hijos, para luego desplazarse a su puesto de venta. El negocio que realiza le fascina, donde generalmente trabaja sola, pero cuando se va de compras solicita el apoyo de su nuera mientras regresa, de ese modo no pierde clientela. En adelante piensa incrementar su negocio, con la venta de lencerías nacionales e importadas, para atender la exigencia de sus clientes. Es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, de ese modo ganarse la confianza a posteriores ayudas, para el crecimiento de su capital. Con el crédito que solicita, comprara más ropas casuales, para cubrir la demanda de sus asiduos compradores.
texts.en:
Gisela is 45 years old and she is a mother and a hardworking and talkative person. She lives in the house she inherited from her parents. She lives with her 2 children and her grandson Piero who is 6 years old. For many years she took orders for items of clothing for her clients. Ten months ago she managed to set up a stand in the interior of the most visited market in the region. Since them she gets up early in the morning to prepare the day's food for the kids and then she makes her way to her stand. She is fascinated by her business. She generally works alone but when she goes out to make her purchases she requests assistance from her sister-in-law, so that she does not miss out on any sales. In the future she hopes to make her business grow by selling locally made items of clothing as well as imported goods, to have the clients' interest. This is the first loan she requests from MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to the obligations of the loan. She hopes to earn the right to have future loans, to supplement her working capital. With the loan she requests she will purchase more casual style clothing, to meet the demand of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase casual style clothing to meet client demand.

loans.name: Rwenyerere Bakyara Tukwatanise Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
As they say, hard work pays! K. Grace, a very hardworking and determined woman, has reaped the fruits of her hard work having started up her clothes selling enterprise over 10 years ago. She offers secondhand clothes in Rushooka Trading Centre, Ntungamo, where she responds to the seasonal markets being close to her customers.

Due to her good management and esteemed customer care, she has maintained customers for a long time creating a good market.  With this loan, Grace wants to buy more clothes for resale. Since she also has a farming business, she also wants to buy more seedlings and manure for her plantations. This will enable her to make more profit and be able to provide for her family and children’s requirements like education. She is very optimistic she will achieve a self-sustaining lifestyle with more income coming her way. 

K. Grace belongs to Rwenyerere Bakyara Tukwatanise Group, Kihihi.

loans.use: Restocking more bales of clothes

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Despite many difficulties in life brought about by poverty, 59 year old Yolanda B. never lost hope that someday an opportunity would come, as long as she believes and has strong faith. It was 1999 when Ahon sa Hirap, Inc., a microfinance institution partner of Kiva in the Philippines visited her house. She immediately joined, because she was so certain that this would be the beginning of her journey towards development. She is also encouraged by the full support of her husband, a construction worker, and their children in this endeavor. As a member of ASHI she did her best to perform well, and she has benefited. The trials and poverty that her family once experienced serves as her inspiration to work hard. Today, with the help of her husband and 5 children, their life is much better than it was before. She was able to send her children to school and to save for the future. She is applying for a loan of 20,000 PHP to finance her growing retail store. She will buy more grocery products, such as: canned goods, sacks of rice, beverages, noodles, soaps and shampoos, and other items to accommodate her increasing number of customers. She wanted to increase her profit so that she could continuously send her children to school and help her husband with their financial needs. She wanted to make money to renovate their house and to buy additional appliances. Her business plan is to build a mini-grocery for her children to manage. She is hoping and praying that ASHI and Kiva friends will support and assist her in her dreams until she reaches them.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, canned goods, beverages, soap, shampoo and other grocery products for retail

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret O. is 54 years old and is married to John O., who runs a butchery that adds to the income for the family. They have three children aged 28, 23 and 15. Margaret cooks chapattis and chips which she sells to her customers, who are mostly residents of Katito and passersby. Her monthly income from this business is Kshs. 6,000.

She is applying for a second loan of Kshs.10,000 from KADET LTD after paying her first loan successfully, and she plans to buy stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, and English potatoes for making French fries locally known as chips. The profit she gets from the proceeds of this loan she plans to save and pay school fees for her last born child who is joining form one next year.

Margaret hopes to grow her business and support her family effectively. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, and English potatoes.

loans.name: Wensi

texts.en: Wensi is a 26-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is into the business of poultry and has been in it for the last year. He says that he started it with a few chicks but now, it has grown with a considerable increase in the number of chickens he has. He says the only challenge is that poultry is a demanding business which needs capital to inject so as to meet the ever changing quality requirements. He would love to see himself becoming a national supplier of chicken. The purpose of the loan facility is to enable Wensi to buy chicks and chicken feed for his poultry farm.

loans.use: Buying chicks and chicken feed for his poultry farm

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes I. is from the village of Brgy. Maddiangat, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 42 years old. Agnes is married and has three children. To make a living, Agnes owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Agnes has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Agnes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agnes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Agnes is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Agnes from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Deberlane

texts.en:
Mrs. Deberlane P. is from the barangay (suburb) of Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old, married to Rancito P. and blessed with 3 children, 2 school-aged and one infant. Deberlane is presently engaged in operating an eatery business. She also receives support from her husband, a jabal-jabal driver, who earns 100 PHP per day. Deberlane has been engaged in her business for 3 months and, although she’s new to it, is earning a monthly income of at least 2,500 PHP. 

Just this year, Deberlane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As a newly-recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, Deberlane is requesting her first loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her existing eatery business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions, especially in meeting their basic needs and in saving for future use, loan repayments, the children’s education and possible business expansions.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her existing eatery business

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Phytosanitary Maintenance.

loans.name: Costique

texts.en:
Costique is 31 years old, married, and has two children. Currently, one of his children attends school. Costique sells utensils, which he has been doing for 6 years. 

Costique will use this loan to purchase and add more utensils to his business. With the new profits, Costique plans to increase the volume of his stock.  He anticipates having a car in the future.

loans.use: To buy utensils for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik, tiene 44 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos de 18, 17 y 9. Sus hijos mayores acaban de terminar la secundaria y quieren ir a la Universidad San Cristóbal en Ayacucho. 
Maria ha tenido muchos problemas con su cónyuge antiguamente, ahora, ella y él se llevan mucho mejor y se siente más seguro sabiendo que ella tiene su propia fuente de ingresos y ahorros.
El sueño de María es comprar un terreno y ver a sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en: María is a member of the Llanpachik community bank.  She is 44 years old, married, and has three children aged 18, 17 and 9.  Her older children have just finished high school and want to go to San Cristóbal University in Ayacucho.  Maria has had a lot of problems with her husband in the past.  Now they get on much better and she feels more certain knowing that she has her own source of income and savings.  María's dream is to buy a plot of land and to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy auto parts

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar de 38 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, tiene un hijo con el viven solos alquilando vivienda, él se dedica a la venta de CD Y DVD de forma ambulante, este negocio le ayuda a mantener a su hijo y pagar los gastos del hogar.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para fortalecer el negocio comprando CD Y DVD para abastecer el negocio, con esta ayuda espera mantenerse competente y atender las demandas de los clientes.
Su principal objetivo es darle a su hijo los estudios necesarios y proveer la alimentación diaria.
texts.en:
Oscar is 38 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera in the department of Morazán. He has a son and they live alone in a rented house. Oscar works selling CDs and DVDs by foot and this business helps him to support his son and pay the household expenses.

He is currently requesting a loan to strengthen his business by purchasing CDs and DVDs to stock it. With this support, he hopes to stay up-to-date and tend to the customers’ demands.

His main goal is to provide his son with the necessary education and provide food on a daily basis.

loans.use: To purchase CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita C. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 51 years old. Rita is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Rita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Ourng

texts.en:
Ourng H. is married and resides with her husband and a child in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. 

H. repairs motorbikes, earning an income of US $4 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend US $50 on food and US $20 on the other necessary expenses. 

H. is requesting a loan of US $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her fifth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Yolanda Fabiola

texts.es:
Yolanda, tiene 42 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la Capital Arqueológica de América,  Cusco – Perú. Yolanda es técnica en enfermería y no tiene trabajo pero está postulando para ESSALUD de la ciudad el Cusco. Yolanda tiene una pequeña librería y tiene una variedad de útiles de escritorio. Ya son varios meses que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Yolanda en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar útiles escolares porque se está acercando campaña escolar.  

Yolanda pertenece al banco comunal “Allin Muju” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 42 years old and has three children.  She lives in the archaeological capital of America (Cusco, Peru).  Yolanda is a nurse.  She doesn't have a job but she is applying to ESSALUD in the city of Cusco.

Yolanda owns a small bookstore and sells a variety of stationery products.  She has been in this business for several months and it is doing very well.  On this occasion, Yolanda requires a loan to buy school supplies because the new school year is approaching.

Yolanda is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Allin Muju" community bank.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is being given with this loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Bamory

texts.fr:
Monsieur BAMORY S. est né le 23 octobre 1966 à BAMAKO. Père de 3 enfants, il vit dans une famille nucléaire à Noumousso - Kadiolo (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Il mène des activités de commercialisation de produits agricoles et alimentaires depuis maintenant 15 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de produits et cela en permanence. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, il décida de collaborer avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt il est à son deuxième prêt de groupe.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter de l’igname : 800kg et des bananes plantains:50régimes. Il s’approvisionne en Côte d’Ivoire, un pays frontalier du MALI. Les produits sont directement acheminés à MOPTI pour être livrés. Il  sont vendus au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer  son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
 Il compte devenir un grossiste de bonne renommée à fin de satisfaire ses nombreux clients qui ne cessent de croître.
texts.en:
Mr. Bamory S. was born on October 23 1966 in Bamako.   Father of three children, he lives with his nuclear family in Noumousso – Kadiolo (the third largest administrative region in the republic of Mali).  

For the past 15 years he has marketed agricultural and food products.  His experience in this industry has earned him a good reputation and he constantly receives product orders.  In order to have the resources necessary to satisfy his customers, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institution.  After properly repaying his first loan, he is at his second loan from the group.  

This loan will allow him to buy 800 kg of yams and 50 bunches of plantains.  He stocks up in the Ivory Coast, a country bordering Mali.  The products are transported directly to MOPTI for delivery.  They are sold for cash to a clientele composed of men and women.

With this loan, he expects to make an average monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and invest the rest in his business.  He plans to become a reputable wholesaler in order to satisfy his many customers who continue to grow more numerous.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Jose Victor

texts.es: José tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos menores. Vive en la parte rural del distrito de Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. Desde hace más de 3 años, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. Realiza esta actividad en un terreno cerca de su domicilio. Cuando los animales alcancen un buen peso y tamaño, los vende a los negociantes que suelen visitar su comunidad. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida en la zona. Desea usar su crédito para comprar más animales y alimentos balanceados. También, pretende hacer unos arreglos a sus corrales para lograr una presentación más profesional de sus animales para sus clientes. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José, 28, is married and has two minor children.  He lives in the rural part of Lambayeque District in northern Perú.  For over three years he’s been raising small farm animals to sell.  He does this activity on a piece of land near his home.  When the animals reach a good size and weight he sells them to merchants that tend to visit his community.  He has a well-established clientele in the zone.

He wants to use his loan to buy more animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them.  He also intends to do some repair work on his corrals so that his animals will attain a more professional appearance for his customers.  Because of this, he’s deemed it convenient to request a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to repair his corrals, buy more animals and balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
Memuna is 35 years old. She is married to a school teacher and has a 10-year-old child. In 1996, she established her imported food stuff business. She began her business when she realized that she needed to contribute financially to provide livelihood for their family. She opens her business 6 days a week and 10 hours a day. 

Memuna has a good loan repayment history. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to buy more imported stuff to sell. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different types of imported stuff for her business.

loans.name: Carmiña

texts.es: Carmiña quien se dedica al comercio de productos de belleza por catalogo, desde hace mas de cuatro años, cuenta con una gran variedad de productos, la venta lo realiza tanto al contado como a crédito, vive en domicilio de propiedad de sus padres quienes se encuentran en el exterior,  tiene un niño a quien mantiene, solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como maquillajes, cremas para manos, perfumes y esmaltes para uñas, etc.  ya que ella como promotora tiene descuentos y también compra cosméticos que se encuentran en promoción,  y  compra mercadería para almacenar y después los vende y así poder incrementar sus ingresos, es una persona luchadora que sola saca a su familia adelante, esta agradecida con la institución por al apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Carmina has been selling beauty products by catalogue for more than four years. She has a wide variety of products. She completes her sales both in cash and on credit. she lives in her parents' house but they live outside the country. She has a son whom she supports. She requests a loan to purchase merchandise, such as makeup, hand lotions, perfumes, nail polish, etc. And as she enjoys discounts for being a promoter she also purchases cosmetics that are on sale. She purchases merchandise to keep in supply for later resale and to increase her earnings. she is a fighter who is solely responsible for supporting her family. She is thankful to the organization for the support given to her.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, such as makeup, hand lotions, perfumes, and nail polish.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 29 and married to Salome. The couple has been blessed with one child. For the past 21 years, Michael has been selling shoes in an open air market in Nairobi. 

Michael is requesting his sixth loan from KADET LTD to buy more shoes to sell. He has successfully repaid his previous loans. Michael hopes to open another outlet with the anticipated profits from his loan and to take good care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase five bales of shoes to sell

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es:
Estanislao, se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su esposa; el negocio de don Estanislao consiste en la venta de productos lácteos, queso, cuajada, requesón y leche, lleva cuatro años dedicándose al negocio.
Él necesita por el momento un préstamo que le ayude a comprar leche a ganaderos de la zona, ya que su negocio es comprar la leche y procesarla en cuajada, requesón y crema, con este préstamo le ayudara a trabajar y producir más.
Su aspiración es el logro de construir su propia vivienda, ya que actualmente alquila con su familia.
texts.en:
Estanislao sells dairy products. He is 43 years old and lives with his wife. Estanislao sells dairy products such as hard cheese, cheese curds, requesón cheese [a type of soft cheese], and milk. He has been in this business for four years. 

He needs a loan to help him to buy milk from dairy producers in the area, since his business is to buy the milk and process it into cheese curds, requesón cheese, and cream. This loan will help him to work and produce more.

His aspiration is to build this own house, since her currently rents for his family.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: G.s. Maria Elena Cuadra Group

texts.es: El grupo Solidario Llamado Maria Elena Cuadra está conformado por  Reyna Maria Ana Fabiola. A pesar de las diversas actividades económicas que ellas tienen como es venta de ropa  elaboración de piñatas y adornos manuales, todas tienen  el mismo objetivo de salir adelante porque sus negocios les han propiciado los estudios necesarios a sus hijos. Ana  tiene más de 10 años de trabajar en el negocio de piñatas. Sus clientes siempre le están solicitando variedad en la elaboración de sus piñatas. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de papel periódico, mecates, pega, papel crepe y tinajas.
texts.en: The 'Maria Elena Cuadra' community bank has two members: Reyna Maria and Ana Fabiola.  In spite of the fact that they have different business activities - selling clothes, and making piñatas and decorations by hand - they both have the same goal of getting ahead because their business have helped them provide their children with an education.  Ana has been in the piñata business for more than ten years.  Her customers have always requested variety in the piñatas she makes.  She will use her loan to buy newspaper, string, glue, crepe paper and earthenware jars.

loans.use: to buy newspaper, string, glue, crepe paper and earthenware jars

loans.name: Tejkumari

texts.en:
Tejkumari is 50 years-old .  She is married and has 4 children, ages 26, 23, 19 and 17.  In 1995, she established  her furniture business.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received, and successfully repaid,  5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy wood and timber for her business. 

In the future, Tejkumari plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way.  Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture.  With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets.  With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of his or her lumber purchases or hire additional labor.  This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability.

loans.use: to buy wood and timber

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is aged 40 and married with 7 children. She is a farmer from Nkubu town in eastern Kenya where she has been farming for 10 years now. Her farm produces bananas and beans which she sells to the local market. Farming has been her major source of income.

Josphine has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy chickens and chicken feed in order to practice poultry farming. She hopes that this project will generate enough income to enable her to improve her family's livelihood. She plans to use the extra income from this loan to build a modern house for her family. She faces the challenge of the lack of enough water which affects her production.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is a 34-year-old woman, married and residing in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has four school-aged children. She is raising goats and selling them to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She earns PHP 3,000 a month from selling the grown goats. Cheryl has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional goats to raise and be sold when grown. She has been connected to GDMPC for one year. She hopes to raise more goats in the future and earn adequate income so she can start her house renovation plan.

loans.use: To purchase additional goats to raise.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: El señor Lucio nació en la ciudad de La Paz, casado con la Sra. Rosario y tienen un hijo ya joven que se encuentra en la universidad, su domicilio es propio ubicado en la zona la Guardia,  es Artesano y vende artesanías en la frontera con el Brasil (corumba), hace unos treinta años se dedica a esta labor, el destino del crédito es para la compra de una moto para su hijo Adrián quien necesita para movilizarse a la universidad y así poder ahorra dinero en pasajes, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: Lucio was born in the city of La Paz.  He is married to Rosario, and they have a son who is studying at the university.  He lives in his own home, located in the La Guardia neighborhood.  He is a craftsman, and he sells handicrafts at the Brazilian border (in Corumba.)  He has been doing this work for 30 years.  He will use this loan to buy a motorcycle for his son Adrian, who needs it to get to the university, and in this way can save the money he spends on bus tickets.  Lucio is grateful to the institution for the support that they have provided him.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita.  She is 58 years old and is a resident of Cabrera, Pasay City, Philippines.  She is widow with six children, two are already working while the rest still live at home. She, together with her children, manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teresita operates a school supplies business. It is where one can buy school supplies like pen, bond paper, cartolina and the like, without going to a bookstore.  She gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help continue the operations of her business, Teresita is requesting a 11,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional school supply products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Teresita hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy school supplies to resell

loans.name: Kimhun

texts.en:
Kimhun, 31 years old, is a food seller with $7.50 per day for her income. Her husband is a worker with $6 per day for his income. She has four children; one is studying and other three have not started school yet because they are too young. Besides her family, she is also living with one brother and one sister. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $8 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for use in the family. In the future, she wants to buy a stock of rice to resell and repair her house when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila nació en la provincia de Paucartambo en la ciudad de Huancarani y tiene 39 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. 

Actualmente, Domitila vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella tiene una pequeña ferretería donde vende diferentes tipos de productos como por ejemplo clavos, llantas, cables, focos y muchas cosas más. En esta oportunidad Domitila requiere el crédito para comprar clavos, calaminas, llantas y otras cosas mas. 

El Banco Comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Domitila was born in Paucartambo province, in the city of Huancarani.  She is 39 years old, and is married with four children.

Currently, Domitila lives in the same city where she was born, and this is where she works.  She has a small hardware store where she sells different types of products, for example nails, tires, cables, lights and many more things.  On this occasion, Domitila is requesting the loan to buy nails, roofing materials, tires and other additional items.

The “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” Communal Bank meets weekly in the district of Huancarani, in Paucartambo province in the department of Cusco (in Peru).  Cusco is well-known for being an area with much tourism and commerce, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and also because it's the location of Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy nails, roofing materials, tires and other additional items.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
La Señora María es de la ciudad de Santaní, vive en su casa propia. Ella tiene un Copetín en la zona del Mercado Municipal, ella es una Señora muy emprendedora, trabajadora y creativa, es una cliente recurrente de la Fundación y le agradece por darle la oportunidad de ayuda a su negocio. Su objetivo es ampliar su negocio y asi mas adelante poder tener un comedor.
Ella comenta que su negocio la ha ayudado a salir adelante y mantener a su familia, dice que tiene muchos clientes lo cual le genera muy buenos ingresos. Le gustaría poder seguir con su negocio para poder ir creciendo día a día.>P>
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, golosinas y otros para el abastecimiento de su copetín, con lo cual podrá cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
María’s from the city of Santaní.  She has a snack bar in the municipal market.  She’s a very enterprising woman; hardworking and creative.  She’s a recurrent client of the Fundación and she thanks it for giving her the opportunity of help for her business.  Her goal is to enlarge her business so that later on she can have an eatery.

She comments that her business has helped her get ahead and to support her family.  She says that she has many customers which allows her to generate good income.  She’d like to be able to stay in business and to make it grow more each day.

She is asking for the loan to buy soft-drinks, snacks and other items to stock her snack bar in order to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, snacks and other stock items for her snack bar.

loans.name: Nonima

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Nonima works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Nonima is borrowing 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Nonima has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is married with three children. Lucia is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Lucia is a farmer and grows rice and corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers.

Lucia has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Lucia hopes to improve their living status.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. She is into kenkey production, which she has done for 10 years. To prepare her kenkey, she buys maize from the market and soaks it in water to soften the maize for three days. On the third day, she washes the maize and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough out of the milled wet corn and leaves it for a day.

She divides the risen dough into two. She mixes one with water to get it into a porridge-like consistency form and cooks it until it is firm, but not fully cooked. She later mixes the rest of the uncooked dough with the half-cooked dough. She molds the dough into balls and wraps them in corn husks. She then cooks them again till they become soft enough to eat.

Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces such as pepper sauce. It is often served with meat or fish, such as fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, and roasted turkey. 

Araba will use the loan to procure sacks of maize to make kenkey.

loans.use: to procure sacks of maize to make kenkey.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi est un homme âgé de 29 ans. Il est marié å une coiffeuse. Il a 1 enfant non scolarisé et agé de 03ans. 
Koffi travaille comme commerçant depuis 2010. Il exploite un cyber café pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir avoir accès à la connexion internet. 
Koffi a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de nouveaux ordinateurs et augmenter le débit de la connexion. Il veut améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Koffi is 29 years old and married to a hairdresser. The couple have one child, aged 3, who does not go school.

Koffi has been working as a salesman since 2010. He runs a one-man business, operating a cyber cafe for a wide clientele. His main challenge lies in getting internet access.

Koffi is requesting his first loan from WAGES in order to buy new computers and boost his internet connection speed. He would like to be able to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy new computers

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is 42 years old. She is married and has 3 children, ages 21, 19 and 15. 

In 1999, Jayanti established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers.  

In the future, Jayanti plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Fayaremu A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Fayaremu A Group in Western Kenya! Roseline is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

 Roseline takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Roseline had a very good maize yield, harvesting 15 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Roseline was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Roseline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Roseline will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Fayaremu A group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS ORQUIDEAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teresa; ella tiene 54 años de edad y es casada y tiene 9 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida y también vende chicha que es una bebida a base de maíz, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener otro restaurant y salir adelante en sus negocios. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carnes, verduras, pollos y arroz al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Señora Teresa belongs to the communal bank "Las Orquideas".  The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.   

She is 54 years old, married and has 9 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling food and chicha, a corn-based drink. She sells in an itinerant manner from 7:00 am until 8:00 pm.  Through this business she has been able to provide for her children.  Her dream is to have a restaurant and get ahead in her business.  She is requesting a loan to buy wholesale food products to prepare such as meats, vegetables, chicken and rice.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase meats, vegetables, chicken and rice.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia de mesmo nome, Sul de Moçambique, viuva e mae de 4 filhos dos um ainda esta a fazer a faculdade e os outros ja lincenciados. Fez 6ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta sua sogra enviando algum valor para ajudar nas despesas de casa.

É comerciante ha mais de 20 anos e o seu produto preferido e carne que compra no Reino da Suazilandia e revende em Boane, onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt a 5.000.00mt por mês e aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, farinha, açucar, refrescos, sabaõ e outros) para aumentar e diversificar a sua mercadoria. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 15.000.00, 30.000.00, 40.000.00mt e 45.000.00mt aplicados para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende construir um talho, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Veronica was born in the city of Maputo, which is in Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is widowed and has four children; two of them are still in college, and the others have graduated from college. Veronica finished sixth grade and did not continue with school because she could not afford it. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her mother-in-law by sending her some money to help with household expenses.

She has been a businesswoman for more than 20 years, and her favorite product to sell is meat. She buys it in the Kingdom of Swaziland and resells it in Boane, which gives her an income of around 4,000 to 5,000 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

Veronica has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is her fifth Hluvuku loan, and she is asking for 20,000 meticais to buy products (rice, flour, sugar, soft drinks, soap and other items) to increase and diversify her inventory. The earlier loans were for 15,000 meticais, 30,000 meticais, 40,000 meticais and 45,000 meticais, and all were for the same purpose.

She promises to make her payments on time, and in the future she intends to build a butcher's shop. In order to do that, she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell meat and other products (rice, flour, sugar, soft drinks, soap, etc.).

loans.name: Juan Benigno

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre  trabajador  que tiene una pequeña peluquería. Comenzó con esta actividad  porque trabajo en una peluquería y decidió tener su propio negocio para mejorar sus ingresos. 

Trabaja todos los días desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm. Sus actividades en la peluquería son  peinados, cortes, tinturados etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo herramientas para la peluquería como sillas, mesas, tijeras etc.
texts.en: Juan is a hardworking man who has a small barber shop.  He started this activity because he had worked in a barber shop and he decided to have a business of his own to improve his income.  He works every day from 8am until 6pm.  His barber services include hair styling, haircuts, hair coloring, etc.  He has many hopes for his business and that is why he wants to use the loan to buy tools for the shop like chairs, tables, scissors, etc.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and scissors.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 33 years old. She is married with 2 children aged between 6 and 11 years, they all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been farming for the past 9 years. With the loan from kiva, she would like to pay the workers who harvested beans. The profits from the business will be used to buy a land and buy cow for rearing.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who harvested beans.

loans.name: Mwitethya S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Catherine. She is twenty nine years old, married and a mother of two. She is a member of Mwitethya S.H.G which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from enterprise development and financial management training.
She operates a small cafe in her village. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy additional utensils and chairs. This will help her meet her customer’s demand hence increase her income. She will use the anticipated income to provide food and clothing for her family.
