She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy additional utensils and chairs for her cafe so as to meet customer's demands hence more income to provide food and clothing for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase goods to sell in the grocery shop

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is married and lives in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon with her husband and 6 children. She has always enjoyed and been good at sales. Therefore, seeing the needs of her household (and with the help of a friend) she began selling cosmetics and jewelry via catalog. At first it wasn't easy because she had few sales and customers. Nevertheless, with daily work and arduous effort little by little to she successfully increased her customer base and grew her sales volume.

She is an example of strength and perseverance. She didn't give up the battle and 9 years after beginning her business she continues the fight to increase it every day. Therefore, she needs a loan for $USD1,200 to invest in additional merchandise and increase her sales volume. You can become an important and fundamental part of Flavia's success. This business is sustaining her children. Don't doubt any more, she needs you.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Flavia es casada y vive en la localidad de Monterrey, Nuevo León, con su esposo y sus 6 hijos. Ella siempre ha tenido gusto y facilidad por las ventas, por lo que al ver las necesidades que tenían en su hogar y con la ayuda de una amiga, comenzó a vender cosméticos y joyería por catálogo. Al principio no fue nada fácil, pues sus ventas eran bajas y no tenía muchos clientes, sin embargo con su trabajo diario y esfuerzo arduo logro poco a poco incrementar su cartera de clientes y aumentar por mucho el volumen de sus ventas.

Ella es un ejemplo de constancia y perseverancia, pues no desistió en la batalla y después de ya 9 años de iniciar con su negocio aún continúa y lucha por seguir creciendo cada día más. Es por ello que ella necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 1200 DLLS para invertirlos en la compra de más mercancía e incrementar sus ventas. Tú puedes volverte parte importante y fundamental de los logros de Flavia, pues un negocio es la actividad que mantiene a sus hijos. Non lo dudes más, ella te necesita.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Everardo

texts.en:
Mr. M. small convenience store which he aims to keep well stocked. "I'm in one of the city's newer neighborhoods and want to keep my neighbors happy so I'm asking for a $1,000 loan to increase the variety of my products."

Translated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. M. cuenta con un pequeñoo negocio de abarrotes su idea principal del negocio es mantenerlo surtido. "Estoy en uno de los nuevos fraccionamientos de la ciudad y quisiera tener bien complacidos a todos mis vecinos así que solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls para comprar mas variedad de mercancía".

loans.use: To buy more products for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Add more Dairy Goats

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: A thirty-five year old mother of four children, Kadiatu works hard to earn an income to meet her children’s expenses.   Kadiatu said that with such a big family, her husband is unable to meet each family members needs, so she needs to supplement what her husband can provide.  She runs a small business selling stable items in the market town of Kabala in Sierra Leone.  With some of her profits, she invests in goats and sheep and raises them with her parents.  After fattening the animals, she will sell them for profit. She is requesting the loan to increase her stock of foodstuffs and purchase two more sheep for fattening.

loans.use: Purchasing livestock and extra inventory to expand her business

loans.name: Gusti Ayu Putu Karti

texts.id:
Gusti Ayu Putu Kartini with husband and 2 children still stays in her brother's house. To fullfill family needs Gusti Ayu Putu Kartini became a pig farmer. Loan from Dinari organization for Rp1,700,000 (about US$190) will be used to buy 2 sorts of local balinese piglets for Rp500,000 (about $55) for both. Every morning Gusti Ayu Putu Kartini prepared the food for the 2 piglets. In the evenings Gusti Ayu Putu Kartini and children also feed the piglets. Feed expenses for 3 months could reach Rp250,000 (about $28). After 3 months those piglets could be sold for Rp1,300,000 (about $143). Nett profit of 3 months are about Rp500,000 (about $55). With this she could support her husband's income as a tenant farmer, and to pay for childrens education expenses. Gusti Ayu Putu Kartini plans to expand her business, so that Gusti Ayu could afford her own accomodation.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Gusti Ayu Putu Kartini berserta suami dan kedua orang anaknya tinggal satu rumah dan masih menumpang pada saudaranya.Untuk mencukupi keluarganya Gusti Ayu Kartini mempunyai kegiatan pokok yaitu beternak babi. Dengan pinjaman dari Yayasan DINARI sebersar Rp.1.700.000,- dipergunakan untuk membeli 2 babi jenis lokal Bali dengan harga Rp.500.000,- keduanya. Setiap pagi Gusti Ayu Kartini menyiapkan pakan untuk kedua babinya. Sedang sore harinya Gusti Ayu Krtini dibantu oleh kedua orang anaknya dalam memberikan pakan babinya. Biaya pakan selama 3 bulan dapat mencapai Rp. 250.000,- Selama 3 bulan dipelihara kemudian babi dijual dengan harga Rp.1.300.000,- semuanya. Keuntungan bersih selama 3 bulan dapat mencapai Rp.500.000,- Dengan keuntungan hasil beternaknya dapat membantu pendapatan suaminya yang sebagai petani, dan untuk biaya sekolah anak-anaknya. Gusti Ayu Putu Kartini mempunyai rencana untuk mengembangkan usahanya dan dari usahanya itu Gusti Ayu akan mampu memiliki tempat tinggal sendiri.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock

Membeli bibit babi

loans.name: Bibiniso

texts.en: Bibiniso Odirmatov  is a very cheerful person who loves animals. Her whole life she has been doing livestock-breeding. She has a big family which consists of 5 children, husband, and grand-parents. Her business is raising sheep and billy goats and selling them at  "Oppon va Bulok" animal market in the Asht region, Tadjikistan. Currently she has 10 sheep and three billy goats. She has a big yard for her animals and her children help her to take care of them.Often, her children bring the sheep to graze on near-by montainsides. At present, Bibiniso wants to receive a loan to buy fodder for her animals for the winter months.

loans.use: Purchase of fodder for domestic animals

loans.name: Lindomera Esterfilia

texts.es:
Lindomira is a member of the community bank La Amistad. She lives in the San Martín region, in the province and district of Moyabambo. She runs her business out of her house, selling charcoal made from mezquite and other local trees (chupetes) wholesale and retail.

The loans she has received from the community bank along with a little money of her own gave her the opportunity to increase her sales of mezquite charcoal. She carries the charcoal directly from the city of Chiclayo and sells it to the roasted chicken restaurants, Peruvian grilled brochette restaurants, meat barbeque restaurants and other businesses in the community.

With this loan of 1000 soles (Peruvian currency), which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy mezquite charcoal in sacks, which is a very high quality product in high demand by the businesses in her area selling grilled chicken and grilled meats.

Lindomira is 31 years old. She lives with her husband and their two young children. Lindomira is very young and optimistic. She longs to someday open a video game center in her house ,as well, to offer entertainment to the people of her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lindomira pertenece al Banco Comunal La Amistad, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Moyabamba. Desarrolla su negocio en su propia casa y se dedica a la venta al por mayor y menor de carbón de algarrobo y chupetes.

Con los préstamos otorgados por el Banco Comunal y al contar con un capital propio le dio la oportunidad de incrementar la comercialización de carbón de algarrobo que trae directamente desde la ciudad de Chiclayo y los vende a las pollerías, anticucherías, a las que realizan parilladas y a otros negocios que se desarrollan en la comunidad.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará carbón de algarrobo en sacos, producto de muy buena calidad y que es muy requerido por todos aquellos negocios de la localidad que se dedican a la venta de pollos a la brasa y parrillas diversas de carnes.

La señora Lindomira tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 pequeños hijos, mujer joven y optimista, anhela instalar también en su casa una red de videos de juegos recreativos y brindar diversión a los pobladores de su barrio.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal for sale wholesale and retail

loans.name: Belmira

texts.en:
Belmira M. V. has a business raising and selling chickens in the city of Juanjui, San Martin.  She started the business 6 months ago from the back of her home with the help of Manuela Ramos Credi Mujer´s chicken raising project.  They taught her how to raise and care for the chickens including what medicines are necessary and helped her design a modern chicken coup.  She now has a hundred valuable chickens to sell and a steady source of income for many years to come.

Belmira is 52 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She´s an active, happy woman and now the president of Manuela Ramos´s chicken project.  She helps educates other women partnered with the Microfinance Institution start their own profitable chicken businesses.  She loves helping, building relationships, and being a positive member in her community.  Before she worked in Lima as a house maid for many years.

Belmira is a member of the community bank Mi Sueño and is requesting a loan of $350 to repay over 4 months.  With the loan she will buy food and medicines for her poultry.  One day she dreams of owning some land where she can raise other animals as well.

loans.use: To buy food and medicines for her poultry

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyễn Thị Thủy, 32 years old, singled, lives in Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Her occupation is in clothing. She has been in this business for 5 years now. She started her career at a vocational school with a tuition fee of 50USD a month. After 6 months she starts a tailor shop at home. Few months after that her shop becomes well known in the area and her income picks up pretty well. It is 200USD a month presently. She is applying for a loan of 825USD to stock up material and to expand her shop. Weekly repayments are easy for her since her income is very steady.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Thủy, 32 tuổi, chưa lập gia đình, hiện đang sinh sống tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Công việc chính của chị hiện nay là kinh doanh hàng may mặc. Chị làm nghề này được 5 năm. Bắt đầu với việc đi học ở trung tâm dạy nghề, chi phí hàng tháng là 50USD. Sau 6 tháng chị Thủy mở cửa hàng may mặc tại nhà. Sau một vài tháng, cửa hàng bắt đầu có những khách quen thu nhập dần đủ chị trang trải chi phí cho cuộc sống. Đến nay thu nhập của cửa hàng đạt 200USD/tháng. Cửa hàng có khách thường xuyên, việc hoàn trả tuần của chị Thủy càng thêm thuận lợi. Dự kiến vòng vốn này chị xin vay 825USD để mua thêm vải may quần áo tăng thêm lợi nhuận cho cửa hàng.

loans.use: Buy material and expand her tailor shop

loans.name: Baenka Group

texts.fr:
Our project consists in the purchase and warehousing of livestock feed which is then sold to livestock breeders in the towns and various neighborhoods of Dakar. We intend to set up sales points in the various neighborhoods where people raise sheep, goats, and chickens. In general, it is very productive to set up such a project since breeders have to find feed daily for their livestock or their poultry. This project will allow us to create work for all the members of the group, since each of us will be responsible for managing one of the sales points in our eco-village. Thus, thanks to Kiva, we will be able to create jobs for young people who will then no longer have to consider taking off by sea to immigrate illegally, incurring who knows what consequences.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Notre projet consiste à l'achat et au stockage d'aliments pour animaux d'élevage et ensuite les revendre aux élèveurs qui sont dans les villes et les différents quartiers de Dakar. Nous allons constituer des points de vente dans les différents quartiers de la ville où les populations s'adonnent à l'élevage de moutons, chèvres et poulets. En général, il est très intéressant de monter un projet pareil car tous les jours, les populations vont à la recherche d'aliment pour leur bétails ou pour leur poulailler domestique. Ce projet permettra de créer des emplois pour tous les membres du GIE, car chacun d'entre nous aura à gérer un point de vente d ans un quartier de notre écovillage. Ainsi, gr^ce à Kiva, nous allons créer des emplois pour des jeunes qui ne penseront plus à prendre le mer pour une immigration clandestine dont on ignore les conséquences.

loans.use:
Purchase of livestock feed

Achat d'aliments pour bétail

loans.name: Manka's Valentine Group

texts.en:
Manka is a single woman with 4 children. She and her husband also take care of 3 other children. Manka has been selling food since 2004. Everyday she works from 6.30am to 8pm at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She is hoping for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Asia and Saida, who are gocery shop owners.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Richmond

texts.en: Richmond L. is 25 years old. He is single and enjoys trading. He is a retailer of engine oil, break fluid, and other spare car parts. He buys his supplies from oil filling station operators in barrels and sells in smaller quantities to his customers. He is handicapped by low working capital since the oil price has gone up. He therefore needs the loan to remain in business. He wants to use the loan to buy additional barrels of engine oil, gallons of break fluid, and scraps to serve his customers. He believes this will enable him to make a good income from his business. He is a member of the community group called Ezekiel Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy additional barrels of engine oil, gallons of break fluid, and scraps

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Q., 57 years old, joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) in 2003.  She has 5 children, all got married.  She now lives with one of them.  Mrs. Q. borrowed money from TYM Fund to breed animals and buy materials to make mats.  Since she has many experiences in making mats, her business is very good.  She has so many customers and all of her mats are sold out very quickly.  Besides making mats, Mrs. Q. also breeds pigs.  She currently ha 5 pigs that are ready to be sold.  This time she wants to borrow 375 USD to breed pigs and to buy materials to make mats.
On average, Mrs. Q. approximately 219USD per month.

 Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Quyền 57 tuổi, năm 2003 chị tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương, chị có 5 người con đã xây dựng gia đình, hiện nay chị sống cùng 1 người con, tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và mua vật liệu dệt chiếu, với kinh nghiệm gia đình có nhiều năm làm nghề dệt chiếu nên công việc làm ăn của gia  chị  rất thuận lợi, khách đến mua chiếu của gia đình chị rất đông, sản phẩm chiếu nhà chị làm không kịp bán, ngoài việc thu nhậ từ nghề dệt chiếu gia đình chị còn thu nhập từ chăn nuôi lợn, hiện nay gia đình chị đang có 5 con lợn thịt đang chờ xuất. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 6.000.000 đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và mua vật liệu dệt chiếu.
Thu nhập bình quân 3.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing to replenish a small store.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Mr. L. Phorn, 31, is a builder of Khmer-style houses. He is married and has two children. He lives in Kampong Choeung Commune, Kampong Thom Province. He is a skilled builder and earns money from house owners when he completes their houses, and sometimes owners pay half the amount up front. When customer demand increases, sometimes he goes far from home to build houses and has to spend a lot of time traveling.

To reduce the expenses of traveling and make his job easier, he decided to request a loan to purchase a motorcycle to use to travel to his construction jobs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use to travel to his construction jobs

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Mrs. Thai N., 61, is married with three children and lives in Khan Meanchey, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She and her husband not only work as landlords, but they also work selling breakfast and lunch to their tenants and the people in their area, making typically around $15/day of income. Meanwhile, one of her children is a construction worker, one works selling sugar cane juice and the rest work helping her parents.
Mrs. Thai N. would like to ask for a loan to purchase a stand at a market, the best location to serve her food.

loans.use: To purchase a stand at a market to sell her food

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarita S. lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family home with her husband and two sons. Both of her sons currently attend elementary school. 
Mrs. Sarita and her husband Mr. Puspa S. make baked goods. They have been in business baking cakes and cookies for one year. They sell their baked goods to local shops and markets.
Mrs. S. is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients to expand their business. They will use the extra income generated by expanding their business to send their children to better schools.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for baking

loans.name: 31- Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 5 people. They live in Nam Ngan ward, T. Hoa City. They want to borrow money to buy something to resell in the markets. Mrs Ngan is the group leader. She was born in 1977. Her husband is Mr. An, and he is 38 years old. They has a daughter in grade five. Other members of the group include the following:

Mrs T. Thuy was born in 1984, and her husband is Mr T. Van. He is 25 years old. They have a very small child. 

Mrs Nguyet has 2 children and her children are studying in school. 

Mrs Kim was born in 1956. Her husband is Mr Thuyet.

Mrs Mai borrows money to open a small restaurant, and her husband is Mr Tuong.

Mrs Phuong is 59 years old and her husband is Mr Truong. They have 3 children and their children stopped studying after they finished grade seven and now they lend money. Their mother wants to borrow from the Fund for T. Hoa Poor Women to open a small shop making photographs.

loans.use: Buying food & household items to resell

loans.name: Eddison

texts.es: Eddison tiene 21 años, vive solo, ya que aún es soltero. Se dedica al servicio de llamadas por celular, de forma ambulatoria, para ganarse la vida. El incursionó en este negocio hace dos años, para ya no depender de su familia y por fin independizarse, lo cual logró gracias a su trabajo, le gusta mucho trabajar y sabe que el trabajo dignifica al hombre, sintiéndose muy feliz y útil. El negocio está marchando bien y Eddison quiere que siga creciendo, pero sabe que aún le falta un largo camino por recorrer y mucho trabajo por realizar. Se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar otros equipos celulares para ponerlos a trabajar.
texts.en:
Eddison is 21 years old and lives on his own as he is still single. He offers cellular phone services as a street vendor for a living. He started this business two years ago so that he would not have to depend on his family. He finally became independent with this job. He really likes to work and knows that work dignifies mankind, so he feels happy and useful. Eddison’s business is going well, and he wants it to keep growing, but he knows that he must go a long way and work hard. This is his second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and he has been punctual with his payments. With the money that he is requesting, he would like to purchase more cellular phones.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cellular phones

loans.name: Kalanzi B-Revocate Group

texts.en:
Revocate B. is 30 years old. She is a hardworking and popular fishmonger in Kalanzi zone. Every morning, she travels 15 kilometers to Ggaba – a landing site on the shores of Lake Victoria – to purchase various types of fish such as tilapia, nile perch, mukeene and kolongo. When she gets back to her stall she dries and smokes some of the tilapia and also slices some of the nile perch into small, affordable pieces of various sizes which she later deep fries in the evening from 5pm-9pm, her peak business hours. This is aimed at meeting the diverse tastes and preferences of her customers.

From fish worth 100,000 Ugandan shillings (about USD$50), Revocate gets a profit of 50,000 shillings. At the moment, she is using the loan proceeds to purchase more fish hoping for increased sales and increased profits. She is a married mother of four and she also takes care of her parents. Her ambition is to become a supplier of both fish and green bananas to the market vendors. She hopes that when her dream comes true she will build a modern residence for her family.

Revocate will share this loan with the four other members of her group.

loans.use: To purchase more fish.

loans.name: Oteka

texts.en:
Oteka D. is 26 years old. She is married and has a child. Oteka’s business is sewing traditional women’s dresses. Three years ago, she started offering her services as a seamstress to her neighbors and acquaintances. She conducts this work with only one sewing machine right now. She sells finished clothes in the market.

Fortunately, the good service that she offers and the good materials with which she works help her to make her small factory progress. Despite her young age, Oteka already has apprentices at her tailoring shop. As a result of the large quantity of orders, she needs to acquire another machine so she may satisfy the orders. For that reason in mind, she is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni for a term of 10 months to buy a sewing machine. With your help, Oteka can grow her business and improve her family’s quality of life. She thanks you for your trust and support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Repairs on sewing workshop and purchasing a sewing machine.

loans.name: Elina

texts.fr: Elina habite le quartier de gbadagbo, elle fait le commerce de produits génériques  et ce depuis  2001, elle voudrait agrandir son stock c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite pour sa deuxième fois à wages un crédit de 300000F, elle est mariée à un brodeur  et a 02 enfants
texts.en:
Elina lives in the Gbadagbo district. She has been doing commerce in generic pharmaceutical products since 2001. She would like to expand her inventory, and so she is requesting for a second time a loan from WAGES in the amount of 300,000 francs. She is married to an embroiderer and has two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell generic pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Ha Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hà Thị Hiển   năm nay  44 tuổi , chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con đang tuổi đến trường  tại thị xã Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc.Chị Hiển tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Hiện tại cả hai vợ chồng chị Hiển đều đang kinh doanh cửa hàng ăn phục vụ cho công nhân tại nhà. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm thực phẩm cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Ms. Hà Thị Hiển is 44 years old. She is living with her husband and two school-aged children in the town of Phúc Yên, Vĩnh Phúc province. Ms. Hiển joined TYM Fund since 2005. Currently, she and her husband are operating a restaurant out of their home. This is also is the family's main source of income, providing 6,000,000 VND per month. For the upcoming loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 20,000,000 VND to purchase more food products for the family's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase for food products to sell.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha A. works as a hair dresser at the fish port in Elmina.  She also sells mesh cloth for hair and weave-on hair pieces.  Agatha has been in business since 2003.  She is single with no children and has received an education through junior high school.  Agatha is requesting a loan to improve her hair-styling business. She plans on using her profits to invest in her business and further improve her income and standard of living.

loans.use: To improve hair-styling business

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: El señor Roberto Gomes L. tiene la edad de 27 años habita en San Caralampio loma Negra en Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con las cosas del hogar, ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijos un varón de 13 años que actualmente estudia y una niña de 10 que también estudia, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar la vivienda, para poder darle una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos y apoyarlo en sus estudios , desde hace diez años trabaja como productor , el mayor problema que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , el inicio la actividad agrícola con el apoyo de su suegra que el brindo una manzana de tierra para que la trabajará . Los planes hacia un futuro en sus cultivos es poder diversificarlo, con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para poder tener una producción buena y vender bien en el mercado.
texts.en:
Roberto G. L. is 27 years old and lives in San Caralampio, Negra hill en Ticuantepe with his wife who helps him with household matters. They care for their two children, a 13-year old boy that currently goes to school and a 10-year old girl that also attends school. Their plans as a family are to improve their home, to have a better quality of life for their children, and to help them with their studies. For ten years, he has worked as a producer. The major problem that presents itself is the lack of financing. He began his agricultural activities with the help of his mother-in-law, who gave him a parcel of land so that he could work. His plan for the future of his crops is to diversify. With this financing, he will buy fertilizer and consumables so that he will be able to have a good harvest and good sales in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy consumables and fertilizer to improve his harvest

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha has been running a tailoring business in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for 10 years. She belongs to the Dodoma road TRM loan group (group code 2023). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day she works at her business for 11 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can improve her business by adding more items. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Martha is married, and has three children: ages 18, 16, and 3. She also cares for four additional dependents.

loans.use: To expand business offerings

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is a forty-four-year-old woman. She is married with six children, three of whom are in school. She lives with her family at Dorma Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She is a food vendor and sells banku with fried fish. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup.

She has many customers since it is enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise increased income to support her children education. She has been in business for four years now. She belongs to the village loan group called ‘Promise’.

loans.use: For raw materials to cook banku

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es: Yeni tiene 30 años, vive con sus padres en la casa de ellos. Por 9 años trabajó en una pastelería y durante ese tiempo aprendió el manejo de ese negocio, por lo que decidió abrir su propio establecimiento en una zona céntrica de su ciudad. Ella misma elabora los pasteles y ha contratado a una joven para que la ayude en la atención al público. Hasta el momento las ventas han sido exitosas, debido a que utiliza ingredientes de muy buena calidad para la preparación de cada uno de sus pasteles. Para el futuro, Yeni se proyecta a tener sucursales de su pastelería para expandir su mercado de ventas. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, tiene grandes deseos de aprender y trabajar con su banco comunal, por lo que se le nota muy entusiasmada. El dinero que está solicitando será destinado a la compra de sacos de harina, manteca y demás ingredientes para la preparación de sus pasteles.
texts.en:
Yeni, 30, lives with her parents in their house. She worked in a bakery for nine years. During that time she learned how to manage the business. So, she decided to open her own establishment in a central zone of her city. She makes the cakes herself, and she has hired a young helper to wait on customers. Her sales have been successful because she uses very good quality ingredients to make each one of her cakes. In the future, Yeni projects having branches of her bakery in order to expand her sales market. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very enthusiastic because she has a big desire to learn and work with her Community Bank. The loan is to buy sacks of flour and other ingredients to make her cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make cakes

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith R. is a 35-year-old farmer and mother of two children. She grows rice but also plants corn to provide an additional income for her family. Judith's husband, Jimmy, manages their 1.3-hectare farm. All of their harvest is intended for family consumption, but when there is an excess, the couple sell it to rice traders in their village.

Farming is what keeps the R. family together. Judith would like to improve her harvest by adopting the use of fertilizers and new insecticides. When she heard about Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures Inc., she immediately requested a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use the loan to support the needs of her farm.

Judith's next target is to own a turtle machine, a type of farm equipment. She believes that she will be able to achieve her dreams with CEVI's help.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of potash fertilizer and sacks of seeds

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma S. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Norma is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 26 years and earns approximately 4,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Norma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Norma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of their children and supplement their income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Sesilia's Group

texts.en:
Sesilia is a member of the Uamsho borrower group. She is married and a mother of one child aged 10 years. She also cares for one other dependent. Sesilia started her own shop selling rice and wheat two years ago. She works twelve hours a day and earns a monthly profit of 180,000 Tsh.

This is Sesilia`s first loan from BRAC Tanzania, and she has requested the amount of 150,000 TZS in order to buy more commodities. With the additional profit she will gain from the use of this loan, Sesilia hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 60 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijas. Desde hace 21 años se dedica a la venta de comida en la puerta de su casa, ella prepara los platos típicos de su zona y los ofrece por la mañanas y las tardes, todos los días. Su esposo la apoya en trasladar los objetos pesados cada vez que Delia lo necesita así. Y debido a que su casa está ubicada en una avenida muy transitada de su ciudad sus ventas son exitosas. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal porque le permite tener capital para su negocio cuando lo necesita. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de utensilios de cocina, comestibles y bedidas.
texts.en:
Delia is 60 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters. She has sold food from her doorway for 21 years. Delia prepares local dishes and sells them in the morning and afternoon and because her house is located on a heavily trafficked street her sales are very good. Her husband helps her by moving heavy objects whenever she needs him to do so. This is Delia’s sixth loan with MFP and she is very happy being a member of her communal bank because it allows her to have capital for her business when she needs it. She will buy kitchen utensils, food, and drinks with the loan money.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food and utencils

loans.name: Chheun

texts.en:
Chheun N. is 29 years old and a resident of Kampong Chhnang Province. She sells various kinds of vegetable that she buys in bulk on credit from suppliers. Chheun sells her items in front of her home. Her husband sells ice-cream to pupils in school to raise extra money. The couple is married and has two school-age children.

Chheun will be use half of her first loan to repair her house and the rest to buy a used motor for family’s touting needs.

loans.use: Repair her house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 46 años, es una mujer muy simpática y atenta con las personas, sobre todo con su familia, conformada por su esposo y su hija, quien está casada y a quien trata de ayudar en la crianza de su nieta. Su salón de belleza está ubicado recientemente en su domicilio, ya que anteriormente trabajaba en puestos pequeños dentro de los mercados, pero gracias a su esmero y dedicación supo invertir sus ganancias en crear un ambiente dentro de su casa, implementándolo con las máquinas necesarias para su funcionamiento. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es peinar y cambiar la apariencia de las personas, ayudándolas a mejorar su aspecto y a elevar su autoestima, por tal razón lleva ya 12 años dedicándose a esta actividad, siendo lo más difícil de este trabajo la utilización de los fuertes líquidos que maltratan sus manos, pese a ello, continúa trabajando sin parar. María desea en el futuro adquirir máquinas de última tecnología  para mejorar el servicio y la calidad de su trabajo y que sus clientes queden mucho más satisfechos con su apariencia. 
Este es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y se compromete a trabajar con responsabilidad para evitar problemas económicos que inestabilicen sus ingresos. Yolanda solicita un préstamo de mil soles para comprar algunos productos de belleza para mejorar su servicio.

loans.use: Compra de productos de belleza

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Suon N. is 36 and lives in Siem Reap province. To earn a living, she makes and sells cakes in the community. She typically makes about US$5 each day. Her husband is a farmer who typically makes US$1 each day. They have three children, two are in school and one is too young to attend. Suon N. is asking for a loan of US$500 to make a new investment. She wants to raise pigs.

loans.use: Raise pigs.

loans.name: Believe God Group

texts.en:
The members of the Believe God group are small-scale businesswomen in the town of Magburaka, located in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva to seek a loan of Le 500,000 each for the very first time to enable them to improve their businesses. With such a loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality. In this way, they can make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve – they will be able to better support their school-going children in terms of feeding, clothing and meeting school expenses.

Zainab F. (on the left in the photo), born in Matotoka village, is the leader of this group. Thirty-eight years old, she is married to a farmer, and they have five children, all attending either primary or secondary schools. Zainab sells market food – rice, pepper, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) etc.- in Masimgbin village, about 25 miles from Magburaka town. She has been doing business now for many years.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 4 años en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Desde hace un año y medio cuenta con una pequeña tienda que instaló en su casa donde vende comestibles de primera necesidad. Para ello, Maritza brinda una atención amable y esmerada, todos los días y durante todo el día. Su esposo en ocasiones la ayuda, pues él tiene otro trabajo. Maritza no solo vela por la atención, sino que también administra la mercadería y estima sus ganancias por cada producto. Por ello, se ha dado cuenta que es más rentable la venta de carnes y productos a granel, y es en eso en lo que piensa invertir mayor dinero.

Esta es la tercera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal, pues es un grupo pequeño de personas que se conocen y se tienen  confianza. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes; tales como menestras, carnes  y algunos productos envasados.
texts.en:
Maritza, 33, lives with her husband and their four year old son in the house that she inherited from her parents. For one and a half years she has had a small store that she set up in her house. She sells basic needs type foods. To do this, Maritza offers kind and careful service all day, everyday. Her husband helps her occasionally; he has another job. Maritza not only waits on customers, but she runs the store and estimates her earnings on every product. In doing so she has realized that it is more profitable to sell meat and bulk products. This is how so plans to invest more money. This is the third time that she has had the opportunity for a loan with MFP. She is very happy to be part of her communal bank. It is a small group of people who know each other well and trust each other. She will use the money that she is now asking for to buy groceries like stews, meat, and some canned products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos tiene 54 años, está casado y es padre de 4 hijos que aún vive con él, en su casa propia.
Él muy amoroso con sus hijos y a la vez se siente muy orgulloso de su hija mayor que nació con el don de la pintura. Es por ello que trabaja arduamente en sus chacras sembrando papas, ollucos, arvejas, maíz y cebada con la compañía y ayuda de su esposa, pues su anhelo es que su hija estudie arte y pintura en un instituto superior ubicado a 5 horas de su pueblo en carro. 
A Marcos le gustan las labores agrícolas, pero sus dificultades son en los tiempos de “la helada” (clima muy frío que congela sus cultivos) donde muchas veces no puede salvar sus productos, y el otro problemas es la lluvia, si es muy constante los productos se agusanan.
Pese a todas esas dificultades, él no renuncia a su condición de agricultor, ya que lo realiza desde su infancia y sobre todo, vive de ello. 

Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP, él es coordinador de su grupo solidario, al que le tiene aprecio y gratitud. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará insecticidas contra los gusanos para sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Marcos is 54 years old, married, and the father of 4 children. He lives in his own home.

Marcos is a loving parent who is very proud that his oldest daughter was born with a gift for painting. For this reason, he works hard in his fields planting potatoes, ulluco, peas, corn, and barley with the help of his wife. His hope is for his daughter to pursue art and painting at an institute located 5 hours from their hometown by car. He enjoys farming, but says he experiences difficulties when the area encounters frost (thereby freezing his crops) because he is not able to save his harvest. On other occasions, if there is too much rain, his crops will rot. Despite these difficulties, Marcos refuses to give up farming since he has done this since childhood and knows no other way of life.

This is his 12th loan with MFP. Marcos is the coordinator for his solidarity group, so he is admired with great appreciation and gratitude. He will use the money to buy pesticides to prevent worms from infecting his potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pesticides

loans.name: Busena

texts.en:
Busena C. is currently in the business of selling sodas and ice cream and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge for cooling the sodas and ice cream.  Busena is 21 years old and is married with a husband who is a businessman. She has three children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge for cooling sodas and ice cream for sale

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Teodoro Pareja, Jr., age 26, is a young farmer from Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur. He learned farming from his parents and wanted to expand his business. Currently, he tills a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm. He said that he needs additional capital to sustain his business.

He is hoping to receive a loan of Php 5,000 from Community economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies to improve his harvest and income.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Las Intelectuales Y Responsables Group

texts.en:
Melida is the coordinator of her group Las Intelectuales y Responsables (the intellectual and responsible), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy centers around the backbreaking labor of the sugarcane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their 3 children.

Melida is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling chorizos, a delicious smoked mixture of pork that is then formed into sausages using pig intestines. Yum! She will use the profits to invest in her children by purchasing them shoes and clothes. Her long term goal is to continue growing her business and to see her children grow up to go to university and be successful. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy meat to make chorizos.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy, de 35 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora. Vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Hugo, de 36 años, y con sus 3 hijos: Rodolfo de 16, Yadira 15 y Frank de 10 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Su negocio está ubicado en la explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca). Su puesto de tejidos artesanales es uno de los más visitados, ya que los modelos que tiene son muy novedosos. Las prendas artesanales las teje ella misma, es por eso que le da a sus tejidos el acabado que desea.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y mientras más lo hace mejor se siente, además que de esta forma puede pagar los estudios de sus menores hijos. Lleva 2 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus artesanías hasta su puesto de venta, ya que vive muy lejos de ahí. 
Para el futuro, espera juntar el dinero necesario para instalar una tienda donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad sus prendas.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Nancy con MFP, ella es muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta y sabe que le ayudará a progresar. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de prendas que produce.
texts.en:
Nancy, 35, is a mother who is very cheerful and hardworking. She lives in a rented house with her husband Hugo, 36, and their 3 children: Rodolfo, 16; Yadira, 15; and Frank, 10. Her husband and children are the reason for all of her hard work. Nancy’s business is located in the Laguna Temporal esplanade (a place where markets are set up in the city of Juliaca). Her artisanal weaving booth is one of the most visited, since the designs she has are very original. She weaves the artisanal garments herself, and so she gives her weavings the finish that she wants. The thing Nancy likes most about her work is weaving, and as long as she weaves she feels better; besides, it allows her to pay for her younger children’s studies. She has made a living in this business for 2 years, and says that the thing she finds most difficult is transporting her crafts to her booth, since she lives very far from there. In the future she hopes to set up a store where she can sell her garments more comfortably. This is Nancy’s sixth loan with Kiva partner MFP. She is very punctual in making her payments, since she does not want to cause problems at her communal bank; she is very happy with her bank and knows that it will help her to make progress. Nancy is asking for 1600 soles and will use the money to purchase more wool so that she can increase the amount of garments she produces.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wool

loans.name: Orubu 1 Apiyo Rosemary Group

texts.en: A. Rosemary is a business woman, forty-seven years old and married. She has two children in school and is looking after two additional dependents who are also in school. She deals with produce, selling beans, peas, and so on. She is requesting a loan to purchase more produce to sell. She is a promising business woman whose dream is to educate her children, and she works very hard for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To purchase produce to sell.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es:
Jonathan es un joven muy trabajador y responsable, tiene 24 años y vive en la casa de sus padres, junto a sus hermanos.

Desde hace 2 años se dedica la venta y soporte de motores para carros en su pequeño taller. Esta es una labor muy sacrificada debido al esfuerzo físico que requiere; además gracias a las ganancias que obtiene puede ayudar a sus padres y hermanos con los gastos de su hogar. Jonathan se siente feliz con su trabajo y quiere salir adelante en el mismo, aunque no descarta la posibilidad de incursionar en otro rubro, pero cree que eso sería más adelante; por el momento quiere trabajar mucho para salir adelante y progresar.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará algunas herramientas necesarias para la refacción de los motores.
texts.en:
Jonathan is a hard working and responsible young man. He is 24 years old and lives with his parents and siblings. He’s been servicing cars and selling auto supplies from his small shop for the past two years. This job requires great physical effort and sacrifice, but the income he earns allows him to help his parents and siblings with the household expenses. Jonathan is happy with his work and wants to move ahead with it, even though he does not reject the idea of moving into another line of work, but this will have to wait. At this time, he would like to work hard and progress. This will be his fourth loan through MFP and he has always made his payments on time. He will use the money from this loan to buy some tools he needs to repair motors.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce, a 30-year-old married lady with three children in school, has been selling clothes and mobile phone airtime cards for three years. Assisted by one employee, her business is located in Kawangware, a few miles away from the capital city. Before venturing into this business, Joyce sold vegetables.  She appreciates the training she received from Faulu Kenya which helped her to generate new business ideas.  She dreams of becoming a prominent businesswoman and hopes to buy a building in the future. Joyce is requesting a loan of kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy more clothes and airtime cards to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and mobile airtime cards for sale

loans.name: Repeka

texts.en:
Repeka U. is 22 and single with no children.  She owns a business venture, selling selling cabbages, tomatoes and cucumbers.  Repeka has 3 years of experience in this business.  Repeka needs a loan of WST $1500 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Repeka joined SPBD.This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Repeka's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Albiso

texts.en:
Albiso C. is from the village of Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga d' Norte. She is 31 years old. Albiso is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Albiso owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Albiso has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Albiso joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Albiso has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Albiso is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Albiso from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Bisi

texts.en:
Bisi sells drinks and pepper soup in her shop and she has been in the business for the past 8 years. She does this to make a living in Lagos. She manages the business with the support of her children who assist her after school hours. 
She is married with 4 children and she is 43 years of age. She wishes to increase her business by having a better space where he can attend to her numerous costumers and sell drinks in wholesale in future. She is asking for the loan for the loan of NGN50, 000 to purchase more drinks and pepper soup items to sell. She says thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pepper soup items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase film, a water system and fertilizers for a new green house.

loans.name: Crisologo

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “RENOVACIÓN”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es el Sr. Crisologo; él socio tiene 55 años de edad, Nuestro socio es casado y tiene 5 hijos, Nuestro socio es jubilado él trabajo en el ministerio del interior y hoy disfruta de sus nietos y de estar en casa junto a su esposa y viajar los fines de semana fuera de la ciudad, Nuestro socio está dentro de este grupo desde hace 9 años, él disfruta de estar en el grupo a modo de reunirse con sus amigos y pasar unas horas de entretenimiento. El socio solicita el préstamo para uso personal y para mejorar su casa y comprar llantas a su carro. 

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the Renovación Communal Bank. Our member lives in the San Jerónimo province in the Cusco department. Our member is Crisologo. He is 55, married, and has five children. Our member is retired from working in the Ministry of the Interior. Now he enjoys his grandchildren, being at home with his wife, and traveling outside of the city on the weekend. Our member has been in this group for nine years. He enjoys being in the group as a way to get together with his friends and spend a few entertaining hours. He is requesting a loan for personal use, to improve his house, and to buy tires for his car. He is grateful for and values the support given through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal use, to improve his house, and to buy tires for his car

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena O. is from the village of Galas, Dipolog City. She is 62 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Elena is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory for her store. This will be her 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Ses

texts.en: Mrs. Ses S. is 60 years old, married and devoted to three children who are are working at different occupations. She is married to 62-year-old Eang Ten, who owns a plantation where he plants various fruits. She manages the family housework at home and sells fruit at the market to help support her family. Ses S. has been selling the fruit that her husband grows or that she buys from her wholesale supplier for several years. She wishes to buy a larger quantity of fruit to sell to retailers in the market, but she needs a vehicle for transport. To achieve her goal, Ses S. is requesting a loan to purchase a trailer to connect to her existing motorbike so that she can transport more fruit.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for a motorbike

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia A. is from the village of Minante 2, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 32 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Cecelia owns and operates a business raising and fattening pigs for sale. She is just starting this business. In 2008, Cecelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. Cecelia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: By God’S Grace Group

texts.en:
Esther T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called By God’s Grace. Esther is 50 years old, married, and has seven children who range from 16 to 30 years old. She was not able to attend school due to a lack of financial support. She cares for three siblings.

For 7 years, she has been selling lappas (a traditional dress for women) in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 12,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 55,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more cartons of lappas. She describes herself as a determined woman.

Her dream is to improve her business and build a house. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Bob T. is inset at the lower right because he was absent during the meeting.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of lappas

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with a 12-year-old son Yegor. She is a used clothing vendor in her home town of Berdyansk. She has two vending locations: an outlet in the local mall called ‘Yuzhnyi’ and a little store in another part of town. Irina started this venture nine years ago. Presently, she is making about 10,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Irina is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to reconstruct her vending facility and stock it with merchandise. She is planning to purchase women’s used clothing at wholesale prices and then resell it as retail items. Irina is known as an entrepreneur of integrity and determination. Her commitment to her venture and her personal characteristics will help her repay the current loan without any problems.

loans.use: To reconstruct her vending kiosk and stock it with merchandise

loans.name: Abahuza Group

texts.fr:
Célestin N., née à Rubavu l’Ouest du pays en 1975, il est marié, il a cinq enfants, son ainé a 15 ans et son cadet a 7 ans et il n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il vit avec sa famille à Kigali tous ses enfants vont à l’école.
Il appartient dans un groupe solidaire des transporteurs Taxi Moto appelé ABAHUZA, qui est un groupe dont les membres font le transport des personnes avec moto et ils se garantissent mutuellement, Célestin et son groupe travaillent pour faire vivre leurs familles en améliorant leurs conditions de vie quelques uns ont pu construire leurs maisons, Célestin, lui aussi est motard (un nom des transporteurs des personnes en taxi-moto au Rwanda), il veut commencer le projet de construction d’une habitation. En fait, le groupe a contracté un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les pièces de rechanges pour leurs motos et d’autres pour business de leurs femmes. Les membres de ce groupe ont l’habitude d’épargner pour la préparation de leur bon futur.
N.B : Le groupe contient 12 membres mais 10 sont disponibles sur la photo car les deux qui manques sont malade.
texts.en:
Célestin N. was born in Rubavu (Western Rwanda) in 1975. He is married and the father of five children. The oldest is 15 and the youngest 7. The family lives in Kigali. Célestin did not attend school, but all his children do so. Célestin is a member of the Cooperative Abahuza. It is an association of motorbike taxi drivers who work together and guarantee each other's loans. Célestin and his group work hard to provide for their families and improve their living conditions. A few of them were able to build their house. Célestin, too, is a motard (the name of motorbike taxi drivers in Rwanda). He wants to start the construction of his house. The group did take out a loan from Amasezerano Community Banking to buy spare parts for their motorbikes and also to bolster the businesses of their wives. The group members are used to save regularly some money to secure their future. NB: The group is made up of twelve members. Only ten are pictured, because two of them were sick.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, bricks and planks to build their houses

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma E. is a jolly but strong 49-year-old mother. Her marriage life was never a success because her husband left her with their two children. However, this trial never became a burden to her; instead, she made it an opportunity to work hard and show that she could raise their children alone. 

The year 2009 is when she heard of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.(ASHI) – a microfinance institution and partner of Kiva in the Philippines looking for poor women who would like to join the program. Along with four of her friends, she joined ASHI full of hopes and dreams. After a year of good performance and dedication, she slowly gained what she came for. From her loans, she was able to begin a business of buying and selling food, and from her profits, send her children to school. Her eldest son finished a course in a vocational school and is now a technician, while the youngest is still in high school. 

She applies for another loan of 15,000.00 pesos to increase the capital for her buying and selling business. She wants to buy more fruits, vegetables and fish to sell in her community and in the market. Her dreams are for her business to become stable, to buy a motorcycle that they can use to transport their goods, that her youngest will finish a course in college and, most especially, to renovate their house for more comfortable living. She is praying that more friends from ASHI and Kiva will support her and her family.

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables and fish for her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. N. lives in Naguru, a neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school.  Rose has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for many years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Rose sells her products from home, by means of retail.

Rose has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through selling local brew and firewood. The main business challenge(s) for Rose includes transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also educating her children up to university. Rose lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie P. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Margie is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Margie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Margie has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Margie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Margie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Margie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Loice

texts.en: Loice P. makes a living selling groundnut paste, bread and other food supplies in her shop, and is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. She is 20 years old and her husband works in a bank. They have two children, neither of whom is old enough to enroll in school. With the additional income made possible by this loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia J. is a widow who lives in Purok 4, Brgy. Masaling, Cauayan, Negros Occidental, in the Philippines. She earns a living through 3 business ventures: operating a general store, buying and selling rice, and fattening pigs.

Amalia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of 12 prior loans from Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 7,000 PHP, raising her family's standard of living.  This time, for her thirteenth loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy inventory for the general store and feed for the pigs so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business ventures.

Amalia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF's alleviation program empowers women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. The women are taking a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon"--a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org and joining the team.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and pig feed

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel es un padre de familia de 38 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa e hijos en el caserío Prada del distrito de Motupe, una zona conocida a nivel nacional por sus festividades religiosas. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a más de una hora y veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cuatro años se dedica al cultivo de maracuyá, este cultivo es bastante común en la zona y los agricultores del lugar lo siembran en base a asociaciones, las cuales les permiten vender sus productos en el mercado nacional y extranjero. El cuenta con experiencia en el manejo de este cultivo y además siempre está al pendiente de las novedades técnicas de su manejo. Como es la única fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta en su familia siempre trata de mantener su cultivo del mejor modo posible para obtener una buena cosecha.

José desea adquirir algunos fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, de modo que se pueda garantizar una buena cosecha, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José Manuel is a family man of 38, living with his wife and children in Prada, a rural settlement located in the district of Motupe, an area nationally renowned for its religious festivals. A part of the Lambayeque province, it is located at more than one hour 20 minutes form the city of Chiclayo.

He has been engaging in growing passion fruit for four years. This crop is fairly common in this area, and it is planted by local farmers organized in associations which allow them to sell their products in the national and international markets. He is very experienced in caring for this crop; on top of that, he always keeps himself updated on the technical novelties of this type of farming. As this is the only source of income his family can count on, he always tries to care for his crop in the best possible way in order to obtain a good harvest.

José wants to buy some fertilizers to provide good care for his crops, in order to be able to grant himself a good harvest, and for this reason he has though it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 PEN.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to maintain his passion fruit crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Zucima

texts.en:
Zucima A. is from the village of Orang Cabgan, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 52 years old. Zucima is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Zucima works in someone else's agricultural business raising fish for sale. Zucima has been engaged in this business for more than 18 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Zucima joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Zucima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby fish to raise and sell in the future. Zucima is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fish food and other supplies. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Zucima from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish food and other supplies

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es: Adelaida, de 37 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Hugo de 38 años que es obrero y de sus 3 pequeños hijos; juntos se esfuerzan a diario para salir adelante. Esta empeñosa mujer se dedica a la costura de pedrería en prendas de vestir. Esta muy satisfecha con su labor pues la desempeña, de lunes a viernes, durante sus ratos libres ya que una intermediaria le deja la ropa a ella y un grupo de amigas de la zona donde vive para que se dediquen al pegado de diversos tipos de pedrería que adornan diversas prendas. Le pagan semanalmente de acuerdo al volumen de prendas que termino el trabajo, y ayuda a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar. Tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de instalar un negocio propio, pero sabe que debe terminar primero de construir su casa. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar laborando en busca del progreso. Adelaida tiene planeado invertir el crédito en materiales para terminar de tarrajear las paredes de su casa por el interior, pues desea continuar progresando y que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adelaida is 37 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Hugo, a 38 year old construction worker, and their three small children. Together they strive each day to move forward in life. 

This industrious woman works sewing beaded jewellery into items of clothing. She is very satisfied with her occupation, working from Monday to Friday and also in her spare time, since an intermediary passes on clothes that require beadwork to her and a group of friends from her community. Adelaida is paid weekly according to the number of items of clothing that she completes and this money helps her husband with the constant home expenses. They have many plans for the future, including setting up their own business, but Adelaida knows that they should finish building their own house first. 

This is the second loan that Adelaida has taken out with MFP and she promises to make her repayments on time. She doesn't want to make a bad impression on the people who make this loan possible, as it allows her to continue working towards progress. Adelaida plans to invest this loan in materials to finish plastering the interior walls of her home. She wants to continue making progress so that her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Munhnaran

texts.en: Munhnaran, 26, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They have a decent standard of living and they live in a house that they own in her sister's backyard. Her two children go to kindergarden. Munhnaran has worked as a knitter for a company between 2009 and 2010. Then she began to make clothes at home in 2010. Now she is operating a knitting and clothing manufacturing business in her home. She wants to expand her business and have her own workshop. She hopes to hire unemployed people to offer them a chance as well. She is an honest and modest person who says, "I would like to expand my current business and make more profit in order to save money for my sons' future education. I want them to go to college and get good education". Munhnaran is requesting a loan of 900,000 MNT to purchase materials for her clothing sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for sewing business

loans.name: Merylou

texts.en:
Merylou is a married woman who lives in Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a fruits & vegetables business.
