Her husband Petronito, who is 45 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living.  They have two children who are 12 and 23 years old.  Merylou joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Merylou has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 13,600, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000 to buy additional bananas for resale so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business.  Merylou is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase bananas for resale

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria tiene 59 años y es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que busca el bienestar de su familia, ella realiza las actividades del hogar y en su pequeña tienda de abarrotes, ella vive en la Comunidad de San Isidro de Chicon que se encuentra ubicado a 15 minutos  de la ciudad de Urubamba, Cusco – Perú. En la comunidad de Chicon los pobladores se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura. Gregoria se dedica a la venta de comestibles como por ejemplo azúcar, fideos, arroz, pan y otras cosas más. Gregoria en esta oportunidad requiere el microcrédito para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo gaseosas, arroz, azúcar y otras cosas más. 

Gregoria pertenece al banco comunal “Los Dinámicos de San Isidro de Chicon” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
59-year old Gregoria is a hardworking, enterprising woman who is always seeking the wellbeing of her family. She takes care of the household and also runs a small grocery store. She lives in the community of San Isidro de Chicon which is located 15 minutes from the town of Urubamba, Cusco, Peru. The people of the community earn their living by raising animals or working in agriculture. 

Gregoria sells groceries such as sugar, pasta, rice, bread etc. She is seeking a loan to buy more items such as soft drinks, rice, and sugar. She belongs to the Los Dinámicos de San Isidro de Chicon community bank, a part of the Arariwa Association. She is grateful for the chance to obtain a loan and promises to pay it back according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as soft drinks, rice, and sugar

location.town: San Isidro de Chicon- Urubamba - Cusco

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en:
Keziah A. is 34 years-old and married with five children aged between fifteen and three years-old whom they hope to give a good education to the university level.

Keziah's business is located at Jubilee market in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region of Kenya that harbors Lake Victoria and is well known as the lake basin.

She sells chicken mostly to restaurant owners and local people. She has been in this business for five years now. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is competition from the fish mongers. However, she works hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well.

She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to purchase broilers for sale to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to open a big hotel some day. She describes herself as a very honest and hardworking lady.

loans.use: to buy chicken

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more fuel for his shop

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Don Mario, reside en San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, se dedica al cultivo agrícola desde hace 30 años, el trabajo lo aprendió de su padre, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm, él vive con su familia, tiene tres hijos de 11, 15 y 19 años de edad, ellos dependen económicamente.
Actualmente don Mario iniciara los procesos sobre el cultivo de maíz y frijol, para lo que solicita un préstamo y poder comprar abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento de plagas,  esta inversión le ayudara a contar con todo lo necesario y echar andar el cultivo de este año.
Su objetivo es continuar cosechando la tierra, trabajando fuerte por sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Mario lives in San Rafael Oriente in the department of San Miguel.  He has been farming for 30 years, a trade that he learned from his parents.  He works every day from 6am until 3pm.  He lives with his family, and has 3 children aged 11, 15 and 19 years, who are financially dependent upon him.  Now, Mario is ready to start planting corn and beans, and so he is requesting a loan to purchase manure, fertilizer and pesticide.  This investment will help him to have everything he needs to put his crops in this year.

His goal is to continue harvesting the land, working hard to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and pesticide

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Susan Tatiana

texts.es:
Susan Tatiana Méndez C., tiene la edad de 19 años, está soltera  y vive con su hijo que es su mayor prioridad. Ella con el dinero pretende comprar materiales para la confección de ropa. Ella cuenta con las maquinas para la creación de ropa y tiene varios años de trabajar en eso. Ella lo que pretende es generar las ganancias necesarias para seguir adelante con el negocio y darle cada día mas una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo a así poderle dar un mejor futuro. Ella quiere crecer como persona y cada vez ser más fortalecida en este pequeño negocio.
Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Susan Tatiana Méndez C. is 19 years old, single and lives with her son who is her highest priority.  She plans to use the money from this loan to buy material for clothes making.  She has the sewing machines she needs and has been doing this for several years.  What she wants is to earn the necessary income to continue ahead with her business and every day improve her son’s quality of life so she can give him a better future.  She wants to grow as a person and every day be stronger in this business.

This will be her first loan through FUDECOSUR.  She has not had other loans through state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her a loan, simply and at low interest.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine makes candies. With petrol costs escalating sky-high it is hard for many to afford running a car, including our client who uses the company car to deliver the candies to shops.

This loan will cover the costs of installing a gas balloon (an alternative fuel system for cars) and necessary technology for the car to run on gas instead of petrol.

loans.use: to pay for a gas balloon for her car.

loans.name: Juana  Aracelly

texts.es:
La señora Juana tiene 41 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, tiene tres hijos, de oficio comerciante, ella se dedica a vender comida y a vender ropa usada. Cuando ella inicio en este negocio tenia 19 años de edad, vendía frutas en el mercado esto lo hizo durante 8 años, después decidió vender ropa usada , de ultimo vender comida que ella misma prepara y reparte a los clientes que ya tiene, esto lo hace todos los días , se levanta desde muy tempranas horas a prepararse para un día agitado de mucho trabajo ya que por las mañanas cocina y por las tardes se dedica a vender ropa usada. Su marido trabaja como taxista y con lo que gana le ayuda a ella para pagar los gastos del hogar, todos sus hijos ya están adultos y trabajan por su cuenta. 
Solicita el préstamo para capital de trabajo, quiere comprar ropa usada en gran cantidad e invertir en su negocio de comidas. Con  esta inversión ella desea surtir su negocio, para atraer mas clientes , mejorar sus ventas e ingresos . En lo futuro solo le gustaría dedicarse a vender solo comida y refrescos, pues le gusta cocinar, es un arte que ella disfruta.  Su meta próxima es darle mejores condiciones a su comideria, quiere darle una mejor presentación .
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana, 41, lives in the city of León and has three children.  She is a merchant who sells food and second-hand clothing.  She began her business when she was 19 years old.  For eight years she sold fruit at the market, then decided to sell second-hand clothing.  She then added food to her business line, which she prepares and sells everyday to her customers.  She gets up very early to prepare for her busy workday.  In the morning she cooks and in the afternoon sells clothing.  Her husband works as a taxi driver and helps cover household expenses.  All her children are adults and work indepedently.

She is requesting a loan to use as work capital because she wants to buy more second-hand clothing and invest in her food business.  She plans to stock her business better to attract more customers and improve sales and income.  In the future she would like to sell only food and softdrinks since she likes to cook and considers it to be an art she enjoys.  Her next goal is to upgrade her eatery, to make it look nicer.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Rene Esteban

texts.es: René Esteban tiene 47 años. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de transporte de carga. El tiene 3 hijos pero ninguno está a su cargo ya que trabajan de manera independiente. El señor se ha desempeñado como un buen cliente. El inicio este negocio como agricultor luego de cierto tiempo fue que el decidió obtener este medio de vida. Por lo que su prioridad es mejorar el servicio de transporte. El solicita este financiamiento para la compra de llantas, asientos, entre otros. Su deseo es seguir con vida para proporcionarles a su esposa y hijos lo necesario.
texts.en:
René Esteban is 47 years old and has a business providing cargo transport services. He has three children, but he is no longer responsible for them since they already work independently. Sr. René Esteban has developed into a good client. He started out as a farmer, but he decided at some point later on to pursue this trade as his livelihood. His priority is to improve his transport services.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy tires, seats, and other items. He wants to continue with his business so that he can provide what his wife and children need.

loans.use: to purchase tires, seats, and other items.

loans.name: Arodgina

texts.en:
Arodgina works hard to support her family. Arodgina is married and has a lumber business in the Philippines. Arodgina has been in this business for ten years. She also earns additional income by farming rice and by buying and selling charcoal and coconuts.

Arodgina requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more lumber to sell.

In the future, Arodgina would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell.

loans.name: Jéremie 3:16 Plus Group

texts.en:
Augustin is the chairman of the Community Bank named “Jérémie 3:16 Plus” which is composed of 23 micro-entrepreneurs. The members are united in the same goal — to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 
Augustin is 39 years old. His main activity is to sell beverages. He buys them in bulk and resells them retail at profit. He sells his products daily at the market in his area located east of Kinshasa.

Augustin started his business in 2004. He is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having four times obtained and correctly repaid loans. His next loan will allow him to buy packages and crates of beverages to increase his sales in order to make a better profit. The business makes a profit of about US$200 per week. The aim of this loan is to reinforce his working capital and provide food for his family. He is married and the father of two children, aged 7 and 9 years old. Both attend school. He is also responsible for two relatives.

loans.use: to buy packages and crates of beverages to resell at retail

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a 30-year-old woman, married and a resident of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has two school-aged children. She grows bananas as the source of income. Every month, she has a total earnings of PHP 3,000 from this activity. Lina has been struggling hard for the family for nine years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase corn fertilizers and banana propagation cost. Lina hopes to expand the business, buy a motorcycle to easily move the goods in the marketplace and obtain more income in the future.

loans.use: To purchase corn fertilizers and banana propagation cost.

loans.name: Willian Geovanny

texts.es:
Willian Geovanny tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero vive con los padres, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	PATRON SAN JUAN , se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad San Juan, sector Llullundondo, parroquia Guanujo, a una distancia de 25 minutos  perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Willian Geovanny se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales siembra en los terrenos de los padres cultiva papas, maíz, habas y otros productos que se dan en la zona, tiene 2 cabezas de ganado. Compra y vende sus productos en la ciudad de Guaranda

Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos, semillas y para comprar animales e incrementar su negocio y tener alguna utilidad. Enfrenta desafíos el incremento y caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los bruscos cambios climáticos por los que estamos atravesando. Su sueño es ampliar su producción, tener terrenos propios.
Le gustan las festividades del carnaval y del patrón San Juan, realizar actividades como salir a pasear y el deporte.
texts.en:
Willian Geovanny, 25, is single and lives with his parents in the Guaranda Canton in the province of Bolívar.

His communal bank, PATRON SAN JUAN, is in the San Juan community, in the Llullundondo sector of the Guanujo Parish in the Guaranda Canton.  The members are involved in agriculture and livestock farming.

Willian Geovanny is a livestock farmer and grows potatoes, corn, lima beans and other crops on his parents cropland.  He has two cows.  He buys and sells products in the city of Guaranda.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds and to buy livestock to expand his business and earn more profit.  His main challenges are the radical price changes of the products he sells, as well as the abrupt climate changes that occur.  His dream is to increase production and buy his own land.

He enjoys the carnival and San Juan festivities, as well as taking walks and being involved in sports.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and livestock to increase business.

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.ru: Бунафша проживает в районе Яван. Ей 44 года. Он замужем. Ее муж находится на заработках в России. Бунафша имеет четверых детей. У нее среднее образование. Она зарабатывает путем разведения мелко - рогатого скота. В этой области она уже шесть тел. Кредит берет для закупа овец.
texts.en: Bunafsha lives in Yavan. She is 44 years old and married. Her husband works in Russia. Bunafsha has four children. She has a secondary education. She earns a living by breeding sheep and goats.  She has a flock of six.  She is taking out a loan to buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Lak

texts.en:
Lak is 31 year old and sells drawings. Her husband band is an artist, and they have two children, one of whom is a student.

Lak and her husband earn about $15 per day. Each month, they spend about $90 on food, $8 on electricity, $80 on rent, $10 on school fees, and $10 on transportation. She plans to use this loan of $700 to rent a space at the market where she will sell drawings. In the future, she wants to expand her shop, and perhaps wholesale drawings as well.

loans.use: to rent a space at a market from which to sell drawings

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia  is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 4 children. 

Letecia  is providing pedicure, manicure and hair cutting in their house or home service.  She has had this business for 6 years. S he requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy materials needed for manicure and pedicure services.  Letecia  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Letecia  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for manicure & pedicure services

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en:
Alhaji is 33 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of six weeks and 14 years. Three of his children attend school, and he also supports five relatives. He runs a building materials and tools store in Goderich in Sierra Leone. He has one employee working for him. 

He has been in this business for six years and sells building materials, like cement, iron rods, zinc, and pipes at his store. He also earns income from renting a house. Alhaji says that the main challenge to his business is securing more finances to help it grow. 

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more iron rods, cement, shovels and pipes. Alhaji says that the extra income from this loan will help cover his family's expenses. In the future, he would like to expand his business by opening more branches of his store in different locations.

loans.use: to purchase more iron rods, cement, zinc, and other building materials.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is married and runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines where she works very hard to provide for her family. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has been in this line of work for four years and would like to save enough money  to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Argene

texts.en:
Argene is 52 years old, married, and has three children.  Argene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retail business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.  She  also earns additional income from selling firewood and charcoal. 

Argene is requesting a loan for 13,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to purchase more sacks to sell.  Argene has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF.  She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth has been in the clothing sales business in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years. She is 24 years old and single.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our existing clients and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more clothes for selling through her business.

In the future, Ruth hopes to expand her business, establish her own clothing line, and become one of the leading cloth dealers in the area, thereby improving her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for sale

loans.name: Emannuel

texts.en:
Emannuel is a dairy farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya where he lives with his family of four children, ages 8 to 14. Through his farming, he produces milk that goes to the local market.

Emannuel has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he wants to boost his dairy farming business and hopes to be able to meet his family's basic needs, especially the education of his children, as well as repay  the loan.

Emmanuel says they face high transportation costs due to poor roads in the area.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Alie

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Alie.  He is married to a trader, and has five children aged 15, 10, 8, 6 and 3 years, three are school going children. In 2001, Alie established his pot making business. He began his business because he went into blacksmith work when he lost his father at the age of 16 years and there was nobody to support his education.  His mother was a housewife and since there was no money to support his schooling, she sent him to a blacksmith workshop to be trained in making pots.  Now he is a specialist in making pots.  Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 2,140,875 every month from this business.  

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.  Alie has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to produce the following - 8 big sets of pots, 5 medium sets of pots, and 7 small sets of pots. The balance Le 30,000 will be used to transport the raw materials.  

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 2,140,88. In the future, Alie plans to acquire his own workshop and educate his children to the university level which he was able to do himself.  His major problem is that sometimes he can make a pot and missed the dimensions that will lead to him having to redo it to get the correct quality. He serves about 15 customers each day, his business is popular because he is the only pot maker around that locality.  He has three trainees in his workshop.  He gets his raw materials from Freetown and Makeni Township.  He usually transports his materials by public transport. He plows back the profit into the business. 

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to produce new pots at his blacksmith shop and transport the raw materials

loans.name: Chhit

texts.en: Mrs. Chhit is a married woman who has been residing in the Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh. She is now 44 years old and has two school-aged children who live under her care. Chhit and her husband are in the same business, buying and selling recycled materials for profit. Together, they are able to yield an average of 3 USD per day. They are very diligent in collecting recycled materials through the villages by hauling their trailers all day. Chhit will use the loan of 400 USD as capital to buy recycled materials from the villagers. This loan will sustain her business and allow her to increase her income.

loans.use: to use as capital to buy recycled materials from the villagers.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia tiene 54 años, convive con Hilario, su pareja hace más de 32 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos de edades que oscilan entre los 32 y 25 años. Florencia e Hilario viven solos en una casa propia en la localidad de Huaracayo, distrito de Acobamba. Incansable y visionaria, Florencia no para. A su edad, siente que aún tiene mucho por hacer y lograr.  En su localidad cuenta con 3 lotes de terrenos agrícolas, en ellos produce maíz, arvejas y algunas variedades de papas. Comenta que el maíz es el que el da más rentabilidad. “Esta vez tengo sembrado maíz, y lo bueno es que lo vendo por tongos (lotes), cada uno a 1500 soles y como tengo 3, esta vez tengo asegurado 1500 soles”, afirma. Ante tal ganancia y recompensa de trabajo, Florencia no duda en coger sus herramientas para sembrar, cultivar, abonar y cosechar. En la cansada faena la apoya su esposo; además contratan personal extra para agilizar las tareas. “Por persona pagamos 25 soles al día, pero siempre es necesario”, manifiesta Florencia; ya que Hilario tiene contratos en una empresa constructora, razón por al que viaja constantemente.  La siembra de café es más rentable aún, por ello una de sus metas es adquirir un terreno en la provincia de Chanchamayo (selva central), para abarcar este producto. Florencia está emocionada, por que éste sería su primer préstamo de MFP. Agradece de antemano la ayuda.
De obtener el dinero, lo invertirá en la compra de un terreno en las montañas de la selva central, para la producción de cafetales.
texts.en:
Florencia is 54 years old and lives with Hilario, her partner for more than 32 years. They have five children together, whose ages range from 25 to 32 years old. Florencia and Hilario live alone together in their own home in the town of Huaracayo, district of Acobamba. Untiring and a visionary, Florencia does not stop. At her age, she feels that she still has much to do and achieve.

In her town she has three plots of land suitable for agriculture where corn, peas, and some varieties of potatoes can be grown. She says that corn is the most profitable crop. "This time I have corn planted, and the good part is that I sell it in lots, each one for 1500 soles, and since I have three, this time I am assured of having 1500 soles," she affirms.

With such earnings and compensation for her work, Florencia has no doubts about picking up her tools to sow, cultivate, fertilize, and harvest. Her husband supports her in this tiring task, furthermore they hire extra help to speed up the work. "We pay 25 soles per day, per person, but it's always necessary," says Florence, especially since Hilario has contracts with a construction company and for this reason he is constantly traveling.

Planting coffee is even more profitable, which is why one of her goals is to acquire a plot of land in the province of Chanchamayo (central jungle), in order to include this product. Florencia is excited, because this would be her first loan from MFP. She is thankful in advance for the help. Having obtained the money, she will invest it in buying a plot of land in the mountains of the central jungle, in order to produce coffee trees.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, nuevamente solicita otro préstamo  para fortalecer su negocio y comprar productos de primera necesidad como: aceite, maíz, pollo, frijoles, café instantáneo de esa forma seguir aumentado en sus ventas y los ingresos que sean mejores.
El préstamo anterior pudo observar una mejora el inventario aumento y pudo sacar buenas ganancias para mejorar su vivienda el cual ha permitido que su familia este en buenas condiciones.
texts.en: Isabel is once again requesting another loan to strengthen her business and buy more basic staple items like oil, corn, chicken, beans and instant coffee in order to increase sales and improve income.  With the previous loan she was able to observe an improvement; inventory grew and she was able to earn good profits to improve her dwelling leading to her family being in good conditions.

loans.use: to buy oil, corn, chicken, beans and instant coffee.

loans.name: Maria Haydee

texts.es: Maria Haydee es una emprendedora que ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, con financiamiento para el negocio lo cual esta emprendedora la actividad a la que se dedica es a la venta de cosméticos, el crédito anterior fue para invertir en el negocio en la compra de variedad de cosméticos y sus clientes de igual manera han aumentado. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para invertir nuevamente en el negocio en la compra de pintura de labios, pintura de uñas, polvos, cremas, perfumes y tratamientos entre otros productos demandados por sus clientes.
texts.en: Maria Haydee is an enterprising woman who has been working with Fundación León 2000 to finance her entrepreneurial business.  She sells cosmetics.  The previous loan was invested in the business through the purchase of a variety of cosmetics, and in addition her customers have increased.  She is currently asking for a loan to invest again in the business through the purchase of lipstick, eye-shadow, powders, creams, perfumes, and treatments among other products that her customers request.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, nail polish, powders, creams, perfumes and treatments

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Desde muy joven Jorge se ha dedicado a las labores del campo las cuales aprendió gracias a las asesorías que recibió por parte de su padre, pues los terrenos quedaban a cargo de el, pero ha sido muy difícil pues los constantes cambios climáticos y los altos costos de los insumos hacen que cada vez se mas difícil ejercer la profesión de agricultor. Por el alto costos de insumos no ha podido realizar un buen mantenimiento y seguimientos a su cultivos lo que ha generado deterioro e incluso algunas plagas se han comido parte de sus cultivos por lo que no ha sacado bueno utilidad de sus terrenos. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, fungicidas, pesticidas y riegos para su terrenos esperando arrancar de raíz el problema que lo aqueja y poder seguir adelante con el negocio familiar que tantos años les dio de comer.
texts.en:
Since he was very young, Jorge has worked as a laborer in the countryside, an occupation that he learned from his father, who he was in charge of the family land. This work has been very difficult, as constant weather changes and the high cost of supplies make being a farmer more and more difficult over time. He has not been able to maintain and monitor his crops because of the high cost of supplies, which has caused deterioration. Some pests have eaten part of his crops and he has not been able to profit from his land. 

He is requesting a loan to buy compost, fertilizers, fungicides, pesticides and irrigation for his land, with the hope of getting rid of the problem and continuing with the family business that has fed him for so many years.

loans.use: to buy compost, pesticides, fertilizers and fungicides for his crops.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a hardworking married lady living in Fort Portal Uganda. She used the previous loan to buy cassava to mill and sell. She has a business of selling produce dealing in items like maize flour, beans and rice, the business she has been running for over 4 years now.

She is facing a hindrance of limited capital that make her lag behind in terms of growth and in the end fail to raise more income that will enable her educate her children up to university. Irene has asked for another loan to buy stock of maize flour and rice to sell during this festive season.

loans.use: to buy stock of maize flour and rice to sell during this festive season.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy works hard to support her family. She is single and has a frozen food retailing business in the Philippines.

Ivy requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more frozen foods to sell.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Ivy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia Suazo

texts.en:
I make my cheeses in my house with my family and then deliver them to my clients door to door in the towns of Siguatepeque and Comayagua. My main buyers are corner stores, groceries, and restaurants. I have been working in this business for 10 years.

The most popular kinds of Honduran cheese are fresh, white cheeses with names like `Queso Blanco`, `Panela`, `Queso Fresco`, `Queso Del Pais`, and `Queso Para Freir`. These cheeses are all made the same way and have the same eating and cooking characteristics. They have shelf-lives of less than one week and are usually wrapped in banana leaves when they are sold.

One very interesting thing about many styles of Honduran cheese is that they do not melt when they are heated - they soften!

loans.use: Purchase ingredients such as milk and packing for the cheese.

loans.name: Gelyn

texts.en:
My name is Gelyn T. and I sell daily consumer products. I have had my business for 2 years and I have a good clientel as I am located near a public school. My business generates enough income to support my family and my goal is to expand my inventory in order to have a greater variety of products. With the additional earnings I will be able to feed my family and to give a good education to my daughter who is ready to enroll in kindergarten.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Gelyn T. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular tengo mi negocio hace unos 2 años, mi clientela es muy buena ya que estoy ubicada cerca de una escuela publica, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mas variedad de productos y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y darle estudio a mi hija que esta por ingresar al kinder.

loans.use: To purchase churros, drinks, juices, cookies, sweets, sugar, butter, and eggs.

loans.name: Bimukaram

texts.en: Bimukaram is mother of 2. She has been in trade for over 18 years. She has changed the type of business she was engaged in, but she has been a seller for the last 18 years. Currently, she sells corn and other grains. Her clients are mostly people who use these products as fodder for their livestock and poultry.  She has several people who come out from rural areas to bring her the goods she sells. Sometimes she and her colleagues make these trips themselves. She hopes that her son will take over her business when he is old enough so that she might start something new. She will use the loan for her next trip for goods.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en:
Ismayil is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Djabrayil region, Soltanli village. This 51-year-old man with his family settled in Khirdalan settlement. He is married and has 3 children. With his own car, Ismayil has transported fruits, vegetables, and agricultural produce from the different villages to Khirdalan setlement for sale.

Ismayil has been selling near his home for 5 years. Now he is applying for a loan of $800 to buy agricultural produce, fruits, vegetables and improve his business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural produce, fruits, vegetables to improve his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more products and a used oven

loans.name: Namig

texts.en:
F. Namig is a refugee from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory Agdam region, situated in the western part of the Azerbaijan Republic since 1993.

He began his business with $300 in 1999. He started selling a small variety of shoes. With this small business and only $300 in working capital, he could hardly earn enough money to meet his family's food and important consumption needs. He had difficulty covering other family consumption needs for medication, clothes, school, etc.

In 2005, after borrowing $400 from Normicro, Namig was able to expand his business and increase the income of his business and improve his family's livelihood.

Now, he needs a $700 loan in order to further develop his business, to buy other shoes and goods to increase his business and to improve his family’s living conditions with this additional income.

loans.use: To buy other shoes and goods to increase his business

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan Jose works as an assistant at a law firm and his wife at the social security depository. He has two daughters who study at the La Paz school. His home is located in the Villa Copacabana section of the city of La Paz. This is his first request for a loan. The amount he is asking for would be used to pay for the enrollment and boarding fees for his two daughters. His work allows him access to this credit given that he has experience as a legal assistant and his financial evaluation is favorable. This type of credit is part of our development program in the Educational Sector.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Jose trabaja como asistente en una firma de abogados y su esposa trabaja en la Caja Nacional de Seguro Social. Tiene dos hijas que estudian en el colegio La Paz. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa Copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado el pago de inscripción y pago mensual del colegio de sus dos hijas. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como asistente legal y la evaluación socio-económica es favorable. Este tipo de crédito es parte de nuestro programa de Fomento, Sector Educación.

loans.use: Payment of enrollment and boarding fees for school.

loans.name: Melina

texts.es:
Melina lives in the region of San Martin in the district of Lamas. She is a member of the communal bank called Las Lamenas. She has a stand where she sells juices and cold drinks, strategically located close to main road which keeps her business steady. Three years ago, motivated by a friend her offered her an existing business, she decided to do it for two reasons; she already knew a little about the business, and also because her two daughters could help her. One of her daughters had experience in this type of business. Melina has been able to maintain her customers with her good service.

With the loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy a new blender, as well as fruits she uses every day to prepare the juices such as oranges and papayas in bulk, also sugar and other ingredients to prepare her pastries and sweets. This will enable her to better meet the demand of her customers. Melina, at 70 years old, is an enthusiastic and strong woman who has raised 8 children. She continues to work hard to better her life.

La señora Melina vive en la región de San Martín, provincia y distrito de Lamas. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal Las Lameñas y tiene un puesto de venta de jugos y refrigerios en un lugar estratégico cerca al paradero de autos, ubicado en el Jr. San Martín Cdra 9, por lo que el negocio es bastante concurrido. Hace 3 años, motivada por una amiga quien le ofrece un negocio implementado, ella decide adquirirlo por dos motivos: conocía de las utilidades que dejaba el negocio y tenía el apoyo de 2 de sus hijas, una de ellas con experiencia en este tipo de negocio. Es por ello que hasta la fecha mantienen su clientela por la buena atención y el buen trato que reciben. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará una licuadora nueva, frutas que utiliza diariamente en la preparación de los jugos, como naranjas y papayas en sacos, guineos en racimos, azúcar en sacos e insumos para la preparación de refrigerios como pasteles, kekes y de esa manera satisfacer el apetito de sus clientes. Melina a sus 70 años aún es una mujer muy entusiasta y fuerte y con el aliento de sus 8 hijos, las ganas de vivir y trabajar todavía continúa luchando.

Translated by Kiva Volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To purchase a new blender for her business making fresh juices.  She will also use it to purchase greater quantities of the fruits she uses each day, as well as sugar and other ingredients used in making the sweets she sells.

loans.name: Claudia Lucia

texts.es:
Claudia Lucia has dedicated herself to selling cheese at a post in the station market of León for the past two years. She used to sell her product while roaming but didn't have as good of sales because she wasn't in a fixed place, which she eventually acquired on her own initiative.

Claudia has four small children whom she has to care for, educate and feed under a strong roof. They have been her biggest inspiration for her work, and despite the lack of economic resources she has not lost hope that her business will help them make headway and successfully prepare her children for adulthood.

For this reason, Claudia is requesting a loan to help her increase her supplies by allowing her to purchase more ingredients to make cheese and thus be able to sell more. She hopes to continue receiving these beneficial loans.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Claudia Lucia se dedica a la actividad de venta de queso desde hace dos años e inicia esta actividad en un tramo en el mercado la Estación en León. Por iniciativa propia, antes de tener su tramo en el mercado se dedicaba de igual manera a vender queso pero lo hacia ambulantemente, sin embargo, no obtenía beneficios por no estar en un local fijo.

Claudia es madre de 4 pequeños a los que tiene el deber de cuidar, educar, alimentar y brindarles un techo digno. Su mayor inspiración para trabajar han sido ellos, y a pesar de la escasez de recursos económicos que atraviesa en su hogar, no pierde las esperanzas de que su negocio saldrá adelante y sus hijos serán personas preparadas.

Por este motivo, solicitó un préstamo en Ceprodel el cual al ser otorgado le benefició en el sentido de que surtió más sus productos en la compra de mayor cantidad de queso para comercializarlo. Según comenta, continuará con estos beneficiosos créditos.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make cheese

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Samorn and her husband have five children. Two of their children are married and live in separate houses. Of the other three, one farms, one weaves silk, and the youngest one is studying in a local school. Samorn has been a silk weaver since 1986. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband is a farmer who grows tomatoes, wax gourds, papaya, and eggplant on the farm near their house. Samorn and her family live on an island of Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 
Samorn is requesting a first-time loan from MAXIMA in the amount $600. She will use this money for purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Señora Pascuala lives in her own home with her husband and children on Buenos Aires Avenue in Las Lomas in the city of La Paz. In her home, she set up a grocery store, which includes the sale of fruit. This gave her a satisfactory result, so she decided to make trips inland to bring large quantities of fruit herself to sell to retail merchants. Currently this activity gives her good income.

The credit she is requesting is to increase her capital and to be able to buy more fruit to bring to the city for its sale.

Pascuala's previous credit history qualifies her to obtain a new credit; she is a very good client. She has been a client of ours since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Pascuala vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la Av Buenos Aires de la zona de Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz. En su casa instalo una tienda de abarrotes incluyendo la venta de fruta, lo cual le dio un resultado satisfactorio por lo cual decidió hacer viajes al interior del país y traer ella misma la fruta en cantidad y vender a las comerciantes minoristas; actualmente esta actividad le redita buenos ingresos.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y poder comprar mas fruta y traer a la ciudad para su venta.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, es muy buena cliente. Ella es cliente nuestro desde el año 2006.

loans.use: To purchase fruits from producers to sell in the city.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 18-year-old Mwanaisha A.. She is married and has one child, aged 18 months. She also has two dependents, her sisters, who live with her.

In 2006, Mwanaisha established her food-to-go kiosk business. Mwanaisha requires a loan in order to purchase ingredients in bulk, which she will use to make snacks and juice. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to make snacks and juice for her kiosk.

loans.name: Moise

texts.fr:
Mr. Moïse L. was born in 1965 in the village of Avétsèdomé where he currently lives. Mr. L. is the father of five (05) children. He is a courageous man who fights to provide for the needs of his family. He works, by himself, in agriculture, breeding, and small trades. However, he does not escape poverty and he constantly faces the problem of stock. His short term project is to stock and sell corn, for this he is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Moïse L. est né en 1965 dans le village d’Avétsèdomé où il vit actuellement. Père de cinq (05) enfants, monsieur L. est un brave homme qui se bat pour assurer et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il exerce lui seul l’agriculture, l’élevage et le petit commerce. Toutefois, il n’échappe pas à la misère et il se confronte énormément au problème de fonds de commerce. Son projet à court terme est le stockage et la vente de maïs pour lequel il sollicite ce crédit.

loans.use: Purchase, stocking and sale of corn

loans.name: Sous

texts.en: Sous S., 45, is a widow with four children and resides in Phnom Penh. Since 2006 she works as a construction worker and earn $2.50. Two of her children are employed in the factory and the rest are students. Now Sous is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a sewing machine for her children to sew at home after regular working hours in a factory. This will provide an extra income to support the family. As of right now, there is flooding around her house so the taioring business will start in the next couple months when the dry season is coming. (Mrs. Sous S. is sitting at the front door of her house)

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her children to tailor at home when they are free from the factory.

loans.name: Gulmahmad

texts.ru:
Gulmahmad S. lives in the Vakhsh district. He is 72 years old and married with three children. Despite his age, he practices animal husbandry, weaves ropes for animals and makes horse saddles and other necessary accessories. Gulmahmad sells completed merchandise at a market. He wants to purchase materials specifically for his business to help guarantee uninterrupted work. Continued business would only be possible with a loan of $450.00 (1500.00 TJS). He would like to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Сайтиев Гулмахмад житель Вахшского района. Возраст 72 года. Женат и имеет троих детей. Не смотря на возраст занимается животноводством , а так же плетет веревки для животных и производит седла для лошадей и другие необходимые принадлежности. Именно для этого бизнеса хочет закупить материал . Это поможет ему обеспечить бесперебойную работу. Готовую продукцию продает на рынке. Все это возможно лишь получив кредит в размере 1500 сомони. Срок на который он хочет взять кредит 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Mrs. Phorn S. lives in Roka Village in Kandal Province. She is a 46-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other works as a construction worker. Mrs. Phorn S. is a farmer in the local village. Since her plantation field has infertile soil, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to support her field and to buy rice seeds to cultivate.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her field and to buy rice seeds to cultivate.

loans.name: Sambat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambat T., 49, and her husband, Mr. Chantha Saum, 53, who live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1985 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Three of their children are married; two of them live outside the family home. One daughter is a garment factory worker and two other sons study in a local school.

Sambat has been selling meals since 1991. She herself cooks food to sell in front of a garment factory. Her husband has been a mason for fifteen years. Sambat needs a motorbike and a cart to carry meals to sell to garment factory workers. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a motorcycle and a cart for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a cart for her business

loans.name: Gopi

texts.en: Gopi Kapaley lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband Mr. Karna Dhoj and seven children. She has four daughter and three sons. Some of her daughters are studying and some are working in a private office. All of her sons are studying in secondary school. Both Mr. and Mrs. Kapaley are engaged in their own fruit shop. They sell different varieties of fruits in their shop. They opened their fruits shop 2 years ago in Sanepa-chock. Now Gopi is requesting a loan of Rs. 10000.00 to buy fruits for their shop.

loans.use: Gopi would like to buy fruits for their shop.

loans.name: 17-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.vi:
Chị N. Thị Đỗ sinh năm 1950. Gia dìng chị sống ở Phường Nam Ngạn, Thành Phố Thanh Hoá. Chồng chị đã mất, chị có 2 người con, hiện tạichị sống với con trai út. Hai con của chị là lao động tự do. Chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào việc trồng rau. Binh quân thu nhập một ngày của chị là 50.000 VND. Sáng sớm chị hái rau bán cất cho các nhà buôn ngoài ra chị còn nuôi thêm gà, vịt, lợn. Chị rát thích cách thức vay vốn và hoàn trả của Quỹ Thanh Hoá. Chị muốn vay mức 2.442.600 VND. các thành viên khác trong nhóm:
Chị N. Thị Tố Hảo có 4 người con, 2 con trai và 2 con gái. Chồng chị đã mất. 3 người con của Chị đã lập gia đình. Hiện tại chị đang ở với con trai cả. Chi vay vốn để buôn bán nhỏ
Chị Truột sinh năm 1964, chị có 3 người con gái và cả 3 người con của chi đều đang học. Anh chị vay vốn về đầu tư vào việc chăn nuôi và ngoài ra chị còn dùng tiền vay vốn để mua vôi ,cát và bán lại cho mọi người trong phố.
Chị Yến sinh năm 1977. Chồng chị là Công. anh chị có 1 con đang còn nhỏ. Chị vay vốn để buôn bán bánh mỳ, hạt dẻ, hạt bầu, hạt dưa
Chị Hoa sinh năm 1978. Chi vay vốn về để buôn bán nhỏ.
texts.en:
Mrs N. Thị Đỗ was born in 1950. She lives in Nam Ngạn district, town of Thanh Hoá. Her husband passed away. She has 2 children, the younger one is still living with her. They are both free lance laborers. She is seeking a loan to cultivate vegetables. Her income is about 50.000 VND a day. Everyday, early in the morning she would go to the field to pick vegetables then sells to the vendors. She also raises poultry and pigs. She likes the loan program from "Thanh Hoá". She is requesting a loan of 2.442.600 VND. Other members in her group are:
  • Mrs N. Thị Tố Hảo, she has 2 sons and 2 daughters. Her husband passed. She is living with her oldest son, the other 3 are married. She sells basic goods.
  • Mrs Truột, she was born in 1964. She has 3 daughters who are still in school. She and her husband are seking a loan to incest in their pig raising business. She would also use part of the loan to buy sand and lime to resell.
  • Mrs Yến, she was born in 1977. Her husband is Mr Công. They have a young child. She sells bread, chestnut, melon seeds.
  • Mrs Hoa, she was born in 1978. She sells basic goods.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivate vegetables

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith O. sells provisions and drinks. Her husband is an ambulance driver for a government hospital. She is 37 years old and has two children. 

She plans to increase her stock during and after the festive season. She is requesting a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Struggle Group

texts.en:
This is Aminata J., Kadiatu B. and Fatmata J.. They named their group Struggle.  They are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. This is not their first loan from Kiva through SMT. They had all previously received several loans from Kiva through SMT. Those loans created meaningful impacts on the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees.  They’re also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans.  Today, they are requesting a loan of $400 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Aminata (right) is the leader of the group. She is forty years of age. She was born in Magbinty village in the Port Loko district in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and the two have five children. Two of her children are in college, three in secondary school and one in primary school. She has been a businesswoman for over twenty years now.
 
Aminata sells market food. She sells onions, salt, pepper, sugar, etc. With this new loan, she will expand  her business.  She will be able to buy about ten bags of onions, five bags of salt and two bags of sugar. 

So far, Aminata faces no serious challenge in her business that is worth noting. Business is going fine . She enjoys what she does for a living. To Aminata and her colleagues in the group, an increase in profit means making their lives better. They will be able to take good care of their children, specifically with their educational and nutritional needs, and save some money for emergencies.

loans.use: Buy at least ten bags of onions, five bags of salt and two bags of sugar.

loans.name: Chak

texts.en:
Chak L., a 44-year-old resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, has four children, two single and two married. All of her children are employed, while her husband, Mr. Son, 48, makes a living as a local carpenter constructing furniture for sale. Mrs. L. currently raises pigs, distills Khmer wine for sale, and grows rice.

Mrs. L. is asking for a loan for her husband to buy more pieces of wood and other materials for his carpentry business. The family believes that the loan will help them increase their income to better sustain the family.

loans.use: To buy more pieces of wood and other materials for her husband's carpentry business.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35 year-old Rosemary M. from Mwanza; she is single with one child, 10 years old. Rosemary has been running a shop business since 2006. Client’s business is to sell different clothes such as shirts, T-shirts, and hand bags for women. She works at the business for 8 hours per day, 6 days per week. Rosemary currently earns about 300USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase more shirts, hand bags and pouches. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Rosemary thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more shirts; hand bags and pouches

loans.name: Mrs. Roeng Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people living in Prasat village in Kandal province are asking for a village bank loan to use for various purposes. Mrs. Roeng C. is 40 years old and the village bank president. She owns a grocery store in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery goods to increase her income. Her husband, Mr. Yong Pak, is a taxi driver. Mrs. Roeng C. has two children who are attending the local school. 

Nine members in this group have end-of-term loans, which means they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva. The rest of the group have monthly payment loans.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery goods.

loans.name: Shukria

texts.en: Shukria is the daughter of A. Q.. He lives in district 8 in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and has three children. She and her children live in a small house; most of it was destroyed during the winter because of snow and rain. Her husband was not able to repair it. So when she heard about the loan process, she came to AFS and requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months to buy all the essential construction materials to repair the house. She is very glad that there is a nice process in Afghanistan for supporting those who are really in need of money.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Juan Israel

texts.es:
Juan Israel A. es un caballero muy esforzado que se dedica a su negocio de pulpería donde ofrece todo tipo de productos a sus clientes estando ubicado en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua. 

Hoy en día el señor Juan ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de sus productos para así ofertarlos en su pulpería y continuar mejorando sus condiciones de vida por medio de su negocio al que se dedica.
texts.en:
Juan Israel A. is a very hard working gentleman. He has a grocery store, and he offers all types of products to his customers. His business is located in the Mayoreo market in Managua. Juan is asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy products. He will sell the products and continue improving his living conditions through his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
“Hardship of life is not a valid reason to give up, but a challenge to move forward,” sayd Judy S. who is a sidewalk vendor in their small village. Dhe is married to Niel S.. The couple lives happily with their four children in Quirino Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. Three of their children are presently studying in college and the youngest is still in high school. Judy is working hard to earn more income to help support the studies of their children.

Her husband is operating a tricycle transport business to earn income while Judy ventures into vending. She sacrifices most of her time to sell food, snacks, fruits and vegetables. She also sells food & snacks on public utility buses and at the bus terminals. Her daily vending is worth the sacrifice because she has many customers, says Judy, and this helps develop her business activity further. Judy is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000.00 ($125 US) which she will add to her current vending capital. Judy is also hoping that somehow, this will allow them to be able to expand their livelihood for the welfare of their children.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana A. is a 50-year-old trader. She is widowed with five children; one of them is currently schooling whilest the rest are working. She has been selling used clothes in the local market of Dorma for four years. She sometimes adds cloth to the used clothing.

With the income from her business, Esther supports all her kids. Her major business challenge over the years has to do with funds to scale up the business. She has lots of marketing experience and is very confident that the loan would enable her to achieve remarkable business progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes and cloth to serve her customers. She hopes to save enough to pay for her one child's complete schooling. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Abotre,’ which means patience.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Javier P. tiene poco tiempo que le entregaron su vivienda por medio de Infonavit. Pero le está haciendo falta las protecciones en las puertas y ventanas.
Está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar a la persona que se encargara de elaborar y colocar las protecciones y así el y su familia podrán ir abitar su nueva casa con mas seguridad.
Don francisco trabaja en una compañía de pinturas este es el ingreso que el genera para su familia y con el cual una parte lo destinara para el crédito.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier Pena recently acquired a house through the organization Infonavit, but it lacks the necessary protection for the doors and widows. He needs a loan so he can hire someone to install protection over his windows and doors so he and his family can live in their new home safely. He gets income for his family from his painting company and he generates income that will allow him to take care of his family and pay back the loan.

(Translated by Elizabeth of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install protection over his windows and doors so he and his family can live in their new home safely.

loans.name: Twanzane Fele Mbahana Group

texts.en: Fele M., a 45-year-old married mother of 15 children, all in school, has sold cassava flour and palm oil for over 20 years. She will use the loan to purchase more cassava flour and palm oil in order to expand the business. Fele is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to purchase a television set.

loans.use: To purchase cassava flour and palm oil to increase the size of the business.

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
Thủy Thị T. Nguyễn was born in 1979. (no: 010102120026). She lives in Vang village, Co Loa commune with her husband, her son and mother-in-law. Her son takes part in school kindergarten. Her husband is a worker. She has a wedding dress shop.  Her family has a monthly income of about 4.500.000 VND. She has been engaged in financial microfinance for two years. This cycle of capital, she wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to invest in her shop. There are two other Fund participants in her group:
 Phương K. Nguyễn was born in 1968. (no: 010102120026). She has two children. She is a mechanic. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND to buy clothes.
 Thà Thị Nguyễn was born in 1960. (no: 010102120027).  She sells vegetables in the market. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND to buy more vegetables.

loans.use: To invest in her shop

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en: Adenike lives in Lagos and she sells sarongs, cosmetics and provisions. She has been in the business for the past 12 years. She is 45 years old and married with five children. Adenike is requesting a loan of 150,000 nairas to purchase more sarongs, cosmetics and provisions to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, cosmetics and provisions to sell

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña Maria Elena Fermín de 49 años de edad, casada, reside junto con su familia en Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, su esposo de desempeña como supervisor de vigilancia, sus tres hijos  dos mayores y uno menor que estudia la secundaria, los dos mayores trabajan en una zona franca. El negocio de la señora Maria es la venta de joya que desde hace diez año inicio con el propósito de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos ya que su salario es bajo, con capital propio comenzó. Con este crédito comprara joyas y ropa nueva para incrementar el inventario y las ventas. Da las gracias Afodenic por lograr el crecimiento ya que son cinco ciclos que ha prestado y lo ha distribuido en la inversión para mejora a su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Elena F. is 49 years old, married, and lives with her family in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood of Managua. Her husband is a security guard supervisor and they have two adult children who work in the free zone and one minor who is studying secondary school. Ten years ago Maria used her savings to start her jewelry sales business in order to help her husband meet household expenses since his salary is low. With this loan she will buy jewelry and clothing to sell thereby increasing her inventory and her sales. She thanks Afodenic for helping her grow since she has been involved in five loan cycles which she has been able to invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and jewelry.

loans.name: Think About Me #1 Group

texts.en:
Think About Me #1 is a loan group made up of five borrowers that is led by Kumba S., who lives in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.  She is 31 years old, married and has three children, ages 6 to 12.  All of her children are in school.  Kumba also cares for one child orphaned in a recent war. Kumba was unable to attend school because it was the cultural norm for girls to rely on their husbands to provide for them, and therefore school was considered unnecessary.  She lives in remote Kolahu city in rural Lofa county, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Kumba’s business is preparing and selling dried meat, important in Liberia since most people don’t have refrigerators. She sells the meat to farmers from her stall, in a market where she is joined by about 100 other people plying various trades.  She has been in this line of work for one year, and has applied for this loan to buy additional meat and bags to transport it in.  With increased profit, she dreams of first having a larger stall and ultimately building a more permanent shop. She also hopes to build a house for her family, and invest in the future of her children, especially by sending them to the school she was unable to attend.

loans.use: To buy meat and plastic bags to transport it in.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa tiene 48 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijas, quienes son el motor de su vida para salir adelante. Ella se dedica a vender prendas de vestir, su puesto de venta está instalado en uno de los mercados más concurridos de su distrito, donde trabaja muy alegremente desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, con el fin de brindar a sus clientes prendas de calidad y una buena atención. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es vender y dialogar con personas  que proviene de diversos lugares del país. Es así que desde hace 20 años, siendo muy joven e inexperta, ha realizado esta actividad y hasta el momento mantiene las mismas ganas y empeño para salir adelante y progresar. Sin embargo, considera que lo más difícil es tener que trasladar su mercadería desde el centro de la ciudad hasta el lugar donde vende, siendo muy pesada esta labor. Para el futuro, Luisa ansía comprar un puesto adicional para vender productos para el hogar y de esa manera incrementar sus ingresos y poder solventar los estudios de sus hijas.
Este es su catorceavo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, donde la puntualidad la ha diferenciado, ya que es considerada como una persona muy cumplida con sus pagos, es así que se ganó el respeto y cariño de todas sus compañeras de grupo. Luisa necesita la cantidad de tres mil soles para comprar mercadería en las fábricas de ropa, ya que la nueva temporada se avecina y pretende tener lo necesario para cubrir las expectativas de sus clientes.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a very industrious business woman who is engaged in managing a village store. For her second loan, she would like to obtain an amount of PHP6,000 as additional capital for the maintenance and development of her retail business. She wants to buy more stocks of products for her store. She hopes that with the continuous support of KIVA lenders, her business will be more competent and productive. The loan she is requesting will be very helpful to her business as well as to her family. 
	Gloria is 40 years old and has three children to Gibert, her loving husband who is a farmer. Their two younger children are still studying. She hopes that through her business she will be able to provide the educational needs of her children. She dreams of giving them better ways of living that’s why she is doing her best to be successful in her business. Their family lives in the village of San Vicente, Quirino, Isabela.

loans.use: additional capital to buy more stocks of products

loans.name: Santos Francisco

texts.es: El señor Santos Francisco C. es originario del municipio de santa María Chichuimula del departamento de Totonicapán hace dos años contrajo matrimonio con la señora Magdalena Vicenta, actualmente con residencia  final zona uno del municipio de Totonicapán su principal actividad es la compra y ventas de animales domésticos su principal lugar de compra en San Francisco el Alto del municipio de Totonicapán, lugar de venta en San Cristóbal, y Totonicapán actualmente necesita de un crédito que le servirá para ampliar su capital y aprovechar la época de fin de año  donde las ventas incrementas y con las ganancias que obtiene le permitirá  mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Santos Francisco C. is originally from the town of Santa María Chichuimula in the department of Totonicapán. He and his wife of two years, Sra. Magdalena Vicenta, currently live in District #1 of the department of Totonicapán. His business involves buying and selling domesticated animals. Santos acquires his animals in San Francisco el Alto, a town in Totonicapán, and then sells them in San Cristóbal and Totonicapán.

He is currently requesting a loan to increase his capital so that he will be able to take advantage of the year-end season when his sales increase. Santos hopes that the earnings he generates will allow him to improve his standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his operating capital to buy more animals

loans.name: Carlos José

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, el señor Carlos E. se dedica a laborar como guarda de seguridad y vigilancia en un mercado de la capital y se esfuerza grandemente porque quiere reconstruir su vivienda que por mucho tiempo ha estado en malas condiciones y desea brindarle a su familia muy buenas condiciones en la vivienda. 

Port al motivo espera en que su crédito le sea otorgado y así adquirir a lo inmediato los materiales de construcción e iniciar esta obra hasta culminarla y sentirse satisfecho por el logro alcanzado para su hogar.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Carlos E. makes a living as a security guard at a market in the capital and works extremely hard because he wants to rebuild his home, which over time has fallen into bad condition. He wishes to provide his family with better living conditions at home. It's for this reason he hopes his loan is approved, so he can immediately acquire construction materials and carry out the work from start to finish, and he can feel satisfied with this accomplishment.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Rafael Humberto

texts.es: Rafael Humberto S. Martínez, tiene 33 años de edad, y cuenta con una familia integrada por Karen, Raquel y Kevin de 10, 11 y 16 años de edad respectivamente, actualmente ellos se encuentran estudiando, mientras su esposa, la señora Arely es empleada y aporta económicamente al sostenimiento de su familia.- Rafael se mantiene muy ocupado entre el cuido de sus hijos en el hogar y la fabricación de pan francés en su misma casa, mismo que comercializa con vecinos de la zona y en un parque muy populoso del lugar, en donde todas las tardes lo esperan para comprarle.- Ahora Rafael está solicitando un nuevo crédito para poder comprar mas materia prima para pan y poder cubrir la demanda navideña que se acerca.-
texts.en:
Rafael Humberto S. Martínez is 33 years old and has a family with three children, Karen, Raquel and Kevin of ages 10, 11 and 16 respectively. The children go to school while his wife, Mrs. Arely, is employed and contributes economically to support their family. Rafael stays very busy taking care of the children at home and baking bread in his own house. He sells the bread to his neighbors and at a busy park in the area, where his customers wait every afternoon to buy his bread. Rafael is soliciting a new loan to buy more raw materials to bake bread and be ready to supply the upcoming demand for Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy raw material

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Diogene

texts.en:
Diogene is 42 years old and is married with five children between 3 and 12 years old. Diogene lives in the Kicukiro, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.  Here, Diogene owns a small kiosk selling a variety of drinks including milk and soda. This is his tenth successful year in business! He employs two people from his community and the hours of his business require that he works from 6 a.m. until late in the evening every day except Sunday.

Diogene is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. These funds will be used to purchase a wider variety of drinks and supplies for sale. Through this expansion, he hopes to attract more customers and sell more products.  As his sales increase, Diogene hopes that his life will change progressively as he will be able to make a bit more money through his efforts. This will allow him to reinvest a portion of profits in his business, continue to pay school fees for his children and set aside some savings for their future.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks and supplies

loans.name: Farid

texts.en: Farid is single. He was born in 1986. Farid A. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli region, now settled in Baku city. He has had a parquet sales business for 3 years. At this moment he sells only parquet and now he would like to buy other goods also and that is why he is applying  for this loan of 2000 AZN.

loans.use: to buy goods for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Unidas, son personas responsables, honestas y luchadoras con muchas ganas de salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida. 
a continuacion se detalla cada una de las actividades que ellas realizan:
Lourdes: Es la lider del grupo, cuenta con un bonito negocio de Taller de Costura, hace tres años que tiene su negocio, vive en la Colonia Flor del Campo, cuenta con clientes fijos que le recomiendan a otros, tambien participa en ferias y con esto promociona su negocio, los clientes observan la calidad con que confecciona las prendas, entre ellas son: vestidos para quinceañeras, bodas, vestidos y trajes formales de trabajo entre otros, los fines de semana se dedica a la Elaboracion y venta de Sopa de Mondogo y Res. Lourdes es una mujer muy trabajadora y carismatica, necesita el credito para la compra de una Maquina sorgeteadora y variedad de tela. 
Jessica: Se dedica a la Venta de accesorios para damas elaboradas de Plata, se dedica a esta actividades desde hace un año, cuenta con clientas fijas que le realizan pedidos mensuales, tiene  variedad para todos los gustos, como ser pulseras, aritos, cadenas, anillos, necesita que el credito para comprar mas mercaderia, no cuenta con el dinero necesario suficiente para comprar al por mayor. Su esposo es una persona muy luchadora y juntos sacan adelante su familia, esta muy contenta con este negocio ya que le permite estar al cuidado de sus hijos. 
Rosmery:  Se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva como ser jeans, camisas, cremas, desodorantes, lociones y otros, actividad que realiza desde hace tres años, vive en la Colonia Flor del Campo. Necesita el creedito para poder comprar variedad de ropa para niños, adultos, accesorios para damas entre otros, es una mujer soltera con muchas ganas de superarse y hacer crecer su negocio. Su sueño seria llegar a tener una tienda grande y muchos clientes y amigos.
texts.en:
The group "Mujeres Unidas" (Women United) is made up of responsible and honest people who are striving to get ahead and improve their quality of life. Their activities are detailed below: Lourdes is the group leader; she has had a sewing workshop for 3 years. She lives in the Flor del Campo neighborhood. She has regular customers who recommend her to others. She also participates in the local fairs and in this way she promotes her business. Her customers observe the quality in the garments she produces, including: dresses for quinceañeras (15th birthday galas), wedding dresses, and formal and business dresses and suits. On the weekends she makes the garments and also sells beef soup. Lourdes is a very hardworking and charismatic woman. She needs a loan to buy a serger (a serger is a type of sewing machine that creates the kind of finished seam you see on ready made garments) and a variety of fabric. Jessica sells women's accessories made of silver. She has been carrying out this activity for a year; she has regular customers that put in monthly orders. She has a variety of products for all tastes, including bracelets, earrings, chains and rings. She needs a loan to purchase more merchandise, as she does not have enough money to buy at wholesale. She and her husband struggle to advance their family. She is very pleased with this business, as it allows her to care for her children. Rosmery sells a variety of products including new clothing such as jeans and shirts, creams, deodorants, lotions, and other items. She has been carrying out this activity for 3 years. She lives in the Colonia Flor del Campo neighborhood. She needs a loan to buy a variety of clothing for children and adults, and accessories for women. She is a single woman who has a strong desire to succeed and make her business grow. Her dream is to be able to have a big store with many customers and friends.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a serger (type of sewing machine), fabric, silver earrings, chains, and rings, jeans, shirts, creams, deoderants, perfumes, lotions, and dyes

loans.name: Wilder Antonio

texts.es: Don Wilder de 41 años de edad, es un padre de familia dedicado al trabajo, junto esposa trabajan para poder apoyar a sus dos hijos en la educación. Su negocio es una pulpería en donde vende una variada de productos del consumo diario.  Ante vendía verduras ambulantes pero todo su capital lo invirtió en la venta, ya que ahora esta tiempo completo vendiendo a sus clientes el y su esposa.
