Ha venido aumentando el inventario con financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado que para el es de mucho beneficio por que mejoran las ventas, como sus utilidades, con este préstamo comprara: arroz, frijoles, maíz, azúcar, golosinas, gaseosas, jugos, sardinas, pote de leche, pan, lácteos, verduras y frutas que es de gran necesidad de consumo. Su meta es poder ampliar la estructura en donde tiene la pulpería, pintar la casa pero no lo ha hecho por que todo sus préstamo lo invertido en su venta pero esta ahorrando lo cual espera hacer estas mejora. Para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilder, 41, is a father who is dedicated to his work. Together with his wife he works to support their two children and provide them an education. He has a small grocery store where he sells a variety of daily use items. He used to sell vegetables door-to-door but now he has invested all his capital in his store and he and his wife work full-time there. Afodenic financing has allowed him to gradually increase the variety of his stock inventory and this has resulted in higher earnings and profits. With this new loan he will buy rice, beans, corn, sugar, sweets, soft-drinks, juices, sardines, jars of milk, bread, dairy products, vegetables and fruits which are in high consumer demand. His goal is to be able to enlarge the structure where he has his store and to paint his house but he hasn't been able to do so so far because all of his loans he has invested in his sales. However, now he is saving up so that he can make these improvements for his family's well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en: Ola is a hard working woman and she is determined to excel in her business. She is a hair stylist and she makes lovely Nigerian and western hairstyles for her customers. She also sells hair extensions and hair cream in her salon. She hopes to own a world-class hair salon in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more hair materials to sell. She is married to a businessman who supports his home. She has two children. The youngest child is 4 years old. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair materials to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 36 años, vive al lado de su esposo y de sus hijos en la casa de sus padres.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de comida en una feria artesanal cercana a la zona donde vive. Su horario es de 8 de la mañana a 2 de la tarde y al anochecer vende anticuchos (brochetas de corazón de res). Gracias a su buena sazón y atención ha logrado hacerse de buenos y fieles clientes, los cuales la visitan día a día con el único fin de saciar el hambre con sus ricos platillos. Todo va bien en su negocio y cree poder mejorar, es por ello que quiere realizar algunos arreglos en su puesto para brindar un mejor servicio y así aumentar sus ventas.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, ella es parte del banco comunal “Cristo Morado” y todos sus compañeros son muy puntuales con los pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará ingredientes al por mayor (costales de arroz y alimentos no perecibles) para preparar sus platillos, además de bancas y algunos utensilios de cocina.
texts.en:
Elsa, 36, lives with her husband and childrfen in her parents' house. For the last 5 years she has sold prepared meals at a crafts market near the area where she lives. She works from 8am until 2pm. When night falls she sells anticuchos (skewered grilled beef heart). Thanks to her good seasoning and customer service she has acquired regular customers who visit day by day to satisfy their hunger with her delicious dishes. Everything is going well with her business and she believes it can improve still. For this reason, she wants to make some improvements on her food stand to provide better service and increase her sales. This is her fourth loan with MFP; she is a member of the "Cristo Morado" communal bank. All of her fellow members are very puntual with their repayments. She will use the funds requested now to buy ingredients at wholesale (sacks of rice and nonpersihable items) to prepare her meals as well as some benches and kitchen utensils.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operational capital.

loans.name: Faleala

texts.en:
Faleala I. is 38 and married with 6 children (ages 10 - 20).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Faleala has many years of experience in this business.  Faleala needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Faleala joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faleala's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic P. is from the village of Sawale, Fuentes, Iligan City. She is 43 years old, widowed, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marivic owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling beauty products and ready-to-wear items in the local community. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Marivic joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn M., from the town of Surallah, is 36 years old and married to Dominador. To make a living, Edelyn plants and harvests corn for sale and also tends a retail shop. Engaged in her businesess for over 10 years, she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month. In 2010, Edelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting her first loan of 6000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure, and plans to use any additional revenue generated to improve/expand her businesses and supplement family income.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social-performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Iragi Group

texts.fr:
Munyerekane B. est jeune manager,conseillère du groupe de crédit  Iragi, à l’ extrême, elle lève sa main sur la photo, âgée de 38 ans, célibataire, elle héberge 5 enfants dont elle est responsable c'est-à-dire sous sa tutelle. Parmi les quels 3 étudient et 2 autres sont encore gauss.  Munyerekane B. est entrepreneur d’un atelier de couture MAMA JAQUY (tailleuse modéliste). Son atelier est situé dans le quartier Himbi II, avenue W. no 77. Munyerekane B. a commencé cette activité avec 80$, un peu plus tard, elle fut informée de crédit de l’IMF Hekima où elle a bénéficié le crédit de base de 50$ pour renforcer son entreprise. 
Avec  le crédit  de  l’IMF Hekima, Munyerekane B. souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant 20 mètres de tissus, 6 paquets de fils à coudre, broderies, 30 mètres de vaselines, payer le loyer de l’atelier, etc.
 Le grand défi de Munyerekane B. est que l’activité de couture est saisonnière. La couture dépend plus des événements de festivité, de noël, de paquet, de nouvel an, des manifestations telle que la journée internationale de Femmes,les périodes de pointe de mariage, etc. les périodes comme les mois de Mai, juin, et juillet, sont des périodes de  crise pour la plupart des couturiers. Munyerekane B. compte diversifier ses activités par le commerce général des divers  et s’approvisionne dans le grand centre de Kampala-Ouganda. Dans le futur, elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle dans le Sud kivu, ville d’Uvira, ville frontalière de Bujumbura-Burundi.
Munyerekane B. remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits permanents qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grâce à ces crédits, elle parvient à  se prendre en charge, de se préserver aux tentations des hommes, de se protéger contre l'immoralité et la prostitution. En outre de subvenir aux enfants qui sont sous sa tutelle dit- elle.  
Ce groupe Iragi est  composé de 17 membres majoritairement femmes.
texts.en:
Munyerekane B. is the young manager/advisor of the Iragi credit loan group, with her hand raised in the picture. She is 38 years old, unmarried but sheltering five children who are under her care. Three of them attend school and two are not yet old enough. Munyerekane B. runs a tailoring workshop named “Mama Jaquy (tailor/designer)”. Her workshop is located in the Himbi II borough, on W. Avenue. She started her business with $80, and a little later was advised that she had been granted a basic loan of $50 by the Hekima MFI, to help start up her business. With the loan from the Hekima MFI, Munyerekane B. wants to increase her turnover by purchasing 20 meters of clothing fabric, six packs of thread, embroidery, 30 meters of poplin cloth, paying the rent for the workshop, etc. Munyerekane B. biggest challenge is the seasonal nature of the sewing or tailoring business, which is highly dependent on festivities such as Christmas, New Year or Easter, special events such as International Woman’s Day, or peak periods for weddings. May, June and July are crisis periods for most tailors and seamstresses. Munyerekane B. intends to diversify her activities through the retail commerce of general tailoring supplies, which she finds in Kampala, Uganda. In the future her ambition is to buy a plot of land in South Kivu, in Uvira, a town bordering Bujumbura in Burundi. She wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for the loans she has been granted without any collateral, because thanks to these she has been able to take charge of her life, avoid the temptations coming from men, and protect herself from immorality and prostitution. She adds that she is also able to meet the needs of children under hr care. The Iragi group consists of 17 people, for the most part women.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 20 meters of clothing fabric, six packs of thread, embroidery, 30 meters of poplin cloth, pay the rent for the workshop, etc.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Al visitar este banco comunal Mateo Pumacahua conversamos con el socio Adolfo, tiene 24 años,  es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chinchero del Departamento del Cusco y estudia guía de turismo en el instituto superior Americana del Cusco, él se dedica a la elaboración en el taller “Niway Away” y a la venta de tejidos  como mantas, fajas y chullos y vende a los turistas que visitan la ciudad, invierte 500 de dólares en la mercadería que compra  materiales de lana de alpaca y maquinas de tejer. Ya son dos años que lleva este oficio, el ser socio de la Fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito surtirá su negocio y va comprar más mercadería. El anhelo del  socio es tener su propio taller de artesanía.
texts.en:
When we visited the Mateo Pumacahua Communal Bank, we spoke with a member named Adolfo. He is 24 years old, single, and lives in the city of Chinchero in the department of Cusco. He is studying to become a tour guide at the Instituto Superior Americana del Cusco, and he works making and selling woven goods such as shawls, belts, and chullos [typical Andean wool caps]. He makes these at a craft studio called “Niway Away” and sells them to tourists who visit the city. Adolfo is investing 500 dollars in the materials he uses, such as alpaca wool and looms. He's been doing this work for two years, and working with the Kiva field partner has allowed him to get ahead and helped his business grow. With the new loan he will expand to sell more items and will buy more materials to work with. It is his hope to one day have his own studio in which to make his crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials such as alpaca wool and looms

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo S., from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, is 75 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Alfredo owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in his business for over 10 years, he earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Alfredo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 15000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, he is requesting a new loan, his seventh, of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Alfredo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Bilquis Bibi

texts.en:
Bilquis bibi lives in the city of Lahore which is famous for its history and Punjabi food. She is a working woman who sews clothes for her neighborhood clients and earns a reasonable amount every month. Her husband is a fruit vendor; he purchases fruit from the fruit market and sells it in different areas of the community. He has been doing this work for the last 30 years. Bilquis has four children, all of whom are getting an education. She and her husband work full-time to afford their children’s education.

Bilquis has applied for her second loan from Asasah to financially support her husband who wants to buy seasonal fruits for selling. With the loan assistance, she is hopeful that her husband will be able to do well in his business and that his income will be increased.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal fruits for reselling

loans.name: Lady Brigette

texts.en: Lady Brigette B. is from the village of Brgy. Nagcuartelan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 28 years old. Lady Brigette is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lady Brigette runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Lady Brigette has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Lady Brigette joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lady Brigette is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Lady Brigette from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: Adrian, de 38 años de edad, es padre soltero y tiene 3 hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva cusqueña, específicamente en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina, donde tiene su propio techo a base de adobe. Desde su adolescencia tenia ese sueño de estudiar la carrera de ingeniería civil, pero por cosas del destino no pudo cumplir su sueño, debido a la economía precaria que existía en su familia, no obstante siguió con su rutina diaria, trabajando en la chacra de sus  padres. Después de un largo tiempo Adrian, retomó sus propias decisiones para incursionar en un nuevo proyecto, específicamente cultivando y comercializando producto de cacao, desde luego que a inicios le fue difícil, pero con el tiempo logró posicionarse. En la actualidad su producto lo vende a otras localidades, por lo que recibe buenos resultados económicos. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia y en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, pero en temporada de cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones que le ayudan a facilitar la extracción de su producto final, en el que luego son vendidos en los centros de acopio de su comunidad. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está contento con su grupo comunal, debido a que todos son puntuales en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono, con al finalidad de que le dé un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Adrian, 38, is a single father; he has three school age children. They all live together in the beautiful Cusco backcountry, specifically in Villa Quintiarina, where he owns his own adobe dwelling. When he was an adolescent he wanted to study Civil Engineering but destiny prevented him from doing so due to his family’s precarious financial situation. Notwithstanding, he continued with his daily routine working his parents’ farmlands. After a long time, Adrian retook control of his own decisions and entered into a new project, specifically farming cacao beans. Of course, it was difficult at first but in time he managed to stabilize. Now he sells his product in other locations thereby obtaining good economic results. Usually he works alone and sometimes gets help from his children. During harvest, however, he employs two laborers that help him reap his final product that’s later sold to his community’s crop gathering center. This is his 5th loan with MFP and he pledges to continue to repay in a timely manner. He is happy with his communal group because all of the members are punctual with their repayments. He will use the requested funds to buy supplies and manure aimed at giving his crops proper care and maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Livinston Jahir

texts.es:
Livinston Jahir M. J., tiene 22 años.  Es soltero vive con los padres,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene hijos.

Livinston es un socio de la ventanilla rural “San Jose de los Amarillos”, que está ubicada en el Recinto de los Amarillos a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Livinston  se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz, cacao y fréjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz, cacao y fréjol Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener un terreno propio para construir una casa. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas y enfermedades como la langosta en el cogollo.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Livinston Jahir M. Jimenez is 22 years old. He is single and he lives with his parents. They live in the city of Ventanas, of the province of Los Rios. He has no children. Livinston is a member of the rural village of San Jose de los Amarillos. It is located in the Recinto de los Amarillos region, 90 minutes from the city of Ventanas. There are 23 members in her group and the majority of them are agriculturists. This is the second loan they request through the San Jose Cooperative (Kiva Field Partner). Livinston is an agriculturist, sowing corn, cocoa and beans. He makes his purchases and sales every month in the city of Ventanas. He request a loan to invest in the purchase of corn, cocoa, and bean seeds. He sees this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. His dreams are to have a plot of land where to build his own home. The challenges he faces are blights and langosta infestations in his fields. He enjoys playing sports.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, cocoa and bean seeds.

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem R., 46, is widowed and lives with her only child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated city in the country. R. is a housewife while her daughter is employed in a local garment factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses.

R. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase rice to stock and sell. By doing so, she is able to generate more income for her family. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

In the future, R. would like to use any additional profit to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rice to stock and sell

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Mrs. Nuon L. is a 47-year-old widow living in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 5.2-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her problem is that her field has poor soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Nuon L. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. With the rest of the loan she will hire farm laborers. She supports two children, one of whom is attending school, while the other is employed in a private company.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. sells sandals, slippers and shoes at Abura. Ama has received a junior high education. She is a widow taking care of three children. She responsibly sees to the well-being of her family from the sales she makes. Her loan will be used to buy more of her goods to sell. She anticipates reinvesting her profit back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more of her goods to sell

loans.name: Janbolat

texts.en:
Janbolat H. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two young children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home, in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of western Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and stays at home with their children. 

Janbolat operates a transportation business. He started his business in 2004 with his own big truck. He transports people's loads between Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city, and Tashkeshtan, China's border city. Janbolat has also begun to supplement his transportation service earnings by transporting and selling coal in the local community. He purchases one ton of coal for 35000 MNT from the countryside, transports it 150 km and and sells it at the local market for 50000 MNT. His large Russian truck consumes a lot of petrol, which is very costly. Because of that, his transportation business has not reached a sustainable level yet. 

Janbolat is a very open-minded and hardworking man. He says, " I want to save enough money and build a big house for my family." He is requesting a 2000000 MNT loan to purchase six tires for his truck.

loans.use: To purchase tires for his truck

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios M. is from the village of Brgy. Maddiangat, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old. Remedios is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Remedios owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fruit and vegetables in the local community. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Remedios joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Remedios from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita A. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 60 years old. Conchita is widowed and has six adult children. To make a living, Conchita owns & operates a business making and selling baked goods like cinnamon bread in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Conchita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Conchita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 40-year-old mother of 11 children. She is a skilled seamstress who began selling children's clothes and making a living for herself and her family. Since Sahar opened her store a year and a half ago she has sold children's clothes and gained a strong clientele.

With the loan, Sahar will expand to women's clothing as well. There is a high demand with the holidays and this stock could ensure important income. One day Sahar wants to expand into men's clothing and become one-stop shopping for the entire family. In the future she wants to branch out into other items such as shoes and accessories. Sahar is developing a steady income with her business and has gained the respect and support of her husband and family.

loans.use: To expand her stock to include women's apparel

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
La señora Jessica vive en casa propia con su mama y sus dos hijos en la zona de San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz; es madre soltera, trabaja en una empresa como secretaria donde percibe sus ingresos para mantener a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para pagar las pensiones de su hijo mayor que tiene 8 años de edad y esta en tercero básico, para poder inscribirlo al siguiente curso para el próximo año.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Impro, pero por el carácter social califica para obtener el mismo.
texts.en:
Sra. Jessica lives with her mother and two children in a house that they own in the San Pedro neighborhood of La Paz.  Jessica is a single mother.  She works as a secretary and her income supports the family.

Jessica is applying for a loan to pay the school fees for her older child for the coming year.  He is 8 years old and will be starting third grade in the fall.

This is Jessica's first Impro loan.  The purpose of the loan serves the social objectives of our institution.

loans.use: Pay school fees.

loans.name: Odongerel

texts.en:
Odongerel is 42 years old and lives alone in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives in a brick house, in the outer ger housing districts of the city. Odongerel’s two sons live apart from her, but she still supports them. Odongerel believes that if her sons live on their own, they will gain valuable life skills. 

In 1996, Odongerel began purchasing Mongolian dairy food products from local herders and reselling them to customers. In 2008, she sold her dairy food equipment in order to purchase a metal container at Narantuul market. In 2009, she began working together with her oldest son to operate a clothing accessories retail business from an outdoor stall and the metal container she owns at Narantuul. 

Currently, she doesn't own the outdoor stall's rental contract. She's renting from a middleman and not directly from the Narantuul market. It's her goal to have 2 million MNT of working capital in order to purchase the rental contract from the current owner. Her working capital was 500,000 MNT last year and has now reached 1 million MNT. 

With this loan of 1,500,000 MNT, Odongerel will purchase clothing accessories like socks, hats, gloves, and slippers from Ereen City, China. Odongerel hopes to resell these accessories at her stall before the Mongolian Lunar New Year in February. At this time of year, it is the custom to give small gifts to family members and friends. She expects her sales to be very high at this time.

loans.use: To purchase small clothing accessories for traditional Mongolian Lunar New Year

loans.name: Eden's Group

texts.en:
Eden E. is from the village of Nagrumbuan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 56 years old. Eden is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Eden is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Eden owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Eden has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eden joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eden has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Eden is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Eden from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of BB drinks

loans.name: Dioselina

texts.es: Dioselina, es una valerosa madre soltera de 39 años, trabaja y vive para sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos, a los que cría en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de La Merced (selva central peruana). Hace 6 meses que comenzó un negocio de venta de accesorios para dormitorio como: sábanas, toallas, cubrecamas, y demás prendas que son confeccionadas por ella misma, gracias a la máquina de coser que tiene. Con su práctica constante, y sus buenos diseños adquirió muy pronto clientes, los que la buscan para comprar sus costuras, por ello más adelante desea abrir un taller, equipado, con una razón social para poder ser conocida, y obtener mejores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Optimistas”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde está segura, podrá concretizar sus objetivos. Dioselina, para comenzar con mucho éxito su taller, comprará con crédito telas de diversos colores y texturas, con ello comenzará con la confección de prendas para dormitorio.
texts.en: Dioselina is a brave, 39-year old single mother.  She works and lives to get her three children ahead in life, raising them in a house that she owns located in the city of La Merced in the central Peruvian jungle.  Six months ago, she started a business selling bedroom accessories like sheets, towels, bedspreads and other items that she makes herself thanks to the sewing machine she has.  With her constant practice and good designs, she acquired customers quickly who seek her out to buy her items.  This is why she wants to open a workshop in the future and be well-known and earn more.  She belongs to Las Optimistas Communal Bank and this is her first loan with MFP, where she is sure that she will be able to meet her goals.  To open her workshop successfully, Dioselina will use the loan to purchase fabrics of different colors and textures to begin making bedroom items.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for making sheets and towels

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina I.- I. is from the city of Calabayan Ozamiz City. She is 41 years old. Gina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Gina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Gina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 25-year-old member of Royal Success group in Faulu Kenya.  She runs a salon so as to earn her daily bread.  Additionally, she earns extra income from farming.  She is a married lady with three children who are in school.  She works hard in her business so as to help her husband in educating her children.  She hopes to expand her business in the future so as to serve more customers.  She has requested for 30,000 Kes to buy hair blow drier, mirror and to renovate her business premise.

loans.use: To buy a hair blow dryer, mirror, iron sheet and to renovate her business premise

loans.name: Yessica Noely

texts.es:
Yessica tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente y vive junto a su familia en el Centro Poblado llamado La Matanza, en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado a 2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco, atendiendo a la Campiña de Laynas y anexos.  Además Yéssica vende abarrotes a sus vecinos de la zona, quienes acuden a comprarle por el buen servicio que brinda y por la calidad de sus productos.  Con los ingresos que obtiene apoya al sustento económico de su familia.

Yéssica desea adquirir más mercadería (abarrotes), para venderla y así obtener mayores ingresos.  Para lograr su objetivo ha creido conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Yéssica is 24 years old.  She lives with her partner in La Matanza, in Olmos district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque department.

Yéssica's business is selling fresh fish.  She serves customers in Campiña de Laynas and surrounding villages.  Yéssica also sells groceries to her neighbors.  They come to buy from her because of the good customer service which she offers and the quality of her products.  She uses the income that she makes to help support her family financially.

Yéssica would like to acquire more merchandise (groceries) to sell and thereby make more income.  In order to achieve her goal, she has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles.

loans.use: to acquire more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Yolenny Nebel

texts.es:
Yolenny de 46 años, es una mujer trabajadora que empezó su actividad hace 12 años atrás, decidió entrar en la venta de comida y esto lo realiza en si domicilio. Está casada y tienen 5 hijos adultos. 

Ella trabaja sola desde las 6H00 am hasta las 14H00 pm. Realizar desayunos y almuerzos. Su esposo trabaja como albañil. Con el préstamo desea invertir en pescados arroz mesas y sillas. En un futuro desea construir segundo piso en  su casa y poner más bonito su negocio.
texts.en:
Yolenny, age 46, is married and has five grown children. She is a hardworking woman that started her food preparation business twelve years ago; she runs the business from her home. 

Yolenny works alone from 6am until 2pm preparing breakfast and lunch. Her husband is a construction worker. She plans to use this loan to purchase fish, rice, tables, and chairs. In the future, she hopes to add a second floor to her house and to better outfit her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, rice, tables, and chairs

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO D. YANAHURA 5TO PARADERO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Anacleta; ella tiene 40 años D. edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. chicha (bebida a base D. maíz) y también venD. jora que es producto que se usa para hacer la chicha, ella venD. en forma independiente en su casa desD. las 10:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio D. este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor para preparar la chicha.                                    

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Anacleta belongs to the “San Isidro D. Yanahura 5th Paradero” Communal bank, located in the district and province of Urubamba, in Cusco department.

Anacleta is 40 years old, lives with her partner, and has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities between selling 'chicha' (a native 'beer' maD. from corn) and selling  'jora' (the special corn used in making chicha). She sells independently from her house, from 10:00 am until 6:00 pm.  In this manner, Anacleta is advancing her children.

Anacleta wants to expand and improve her chicha-selling business. She is requesting a loan to buy jora at wholesale for preparing chicha.

Anacleta is happy about the loan and committed to complying with the scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy a special corn at wholesale for preparing chicha.

loans.name: Boss

texts.en:
Boss, a 35-year-old married father of four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda, has been in the brick-making business for three years. He started the business with 200,000 shillings and now has 3,000,000 shillings as working capital. His main challenge is insufficient firewood.

Boss is requesting the loan to make more bricks to sell, and his goals are to earn a contract to supply bricks to major construction projects in the district and to educate his family.

loans.use: to make bricks for sale.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.es: Sergia, de 28 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su propia casa  junto a su pareja Daniel de 35 años y sus 02 queridos hijos, Kiara de 06 años y Edson de 06 meses de nacido a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho ahínco Sergia ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva cacao, café y palillo, productos que tiene mucha demanda y que son llevados a vender en los centros de acopio situado en la ciudad de San Francisco, donde percibe ganancias considerables. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse y poder cubrir los gastos educativos de su querido hijo; es por ello que pone todas sus ganas en que sean productivas sus tierras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus plantas de la plaga de insectos, ya que se siente muy feliz haciéndolo. Lleva 08 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta su comunidad que es un recorrido de 01 hora de caminata, pero sabe que todo esfuerzo tiene su recompensa. Ahora lo que mayor prioridad tiene es comprar estiércol de animales para fertilizar sus sembríos, así asegura una buena cosecha. Por tal razón pide el apoyo de todos ustedes para que pueda concretar sus planes. Espera en un futuro comprar tierras para incrementar  su producción. Este será su noveno crédito con MFP, y manifiesta que ha sido muy puntual en los pagos de sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa. Con el crédito  comprar estiércol de animales para fertilizar sus tierras y sacar buen provecho de los frutos posteriormente.
texts.en:
Sergia, age 28, is a hardworking woman.  She lives in her own home with her partner Daniel, age 35, and their two beloved children, Kiara (age 6) and Edson (age 6 months), for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.  Sergia works diligently on her land so that it will yield productive returns.  She grows cacao, coffee, and turmeric.  These products are in great demand.  She takes her harvest to the collection centers located in the city of San Francisco, where she is able to generate considerable earnings.  Her crops provide her with the necessary income to support her family and pay for her child’s educational expenses.  For this reason, Sergia does all she can to make her land productive.  What she enjoys most about her work is protecting her crops against plagues of insects, and she is willing to do whatever it takes.  Sergia has been farming for eight years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products from the field to her community.  This journey requires one hour of walking, but she knows that she will be rewarded for all of her efforts.  Now her greatest priority is to buy animal manure for fertilizing her crops, which will ensure a good harvest.  For this reason, she asks for all the help she can get so that she can follow through with her plans.  In the future, she hopes to buy more land so that she can increase production.

This will be her ninth loan with MFP.  Sergia says that she repaid her previous loans on time and hopes to do the same now.  She is an active participant in her Communal Bank.  With this loan, she will buy animal manure for fertilizing her land.  She hopes to earn a good profit from the fruits that will eventually be harvested.

loans.use: to purchase animal manure for fertilizing her land.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: Marcelino, de 30 años es un joven alegre y trabajador vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Esther de 29 años de edad y sus 02 queridos hijos a quienes desea otorgarle una buena educación. Marcelino, cuenta con muchos proyectos en mente para salir de la pobreza que aqueja su hogar, él es agricultor y cultiva diversidad de plantas nativas en su parcela como: cacao, café, achiote y palillo, productos que le brindan una buena sostenibilidad económica para mejorar su condición de vida. Viene trabajando 10 años en esta actividad y en sus días libres aprovecha para trabajar de jornalero en tierras ajenas, para así obtener mayores ingresos y cubrir los gastos de educación de sus menores hijos. Marcelino necesita el apoyo de la entidad financiera para mejorar las fachadas de su vivienda y por ello acude a los préstamos que la institución MFP facilita a las personas mas necesitadas con miras a progresar e invertir su dinero en beneficios de si mismos. Marcelino relata que necesita mejorar su casa con calaminas nuevas, listones y vigas que le duren por un buen tiempo para así otorgarles un buen techo a sus seres queridos. Para el bien de su porvenir espera trabajar con mayor ímpetu en sus tierras y comprar posteriormente más tierras. Este será su primer crédito con MFP y por lo cual necesita el apoyo para concretar sus planes a la vez se compromete en pagar muy puntualmente sus cronogramas de pago. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles que solicita, refaccionará  su morada y  comprará  calaminas, listones y clavos para mejorar el techo de su casa.
texts.en:
Marcelino is 30 years old.  He is a cheerful and hard-working young man who lives in his own home together with his partner, 29 year-old Esther, and his two beloved children who he would like to provide with a good education.

Marcelino has many projects in mind through which he hopes to remove himself from the poverty which plagues his household.  Marcelino is a farmer who grows a variety of native plants on his plot of land including cacao, coffee, annatto and turmeric.  These products provide him with a good financial sustainability through which he can improve his living conditions.  Marcelino has been working in this business for 10 years and he takes advantage of his free days to work as a day laborer on other people's land.  In this way, he makes more income and covers the educational expenses of his young children.

Marcelino needs the help of our financial institution to improve the outside of his home.  For this reason, he is requesting one of the loans that MFP provides to people who need to make progress and invest their money in benefiting their own homes.  Marcelino tells us that he needs to improve his home with sheets of corrugated metal, planks and beams which will last for a long period of time and will provide a good home for his beloved family.

For the good of his future, Marcelino hopes to work with more energy on his land and to buy more land in the future.  This will be his first loan from MFP and he needs this support to carry out his plans.  For his part, he pledges to make his repayments according to schedule.  Marcelino will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to refurbish his home and buy corrugated metal sheets, planks, beams and nails to improve the roof of his house.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheets, beams and nails to improve his roof

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is now 42 years old and still single. He is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 8,000 per month. 

Arthur is asking for a loan of PHP 23,000 to purchase the needed fertilizers and pesticides for his farm. He grows rice and has been in rice production for almost 10 years.

In the future, Arthur hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to earn more income to save for the future. He is so thankful with the Kiva lenders who offer financial assistance for him to increase his crop yields. He hopes that Kiva lenders will continue to assess him so he can continuously yield a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to purchase the needed fertilizers and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 37 years old. She is a hard working business woman who is married and blessed with five children, one of whom is married while the others are in school. She has been meeting the needs of her family for the last seven years by tailoring. Previously, she used to sell groceries. In the next five years, she wants to have opened up another shop.

She had previously taken a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings that she has fully paid. She is now requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en: Chona is a married woman living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has two school-aged children. She has been engaged in a service-based transportation activity lately to earn an additional means of living. Chona has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 at GDMPC to purchase motorbike spare parts and repair costs to maintain it in good running condition. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She hopes to repair her house in the future and earn more income for the new business undertaking.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and pay for repair costs .

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es: Hace 10 años Lorena  decidió vender su vehículo y empezar su negocio de venta de mercaderías por catalogo Avon y Yanbal, luego de ser empleada en una empresa. Todos los días ella se levanta a las 6 am atiende a su esposo a sus hijos a quienes los envía a la escuela, y comienza a caminar recorriendo su sector para vender sus productos. Se preocupa mucho de cuidarse ya que la zona es muy insegura y además porque ya ha sido asaltada en varias ocasiones. Le satisface poder ayudar a su esposo con los ingresos del hogar y así contribuye con la educación de sus tres hijos de 16,10 y 8 años. Para establecer un bazar en su casa ella quiere un préstamo con el cual podrá comprar vitrinas, ropa y bisutería. Además quiere terminar de construir su casa, vivir mejor y que su hijos culminen los estudios con éxitos.
texts.en:
Ten years ago, Lorena decided to sell her vehicle and start a business selling merchandise through Avon and Yanbal catalogs. She later was hired as an employee for a company. Every day she wakes up at 6am to tend to her husband and to her children before sending them to school. After that, she travels around the area to sell her products. Lorena is worried about protecting herself because the area is unsafe and she has been robbed on several occasions. However, she is pleased to help her husband with the household income and contribute toward the education of her three children (ages 16, 10, and 8).

In order to establish a bazaar in her home, Lorena is requesting a loan to buy display cases, clothing, and trinkets. In addition, she wants to finish the construction of her house, live better, and help her children finish their studies successfully.

loans.use: to buy display cases, clothing, trinkets, and perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a tiller drill and a bench grinder.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Lorna is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Jannat's Group

texts.en:
Jannat is the treasurer of this group. She is 56 and together with her husband, who is a retiree, she has raised a daughter. The daughter is twenty. She studies in the Police Academy and she is married. 

Jannat works as a librarian, and at the same time she is a teacher of history at a school. The family is engaged in livestock breeding. They started this activity about 20 years ago, so they have a big experience in this sphere. At the moment they keep two cows and six sheep. In case they need money to meet the family needs, they can sell some livestock. With money received from the loan Jannat wants to purchase five sheep in order to expand the number of livestock. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase five sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the purchase of merchandise and to cover the initial rental expenses of her store space.

loans.name: Dany

texts.en:
Dany, 39 years old, is a house wife. Her husband is a chief construction worker and earns $10 per day. They have five children, three are studying and two are too young to go to school. Every month, she has to spend $75 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $15 on transportation. 

She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work. Before, she used to do construction with her husband, but she quit because she has babies and her husband wants her to stay home take care the children. She wants to buy more construction equipment and material for her husbands work so that he can provide better service to the customers.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband traveling to work

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for more tools to repair furniture

loans.name: Santos Maria

texts.es: Santos  con su credikiva compró materias primas e insumos para su negocio; En la actualidad está aplicando a su segundo financiamiento y requiere comprará materias primas e insumos,  para fabricar ropa encargada, y  responder especialmente  a la demanda de un colegio muy cercano a su negocio y con el cual ganará dinero si responde oportunamente. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias por todo y deseo mucha bendiciones.”
texts.en:
Santos bought materials and supplies for her business with her Kiva loan.  Currently she's applying for a second loan.  She needs to buy clothing specially commissioned to respond to the request of a school very close to her business, and with which she will earn money if she responds appropriately.

Her message to the Kiva lenders is this: "Thank you very much for everything. I wish you many blessings."

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies to make athletic clothing.

loans.name: Maguatte

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée , mère de  2 enfants.Elle s'active dans le commerce de vêtements et vend aussi occasionnellement des chaussures.Elle s'approvisionne dans la capitale et place ses produits auprès de ses clients qui paient au bout de deux ou trois mois.Elle parvient à avoir des revenus assez consistants pour se prendre en charge et s'occuper de ses enfants.Elle sollicite un prêt de 350000f pour acheter des tissus et des chaussures.Son ambition est d'acquérir une boutique au marché central et de fixer ainsi ses clients.
texts.en:
Maguatte is married and the mother of 2 children. She earns a living selling clothes and occasionally shoes. She buys her merchandise in the capital and provides her customers with products that they pay for after 2 or 3 months. She manages to generate an income stable enough to allow her to take care of her children's needs.

Maguatte is requesting a loan of 350 000 francs so that she can restock on fabrics and shoes. She would one day like to buy her own shop in which to serve her customers, in the central market.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 44-year-old married lady who established a small beauty salon at her house almost two years ago, so she can help her husband and her family financially.

Now Manal has applied for this loan to add another service which is selling cosmetics products so she can attract more customers and expand her business

loans.use: to add another service which is selling cosmetics products.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael is 29 years old. He is married to a housewife and has two children. When Rafael was young, he helped his father plow his rice field and transplant seedlings. Today he applies his extensive experience in farming on his own land. He wants to ensure a good harvest so he works hard in the field every day.

Because of insufficient funds, Rafael is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy five bags of urea (a fertilizer) and two liters of Karate (a pesticide) to help sustain his crops.

Rafael aims to save enough money to send his children to college someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 52 years old, married and has two children. She owns a motorbike which she uses for a transport business.  She also practices farming for more income generation.  She has retained the two business through her hard work and determination.  

Rose hopes to own a vehicle for her transport business instead of using a motorbike.  She has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.use: buy farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Toch

texts.en: Toch, 32, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over two years. Her husband has been a broom trader for over six years. He has extensive experience and is successful in his career. In order to improve her family living condition, Toch is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike to run a new business:  selling Khmer traditional medicine in other provinces. By doing so, she would be able to generate extra income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business of selling traditional medicine, build a new house and support her children to study to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to carry Khmer traditional medicine to sell in other provinces

loans.name: Rhonah

texts.en:
Rhonah lives in Uganda.  She is married with two children, both of whom are in school.  Rhonah also takes care of two of her sisters’ children.  She lives in a home that she owns with access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.   

Rhonah has a sells charcoal at the market, a business that she has been involved in for over ten years.  Rhonah works six days a week.  She generates additional income by renting rooms.  Her main business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  

Rhonah requested a 1,000,000 UGX loan from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more bags of charcoal.  Her business aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to build more rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell in the market.

loans.name: Murtiasa

texts.en:
Murtiasa just began working with Ruma on July 23, 2013 to run Ruma’s new business cashing in and cashing out customer’s money for Ruma’s bank partner. As a new agent with Ruma, Murtiasa needs and hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to start his new business. Murtiasa wishes this new business to be another source of income for his family.

Murtiasa lives in Angkas, Selemadeg Barat, Bali, a rural area about four hours from Denpasar. Murtiasa is married, has one child, and lives with three people in the family house.

Prior to joining Ruma, Murtiasa worked as a contract employee.

loans.use: to have start-up capital to process branchless banking transactions

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Battambant province’s Moung Russey district, Ret is now 46 years old and married. She has five children. Ret and her husband are rice farmers who have engaged in the business for 25 years. The current business earns them about 23,000KHR per day to support the family’s needs and afford to save about 10,000KHR each day. 
Ret is the first cycled client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 64-year-old energetic and a hardworking mother of six angelic-looking children. She is from the Kitale area of Kenya. Esther is very hardworking, and she always says, “My parents taught me to work hard from a very young age, and now I am independent.” 

Esther is very dedicated, and she does mixed farming and some small business to supplement her income. She makes sure that she gives the best to her six children so that they can be productive in the future and support themselves. Esther enjoys farming, especially milking and grazing her dairy cows. Esther has farmed for eight years, and is recognized as one of the best farmers in her village. Because of this, most villagers want products from her farm. This has increased her profits. 

Although she enjoys selling her products to the nearby market and to neighbors, her income is not sufficient to enable her to comfortably take care of her family. Therefore, she plans to start a poultry farm. Esther requests 30,000 KES to start a poultry farm to improve her income. The Kitale area is a populated area, and there is a market for eggs and poultry products, but the supply is low. Esther plans to take advantage of that and reap more profits. Esther has been trained by Juhudi Kilimo, and is financially disciplined. She believes that she will be able to repay the loan and open other business ventures. 

If you are a mother from Africa, getting your hands on financial services is difficult, but Esther is sure that through your kindness, she will be able to acquire the loan, help her family, and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy poultry
